story:
The Plan

To allow children in Malawi, Uganda, Sierra Leone, Haiti, and the Dominican Republic to attend summer camps where they will enjoy games, eat nutritious meals, learn Bible lessons, participate in skits, dance, sing, make crafts, play team sports, and simply enjoy being kids. Experiences like this allow children to develop confidence, make new friends, and learn things that will stay with them into adulthood.

All the children attending these camps have grown up in poverty in areas of the world where childhood is fraught with challenges. Many of them were orphaned or have lost at least one parent. Some have been affected by war, and others have seen the devastation of disease (such as Ebola in Sierra Leone). All the children have experienced the kinds of trauma that can rob childhood of its joy.

You can give that joy back!

You can help give a positive, uplifting experience to over 4,700 children (orphaned children from our Children’s Homes and children from the nearby villages who live in poverty). The more support we have, the more children we can send to camp.

Children at camp will experience:

  • Nutritious, well-balanced meals
  • Arts and crafts activities
  • Bible lessons
  • Games and team sports
  • Entertaining skits and/or puppet shows
  • Music, singing, and dancing

Depending on the area and the money raised, children may also experience:

  • Trips to local areas of interest (e.g., hikes, lake trips, etc.)
  • Opportunities to swim (and possibly learn to swim)
  • Small gifts (such as sunglasses, Bibles, hygiene items, or school supplies)

 

How You Can Help

  • $30 will provide one child with an unforgettable camp experience
  • $60 gives two children the experience of camp
  • $150 sends five children to camp
  • $300 is enough to send 10 children to camp
  • $600 sends 20 children to camp
  • $900 gives 30 children the gift of camp

Details

Camps range from 3 to 6 days. Each country holds two separate camps: one for younger children and one for teens.

  • In the Dominican Republic, we hope to take our teenagers on a weekend retreat this summer and to provide day camps for younger children.
  • In Haiti, we are planning a day camp where children will hear Bible stories, play games, and participate in fun arts and crafts.
  • In Malawi, we’d like to take older children on an overnight retreat and hold day camps for younger children.
  • In Sierra Leone, past camps have been so popular that we would like to reach out to hundreds more children who have never been to camp.
  • In Uganda, we plan to host a day camp during the school break in December (this fits more naturally into Ugandan calendars than a camp during the summer).

None of these plans are possible without your contribution. Thank you for giving generously to children in need!

Please also share our campaign with the hashtag #sharesummercamp on your favorite social media platforms.

 

Who We Are

Children of the Nations (COTN) is a nonprofit with a 22-year history of serving orphaned and destitute children in Africa and the Caribbean. Our mission is to raise children who transform nations. We provide holistic care (meeting physical, educational, social, and spiritual needs) that allows children to break the cycle of poverty and build better futures for themselves and their communities.

COTN connects children in need to sponsors through both our Children’s Homes and our Village Partnership Program. Our Children’s Homes take in, and become new families for, orphaned children. Our Village Partnership Program serves children whose families are unable to support them. Children who attend our summer camps are a mix of both sponsored children and children without sponsors who live in local villages. We want to bring this gift to as many children in need as possible.

You can learn more about COTN at cotni.org.

story:
EARTHSHIP VILLAGE COLORADO

(Prairie Sun Village)

My name is Sara and I am the land and project manager for Earthship Village Colorado. I have a background in working with the land, have multiple permaculture certifications and am active in my community creating healing businesses as well as educating my fellow citizens in the Pikes Peak Region on matters of sustainability. I have been a self employed business owner for 20 years, firstly owning an organic gardening company for 17 years and now own an organic herbal apothecary. I have a passion for creating truly sustainable, resilient and whole systems for the benefit of future generations.  

  • We are now on the ground floor for building a community of totally off grid homes. This will create a model of ways to divest from fossil fuels and build homes that use "trash" for construction, helping to keep materials like tires, bottles and cans and used doors and windows out of the land fill. These homes also have the ability to grow food, allowing the occupants to create food security.  These homes first became popular in Taos, New Mexico and we are working with the people there to gain knowledge and understanding of how to build these homes with the greatest integrity possible.
  • By contributing to this campaign, you will help us to facilitate a home that will have many functions for our community. It will act as a visitors center, model home, event center, education center, overnight rental, and a glimpse of what is possible in housing. We will generate money from this house to fund other projects on the 400 acres, such as heavy equipment purchase, tree planting, animal husbandry, intern programs, and the building of more homes. Because banks will not finance these homes, we hope to create a system that builds upon itself so that we can eventually finance these homes for people within the structure of the community.

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We are asking for $350,000. This will allow us to hire an experienced crew to help build as well as cover all costs for construction and permitting and outfit the house and greenhouse with furnishings and plants.
  • Our perks will allow for many to experience the uniqueness of an earthhship first hand. By staying in a fully functional off grid home, it will allow people to get excited about the possibilities of what can be done to shift into the age of clean and renewable energy!
  • If we do not reach our entire goal, we will use what funds we do raise to start the building process and continue to creatively finance the project.

The Impact

 

  • This is an incredibly valuable project in helping to blast out the value and do-ability of these types of homes. It allows us, as a society to begin the process of divesting from fossil fuels, create food security and value and reuse our water to achieve maximum usage for this delicate resource. It will also create resilient and whole systems housing for future generations facilitating the unfolding of true security. 
  • The impact of this project is deep. It will without a doubt foster a powerful community of people looking for better ways to live on Earth. It will firstly be an educational tool for all ages and walks of life. It will also create employment and intern opportunities. This will be a destination for visitors to the area. This is to be the first of many of these houses to be built. It will provide resilant housing for future generations.

Risks & Challenges

We do have our blueprint for the first house in place. They are designed to easily pass code and are stamped by architect Michael Reynolds, who is licensed in Colorado. The greatest challenge we foresee, aside from financing, is permitting within El Paso County. We are still technically within Colorado Springs city limits. There is one other home with similar design within our county, and we have been advised that it CAN be done, but we should expect some pushback.

  • We are persistent and passionate and will go to great lengths to shed light on the great value of rainwater and water conservation through catchment systems.
  • We will strongly advocate and educate the value of these homes as our region is experiencing a massive population boom.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute monetarily, we humbly ask for you to share this campaign with as many folks as possible! Many hands make light work!

  • There is a lot of growing enthusiasm surrounding these types of structures! Please help us to share the amazing and exciting benefits of off grid housing for these changing times.

Thank you for your consideration and time to read over our project! Looking forward to a bright future of clean, renewable and free energy! ~Sara, Chris, Dave and team

story:
The state of Jammu & Kashmir faces frequent turmoil and unrest making it very difficult for the students in the state to attain formal education. Violence, coupled with curfews and shutdowns, has repeatedly disrupted education in the state making it hard for the students of this region to compete with others in various examinations; thereby hampering their career and future. With CM’s Super 50 Program we aim to focus on improving this situation and helping students in getting a quality education.

Over the last one year, schools and colleges in Kashmir have remained shut for 6 out of every 10 working days, leading to near-loss of entire academic year. In 2016, schooling could be conducted only for a period of four months in Kashmir valley and the 10th and 12th class exams held in November covered only 50 per cent of the total curriculum. Students of classes 1st to 9th were given mass promotion*.

Destruction of infrastructure, fear of sending children to schools, incorporation of youth into armed groups, negative economic shocks to households and forced displacement are few of the factors that inhibit students to attain proper education.

Our Program is designed to provide support and academic guidance to bright students of the region through special classes that focus on entrance examination preparation. Despite the turmoil, we strongly believe that by giving determined students the tools and guidance to move forward, they can acquire their seats in the most prestigious institutions of the country.

50 students each for engineering and medical entrance exams (IIT-JEE/NEET and the likes) are selected through an entrance test for each of the 11 centers spread across 10 districts of Kashmir. These students are then coached in an intensive crash course from December to April/May by subject experts chosen from the existing set of government teachers in the state.

 

The entire program is based on the years of experience CHINAR International has from addressing the issues and problems in Kashmir and by using Avanti's robust curriculum and pedagogy that is successfully implemented across 11 states in the country.

Collected funds would be used for the below-mentioned activities:

1. TEACHER TRAINING & SUPPORT

Orientation and training sessions are conducted for all teachers supporting the program to equip them with pedagogical tools needed to run classrooms. In addition, mid-cycle refresher training is conducted to review the progress at each center and provide support to teachers as necessary. Moreover, academic and educational support is provided to all teachers on a regular basis to ensure a smooth functioning of the program. 

2. PROGRAM MANAGEMENT 

Avanti/CHINAR Program Managers ​coordinate the on-ground project implementation by conducting school visits, providing ongoing academic support and resolving any issues hampering the smooth functioning of the program.

3. CURRICULUM SUPPORT & ASSESSMENTS

  • ​​DIGITAL CONTENT SUPPORT: Teachers are provided with digital content (including class-wise lesson-plans, video lectures etc.) to prepare them for classroom sessions
  • WORKBOOKS:  In-class practice, as well as homework workbooks, are provided to students
  • REGULAR TESTS: Consistent tests based on the actual exam pattern are given to students in order to familiarize and acquaint them with the exam pattern

In addition, the Directorate of School Education Kashmir (DSEK) is providing support in printing the modules and workbooks.

A small donation of  INR 1,500 or just $25 will help fund one student - every dollar counts and will help us in moving a step closer to helping students realize their dream of getting into top colleges! In addition, you can choose to have some exclusive handcrafted items from Kashmir by selecting any of the perks mentioned on the page.

    CHINAR INTERNATIONAL

    Provides critical support to children from most vulnerable communities to enable them to attain quality education.

    Works in low-resource govt. schools in collaboration with DSE (Department of School Education) with the aim of school transformation for holistic development of children.

    Works with unemployed youth through skill development and entrepreneurship support to enhance their capacities to become self-reliant.

    AVANTI

    Avanti has a proven track record of success in its various programs. Every 1 out of 3 Avanti students cleared the JEE Mains in 2017 and secured a seat at the IITs and NITs (most prestigious institutions of the country) and 70% scored above the 80th percentile on the Boards.

    Kashmir News Zone, wrote about our work in their article 'CM’s Super 50 Coaching Classes Inaugurated In Ganderbal'

    Greater Kashmir, wrote about CHINAR's stellar work in their article 'Changing lives through quality education, entrepreneurial initiatives'

    Rising Kashmir, mentioned CHINAR in their report 'Chinar International holds annual day function'

    The Economic Times, a dominant national newspaper wrote about Avanti in their article 'Avanti Learning Centres raises Rs. 33 crore'

    The Hindu, a leading national newspaper wrote about Avanti in their article 'Two students crack IIT entrance exam'

    Indian Express, wrote about Avanti in their article 'Mentoring success'

    Hindustan Times, wrote about Avanti in their article ' Seven students from state in Top 100 of IIT exam merit list'

    Kashmir Reader, a leading newspaper wrote about CHINAR in their article '2016 uprising impacted education, students favour agitation'

     

    Below is the list of Awards that Avanti has received:

    1) Ashoka Fellowship - 2013

    2) Draper Richards Kaplan Fellowship - 2012

    3) Echoing Green Fellowship - 2012

    4) Winner of Stanford BASES Business Plan Competition - 2010

    5) PAN IIT Nation Building Initiative - 2010

    Below is the list of Awards that CHINAR has received:

    1) Selected among Top 30 entries in "EduDoc: Stories of Education"

    2) “Certificate of appreciation” for working towards quality improvement in schools. The event was organized by Directorate of School Education-Kashmir

    Can't contribute but still want to support us? Worry Not! Simply by sharing the campaign  through your social media accounts, you can help us a great deal! 

    When you help one child in Kashmir, you help a community of acceptance and encouragement to growth. Your charitable contribution will make it possible for us to run this program and provide free services to the students who really need your help. Join us in our movement and make the Kashmir students feel like the world has much more to give to them than just turmoil and violence & help provide them a future they never envisioned.

    We are an optimistic team of change makers who wish to transform lives of the students of Kashmir. 

    It was started by the Kashmiri diaspora in 2003 in USA and currently has office in Srinagar & Delhi in India and Virginia in USA. At present the organization is supporting around 1400 children in both Kashmir and Jammu regions of the state. In 2014, CHINAR adopted 5 government schools of the Kashmir region and now is in the process is upscaling to 50 schools. It has also helped around 128 families with livelihood support and around 116  youth in skill development and business incubation. In addition, when the floods of September 2014 hit the Valley, CHINAR International jumped into disaster relief activities as well helping over 90,000 people.

    Avanti is an award winning social enterprise established by IIT & Harvard University alumni in 2010 to provide an affordable, high-quality education to disadvantaged students aspiring to study at India’s top colleges. Today Avanti employs over 250 teachers, 300 staff-members and works with over 6,000 students in direct face-to-face teaching programs run by Avanti’s teachers. Avanti works with an additional 6,000 students and 250 teachers through its teacher training programs focused on integrating a blended learning curriculum into government schools.

story:
Who:  Flags of Freedom Foundation, Inc. is a non-profit 501(3)c.  All volunteer with no paid employees.  All funds raised go to support the Freedom Field Project.

What:  Freedom Field Project; an educational project teaching people of all ages, especially young adults and children, the history of our Flag and National Anthem.

Where:  Wapakoneta, Ohio near the Neil Armstrong Air and Space Museum along I-75, the main traveled corridor from Canada to Key West.

When:  As funds are raised we will secure the location and begin construction at the soonest possible date.

Why:  To cultivate in the largest possible number of our citizens an appreciation of both the responsibilities and the benefits which come to them because they are Americans, and are free.

Our founders created an America that became the most successful and prosperous nation on earth by building it on a strong foundation. This foundation was Faith, Family and Flag (Country). Faith in their creator, who gave them certain unalienable rights, including, but not limited to, life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness. The forging of a government whose only purposes were to establish justice, ensure domestic tranquility, provide for the common defense, promote the general welfare, and secure the blessings of liberty to all — nothing more and nothing less. That is how the founders of America intended it to be. And for good reason — it worked. This is the America we seek to honor.

There have been some shameful issues and periods in our history, some of which still linger on today. The treatment of Native Americans, African Americans and other minorities; slavery, and unequal rights. America is a great nation, where great people, against all odds and opposition, can and do make great strides in righting these wrongs. People like Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., Susan B. Anthony, and Abraham Lincoln, to name a few. These people make up the America we seek to honor.

In many countries, government plays “nanny” to every citizen from cradle to grave. Americans stand on their own two feet, attend their churches, support their families, and turn to them in time of need. They do not look to government to solve all of their problems. Americans take responsibility for themselves and their communities. They do not claim to be victims of some unfortunate part of their lives, which in some way should relieve them from all responsibility for their actions. This is the America we seek to honor.

AMERICA tries to free its citizens, business and industry from excessive regulation, privatizes many government services, and transfers much of the authority and responsibility for social welfare and education to its churches, families and communities where they belong. This is the America we seek to honor.

Many great things have been done to educate the next generation of leaders. Americans know that government can’t solve all issues relating to business, education, health care, the environment and an array of other matters needing little, if any, federal intervention or regulation. History has shown that great people solve great problems, not governments. This is the America we seek to honor.

"The Freedom Field Project will reach out to educate people of all ages; for it is education that has the power to mold one’s mind - not laws and regulations." (Fred W. Harris)

Freedom Field Project

Sponsorships:  We have a variety of Individual, Company and Corporate Sponsorships available for the Main Memorial (5), State and Colonial Flags (65), and other components of the project.  The Naming Rights sponsorship (1) is also available.  Please contact the Foundation to discuss any of these options.

Scale Model:  All project photos are of our 3' x 4' scale model which was constructed by Mr. Larry McLean of Wapakoneta, Ohio.  The model is to exact scale and took Larry more than 700 hours to create.

Project Video:  The video contained herein was produced by Mr. Dan Wilson of Wilson 1 Communications in Wapakoneta, Ohio.

America The Beautiful Video:  This video was published on YouTube by subscriber Silver1Sprg. I have not found this person but want to give them credit.

Thank you - Donate Today if you can!

Flags of Freedom Foundation Inc. is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization.

Federal Tax ID # - 34-1661450

Public Charity Status - 509 (a) (2)

Effective Date of Exemption - July 10, 2017

Contributions are tax deductible - If you require further information, please feel free to contact us at dpc@bright.net
story_txt:
Who:  Flags of Freedom Foundation, Inc. is a non-profit 501(3)c.  All volunteer with no paid employees.  All funds raised go to support the Freedom Field Project.
What:  Freedom Field Project; an educational project teaching people of all ages, especially young adults and children, the history of our Flag and National Anthem.
Where:  Wapakoneta, Ohio near the Neil Armstrong Air and Space Museum along I-75, the main traveled corridor from Canada to Key West.
When:  As funds are raised we will secure the location and begin construction at the soonest possible date.
Why:  To cultivate in the largest possible number of our citizens an appreciation of both the responsibilities and the benefits which come to them because they are Americans, and are free.

Our founders created an America that became the most successful and prosperous nation on earth by building it on a strong foundation. This foundation was Faith, Family and Flag (Country). Faith in their creator, who gave them certain unalienable rights, including, but not limited to, life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness. The forging of a government whose only purposes were to establish justice, ensure domestic tranquility, provide for the common defense, promote the general welfare, and secure the blessings of liberty to all — nothing more and nothing less. That is how the founders of America intended it to be. And for good reason — it worked. This is the America we seek to honor.
There have been some shameful issues and periods in our history, some of which still linger on today. The treatment of Native Americans, African Americans and other minorities; slavery, and unequal rights. America is a great nation, where great people, against all odds and opposition, can and do make great strides in righting these wrongs. People like Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., Susan B. Anthony, and Abraham Lincoln, to name a few. These people make up the America we seek to honor.
In many countries, government plays “nanny” to every citizen from cradle to grave. Americans stand on their own two feet, attend their churches, support their families, and turn to them in time of need. They do not look to government to solve all of their problems. Americans take responsibility for themselves and their communities. They do not claim to be victims of some unfortunate part of their lives, which in some way should relieve them from all responsibility for their actions. This is the America we seek to honor.
AMERICA tries to free its citizens, business and industry from excessive regulation, privatizes many government services, and transfers much of the authority and responsibility for social welfare and education to its churches, families and communities where they belong. This is the America we seek to honor.
Many great things have been done to educate the next generation of leaders. Americans know that government can’t solve all issues relating to business, education, health care, the environment and an array of other matters needing little, if any, federal intervention or regulation. History has shown that great people solve great problems, not governments. This is the America we seek to honor.
"The Freedom Field Project will reach out to educate people of all ages; for it is education that has the power to mold one’s mind - not laws and regulations." (Fred W. Harris)
Freedom Field Project
Sponsorships:  We have a variety of Individual, Company and Corporate Sponsorships available for the Main Memorial (5), State and Colonial Flags (65), and other components of the project.  The Naming Rights sponsorship (1) is also available.  Please contact the Foundation to discuss any of these options.
Scale Model:  All project photos are of our 3' x 4' scale model which was constructed by Mr. Larry McLean of Wapakoneta, Ohio.  The model is to exact scale and took Larry more than 700 hours to create.
Project Video:  The video contained herein was produced by Mr. Dan Wilson of Wilson 1 Communications in Wapakoneta, Ohio.
America The Beautiful Video:  This video was published on YouTube by subscriber Silver1Sprg. I have not found this person but want to give them credit.
Thank you - Donate Today if you can!

story:
A Tidal Change Is Occurring.

Thomas Jefferson and some of the founding father pals knew that what they created with the America project was an incredible experience.  They were post-elightenment thinkers that knew that these new Americans were going to be a force in the world.  To become competent world leaders, the American Government decided to provide to all, free of cost, a level of linguistic competence and a level of computational proficiency to compose business contracts to better our American experience.  Publicly funded, vastly rich libraries became available to all communities so that the New Americans could choose to take their minds and businesses to any level they could imagine after they learned to read, write, and perform basic mathematics.  

Times have changed, of course.  The age of the test is the age of today.  Students across various public settings are being presented with limited choice, as well as limited opportunity to engage in the pursuits that are aligned with not only their needs and interests, but also their ability and willingness. At Learn Inc., we guide our pupils through a supported, autonomous educational experience that transcends the borders of a classroom or school time.  We gather and enrich ourselves as a community of individuals with access to an entire community bursting with eager talented professionals willing to share their expertise with the youth of America. We take what we started in the community back to our resource-rich school and continue projects with innovative, compassionate, and motivational facilitators. Standing on foundations of Socratic Learning, Compassionate Communication, and Ecological Literacy, our Learners are provided a platform for individualized, in-context learning that addresses whole-person growth.

Our school is currently supported by tuition, and a team of grant writers are aiming to supplement our tuition to ensure the richest experiences for our Learners.  What we need at this point is financial help from the community to offset the heavy building expenses that were funded solely by our directors.  A modest goal of 4,000 dollars is our need, and we are hoping to achieve that goal in eleven days.  

We offer incentives, but if that is not enough, please visit us at Learninmontana.com and drop us a line to pitch a custom incentive to ensure we get your support in this dynamic and essential project.  

Thank you so much for your time and support.  This small contribution that you make will be the foundation for life-enriching experiences for countless individuals.

story: Hello everyone. My name is Felton Pierre and I'm an aspiring writer. I was born and raised in Miami to parents of Haitian descent. Despite my background living in a low income neighborhood, I managed to avoid street life, drugs and gangs, and instead was able to excel in my academics. I recently graduated from Florida International University and have been accepted into Columbia University School of the Arts for their Writing MFA. The purpose of this particular campaign is to assist me with funding for my first semester. I've struggled financially these past few months (not from lack of applying for jobs; rather I've had difficulty finding employment) and need assistance with paying my tuition deposit (which is $600) and with paying for housing. July 24, I was given an offer of accommodation for on-campus housing from Columbia and I only have a short amount of time from when I receive the offer (until mid-August) to make a payment that secures my housing (similar to a security deposit for an apartment) which is $1000. I genuinely have no means to obtain that amount of money on my own in such a short amount of time, and this is why I'm reaching out for assistance. I've always loved to write and do photography and my career goal is to become an author, and being able to attend such a prestigious school as Columbia would be a life-changing opportunity in this regard. For those who might want to get an example of my work to show how passionate I really am, I have a blog website (thezoenextdoor.com). I believe what I'm aiming to raise with this campaign is a reasonable goal and I have faith in your generosity.

story:
https://www.facebook.com/CentreforLiberty

LIBERTY & ENTREPRENEURSHIP CAMP 2017

Centre for Liberty & Entrepreneurship (CLE) will organize this Liberty & Entrepreneurship Camp 2017  at Bolga in the Upper East Region of Ghana. The three-day event will Start from 24-26 February, 2017 with participant reporting on 23rd February, 2017 in the evening on the Theme 'PROSPERITY THROUGH ECONOMIC FREEDOM'. The Camp is AYPC's flagship programme that has been run since 2008. The Centre for Liberty & Entrepreneurship a free market & liberty think tank formed by three alumni of AYPC's L&E Camp has assumed leadership of this camp now that Afrikanus Kofi Akosah has gone into hiding due to threats against his life from Ghana's socialists.

Participants will be introduced to FREE MARKET & LIBERTARIAN Concepts and how it promotes a humane & a prosperous Society. They will also start their entrepreneurship journey by learning business skills that can assist them in running their own businesses & pro-market institutions for policy reform.

Our motive is to foster a generation of African youth who are independent thinking with an inclination thousands individual freedom. With an immersion process of group work, presentations and research, participants are trained to become Free Market/Libertarian activists and entrepreneurs.

This session will be interesting in the sense that we've young Africans participating from all over the African continent. The 26th of February is set aside as Blockchain Day. Participants will learn the A-Z of Blockchain/Bitcoin & its potentials to free Africa & the world.

We have powerful Speakers lined up for the camp that includes Prof. Brian Ogstad, Prof. Noel Berg, Ken Van Doreen,Tim Tayshun, Regina Joyce Brim. Susanne Templehoff, Kofi Akosah, Marsha Enright, Joe Shepherd, Akwesi Adusei, Mahamadu Salam etc.

The topics to be presented at the Liberty & Entrepreneurship Camp - Bolga are:

•                     The political aspect of libertarianism.

•                     The economic aspect of libertarianism.

•                     Free market as a driving force toward economic prosperity.

•                     How Economic freedom and property rights lead to economic self-sufficiency.

•                     Social freedom to choose how to live one’s life; and

•                     Intellectual and academic freedom.

Our goal is to engage the Northern Ghana, Ghana & African intellectual class and youth in order to propagate the ideas of Liberty and Individual Responsibility.  We know that public support of Liberty, free market ideas and policies will work toward eradicating poverty and bringing an end to violence in the poorest part of Ghana and Africa as a whole.  WE at CLE have successfully organized several free markets and liberty programs in Northern Ghana including:

 

•                     Northern Sector libertarian Convention in February, 2016

•                     Peace Conference in August, 2016

•                      Tax Haven & Holiday event in October, 2016

•                      Freedom& Society seminar, December, 2015 in partnership with AYPC.

 

All these events took place without funding from outside sources.   Therefore we can assure you that your contribution will be wisely and efficiently invested. 

Our events have gotten much attention, and the people of Northern Ghana are starting to look to us to provide the solutions to the problems of poverty, violence and the excesses of government. 

OUR BUDGET

It will cost every student $105.74 to participate in the camp. This means that if we are to host the proposed 45 students including teachers then we need $4,758.30 Every participant is supposed to pay $52.00 which is about half of the total cost. We are therefore raising $2,418.30 to make it happen. See a breakdown of the budget bellow.

 

We also accept donations in BITCOIN: 1GX1JUafxDHcLJFNk3LT1A79Ju7DK4MDhe

 

                                                           PROGRAM BUDGET

ITEM

DESCRIPTION

PRICE PER UNIT (USD)

AMOUNT (USD)

Venue

Conference Hall for 3 days

$100.00 a Day

$100.00 by 3 = $300.00

Accommodation

Boarding for 45 participants for including teachers for 3 nights

$22 a night by 45 = $990.00 a day

$990 by 3 = $2,970.00

Feeding

Breakfast, lunch & supper for 45 participants including teachers for 5 days

$3 per meal by 3 times a day = $9 by 45 = $405.00 a day

$405 by 3 = $1,215.00

Media

Coverage of the event

$50 a day

$50 by 3 =      $150.00

Program Banner

6 by 4

$30

                           $30.00

Sub-total

 

 

                     $4,665.00

Contingency

Unforeseen expenditure

2%

                          $93.30

Grand Total

 

 

                                  $4,758.30

 

Donate Now, Share the Message and support Liberty.

A Donation To L&E Camp - Bolga is A Donation To Safe Northern Ghana.

Thank You for your continuous support for a free society.

in

Liberty

Mahamadu Salam

president

Centre for Liberty & Entrepreneurship

story:
Dear Sir/Madam,

Greetings and Namaste from Nepal !
With much more thanking for your prayer and support, We've successfully held Education Support 2018 program on 1st Jan, 2018.
This is to kinldy let you know our 'Mission Team' are travelling to the part of USA, Europe and Arab countries by the way, if there is convenient for you and our team the mentioned perks items along with honoring certificate, thanking video and photographs from children and letterhead from organization are already handed in your name and addresses.
If they did not find/contact with you it will be mailed through the registered post.

Thank you for your patience !!!
With thanking,
Himalaya Mt. Everest Tower
Mission Department
Kathmandu, Nepal

.................................................................................................................................................................

Greetings with a Beacon of Light and Love from the Top of the World Mt. Everest, Nepal !!!

This Campaign is for humanitarian APPEAL to provide EDUCATION SUPPORT for too neediest 382 children to enable them to go school and get happy.

We need to manage for each children school bags, stationary, uniforms, books, shoes includes school admission related basic urgent needs.

School new session has already started from 23rd April, 2017 which is 10th Baishakh, 2074 (Bikram Samwat) New Year month in Nepal but due to local election schools were closed for one week. 

 

We are wholehearted and willing to do something great in the neediest society by joining with like-minded people like you from Kathmandu valley to the most remote parts of Nepal where there are too horrible and critical situation and the need is most acute.

And we have been making meaningful differences in the lives of downtrodden, under privileged and heterogeneous community groups of Nepal and the children who were victim of Child and Female Trafficking, Earthquake, Landslide,  HIV,  AIDS, Famine, Persecution and during Civil War in Nepal. 

This organization is helping to develop Nepal and too poorest Nepalese and the forgotten neediest children, highlight natural heritage and the World Top Mountains,invite foreigners to do something for overall development of Nepal includes sanitation, rescue and conservation of the Himalayas.

Himalaya Mt. Everest Tower is also an institutional association with Nepal Mountaineering Association (NMA) for mountain tourism and Affiliation with Social Welfare Council (SWC) for social welfare services in all over Nepal.

We've been providing support for orphans and vulnerable neediest children of Nepal so as to enable them live a normal life like other children in the country. They who do not have parents, guardians and the children privilege to look after them we assist  to acquire education by supporting them attend nursery, primary and secondary schools.

HIMET has been assisting with the health, welfare and education, of orphans, the destitute, at-risk, and children dying from AIDS those suffering problems caused by a decade of civil war, famine, persecutions, earthquake, land slide disaster and trafficking.

This brings children to tearful joy most of them have not just missed their parents, family members and also missing their schooling lives.

A, They so enjoy their schooling lives like other children in the country.

B, You'll find a pure joy of children you'll be blessed in every ways of your life.

C, You'll be proud and thanks for this life to be able to serve for too neediest.

D, There will be special count that you've done something great and worthwhile you alive.

F, You'll get to view thank you videos and photographs from their tearful and joyful hearts.

You will get inner peace supporting to get education for the forgotten neediest children of Nepal and we have managed SPECIAL PERKS which are locally hand crafted in Kathmandu and from the high altitude Himalayas of Nepal, suit for all budgets sent with a great agape love from the most famous and Top of the Wold whoever help to us on our determination to save and educate for the forgotten lost children of Nepal. 

High Altitude Green Leaf Tea and other mentioned precious items in the perk section are local branded and will be sent through the registered mail from the postal office of Nepal Government with a very special waterproof sealed and stamped boxes with in details tags you may track about your parcel's status with our emailed 12 Digit Tracking Code Numbers at anytime and you will get parcel within 8 to 12 days of dispatch. 

High Altitude Green Leaf Tea is so super to regulate body, clean clone, weight loss, diabetic, constipation, blood pressure, gastric and for skin care it is also great for FACE PACK and HAIR WASH for shiny and fresher face and hair. 

We have also managed SPECIAL and PRECIOUS HIMALAYAN ANTIQUE GIFT ITEMS that will be sent to our great backers which is not mentioned in the perk section as well as we've SECRET PERK that is viewable for backers oncer your contribution is confirmed. 

Yarsagumba/Cordyceps Sinensis will be sent with the wax sealed and stamp of Nepal Government through the Department of Forest, Governtment of Nepal to your name and address from DHL Express Shipping. 

Himalayas Herb Yarsagumba/Cordyceps Sinensis "Half Mushroom and Half Caterpillar" has a great magical natural power for Chronic and Complex illness include Cancer, Natural Beauty and Magical Natural Booster for a Great Athletics Performances. It is proved since continual World Olympic Championship Multiple Records set by Chinese Female Athletes Wang Junxia. Yes, obviously it is also an extra gear for Sexual stamina. 

WE ALSO OFFER

We also offer TOP OF THE WORLD CERTIFICATE of APPRECIATION and HONOR on HUMANITY SERVICES with HIGH ALTITUDE GREEN LEAF TEA to those who help us in our determination by sharing to their Friends, Family, Colleagues and on Social Medias. 

"WE ALSO RESPECT WITH STAR HONOR AND AWARDS FROM THE TOP OF THE WORLD FOR THOSE WHO ARE UNABLE TO HELP BY FINANCIALLY BUT ALREADY WITH GREAT HUMANITY TASKS."

01, What types of school children study private or under Govt. of Nepal?

ANS: Our mission related schools are under Govt. of Nepal these children cannot even dream to join private boarding school because of high fees and their extra other charges eventhough some of our mission related schools are private due to no Govt. school are available in that remote areas. 

02, How can I be sure that my contribution go to the neediest children and they join school with necessary school supply?

ANS: You'll get videos and photographs of cheerily tearful thanking from the children after joining them with necessary school supply along with our organization letterhead letter and precious certificates with the mentioned perks in the right side through the registered mail with 12 digital 'NP' tracking codes numbers. 

03, What will happen if you won't reach your funding goal?

ANS: We do whatever collected fund allows we assure you that we do as fund allows and you'll get update in time frame as mentioned in the perk section clearly.

04, Can I also get certificate from School of Nepal Govt. after children join the school with necessary supply?

ANS: YES, surely we've clearly mentioned in the perk please check out and choose the related perk. 

05, Can I also visit your organization and school and meet children if luck favors to me to travel in your country?

ANS: Aha, that must be so great and you're very welcome to Nepal! 

Our mission team are always time ready to cheers you from our Tribhuvan International Airport to our mission building and we will take you in our mission field along with beautiful mountain trips as per your plan and wishes.

06, Can I also involve as a volunteer in short and long term in Govt. school like teaching or any other IT or health related programs? 

ANS; Yes, we heartily welcome to volunteer in our mission related field and schools you just need prior notice to us for necessary management. 

07, Can I also donate food, medicine, toys, clothes, tablets, computers or any basic school supplies etc? 

ANS: Yes, of course!  It is prohibitively expensive to transport these goods overseas to Nepal. However, you are welcome to earmark a monetary donation. We promise that your donation will go much more further when spent in Nepal.

08,  What curriculum do the children learn?

ANS: Same curriculum as any other Nepalese children are getting under Department of Education, Nepal. 

HIMET’S do not involve amending, correcting on Nepal’s curriculum though there are some different teaching materials between Private Boarding School and Govt. School academic curriculum. 

09, What is your organization doing to root out and prevent child abuse, child labor and child right?

ANS: Nepal Mission is Community Base Organization (CBO) of Himalaya Mt. Everest Tower 'HIMET'.

We work with communities to ensure that the children do not participate in child labor and is not subject to exploitation in any way.

There will never be any form of child abuse or corporal punishment be tolerated against any children at the schools.

We do monitor and internal controls  that child labor or exploitation is not taking place with any of the schools and villages where we work with. Our focal leaders visit schools most often weekly. 

10,  Does Nepal Mission also offer internships?

Ans: Yes. we are in particular need of journalism, researcher and internships students who will help documentation, projection the work of our Nepal Mission by telling the stories to the World. And you just simply need permission from the organization and we arrange further help whatsoever you may in need from us.

11,  How will the funds be used? any administrative costs handled? 

ANS: Our team take no salary and pays.  Administrative expenses include stationary, ink, stamps and computer-related costs. We work hard to make sure that collected amount totally go to help to the neediest children of Nepal.

12,  Are you a non-profit or non-governmental organization? 

ANS: Yes, Himalaya Mt. Everest Tower is entirely volunteer based non-denominational, non- governmental and social development as a tax exempted registered 'NFP' organization in Nepal. 

13,  Can I donate from outside the USA?

ANS: Absolutely! 

14, Is shipping included worldwide in the perks?

ANS: Yes.

15, What payment methods do you accept?

ANS: Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards.

16,  I am a celebrity or public figure and would like to endorse the prize or help in some other way. How do I contact with you?

ANS: Please email to atten: Rajendra Nhisutu, Chairperson info@mounteveresttower.org.np, info@mission2nepal.org mounteveresttower@gmail.com or Skype: 'nhisutu' whatspp: +9779843097740

17, I have more questions. Who do I ask?

ANS: Please contact us at info@mounteveresttower.org.np or info@mission2nepal.org or mounteveresttower@gmail.com to ask your any questions. We’ll get back to you as soonest as we can.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have money to contribute right now, You can still help by getting the word out and sending others our way. Post the link everywhere links get posted (like... social media... places), Tell the members of your Friends, Family and Colleagues and Clubs, share it with your loved ones, and so on.

We also offer TOP OF THE WORLD CERTIFICATE of APPRECIATION and HONOR on HUMANITY SERVICES to those who help us in our determination by sharing to their Friends, Family and Colleagues and on Social Medias. 

Spread the word! 

Send out this campaign page with all of Indiegogo's awesome sharing tools! 

Yours in good faith,

Rajendra Nhisutu

Founder, Chair, Director

Himalaya Mt. Everest Tower Organization

Kathmandu, Nepal

https://www.mounteveresttower.org.np/orphaned-and-destitute-children-mission-of-nepal

https://www.mission2nepal.org

A Brief about Founder, Chairperson and Team:

In lieu of funds, other in-kind support is also requested (i.e. usable clothing, shoes, additional books, toys, socks age 5 years to 16).

Clothing can be posted as per below: 

Atten: HIMET

Govt. Post Office Post Code: 44600, Post Box No: 5020, 

For general, sponsorship, volunteer or donation enquiries or tele-meetings can be arranged via Skype. I am contactable direct via: mounteveresttower@gmail.com or

info@mission2nepal.org, info@mounteveresttower.org.np

 Skype: nhisutu, Whatsapp: +977 9843097740, Viber, IMO

Tel: +977 9843097740, +977 1 5218636, +977 1 4275636
story_txt:
Dear Sir/Madam, Greetings and Namaste from Nepal !With much more thanking for your prayer and support, We've successfully held Education Support 2018 program on 1st Jan, 2018.This is to kinldy let you know our 'Mission Team' are travelling to the part of USA, Europe and Arab countries by the way, if there is convenient for you and our team the mentioned perks items along with honoring certificate, thanking video and photographs from children and letterhead from organization are already handed in your name and addresses.If they did not find/contact with you it will be mailed through the registered post.Thank you for your patience !!!With thanking,Himalaya Mt. Everest TowerMission DepartmentKathmandu, Nepal.................................................................................................................................................................Greetings with a Beacon of Light and Love from the Top of the World Mt. Everest, Nepal !!!This Campaign is for humanitarian APPEAL to provide EDUCATION SUPPORT for too neediest 382 children to enable them to go school and get happy.We need to manage for each children school bags, stationary, uniforms, books, shoes includes school admission related basic urgent needs.School new session has already started from 23rd April, 2017 which is 10th Baishakh, 2074 (Bikram Samwat) New Year month in Nepal but due to local election schools were closed for one week. 

 We are wholehearted and willing to do something great in the neediest society by joining with like-minded people like you from Kathmandu valley to the most remote parts of Nepal where there are too horrible and critical situation and the need is most acute.And we have been making meaningful differences in the lives of downtrodden, under privileged and heterogeneous community groups of Nepal and the children who were victim of Child and Female Trafficking, Earthquake, Landslide,  HIV,  AIDS, Famine, Persecution and during Civil War in Nepal. This organization is helping to develop Nepal and too poorest Nepalese and the forgotten neediest children, highlight natural heritage and the World Top Mountains,invite foreigners to do something for overall development of Nepal includes sanitation, rescue and conservation of the Himalayas.Himalaya Mt. Everest Tower is also an institutional association with Nepal Mountaineering Association (NMA) for mountain tourism and Affiliation with Social Welfare Council (SWC) for social welfare services in all over Nepal.We've been providing support for orphans and vulnerable neediest children of Nepal so as to enable them live a normal life like other children in the country. They who do not have parents, guardians and the children privilege to look after them we assist  to acquire education by supporting them attend nursery, primary and secondary schools.HIMET has been assisting with the health, welfare and education, of orphans, the destitute, at-risk, and children dying from AIDS those suffering problems caused by a decade of civil war, famine, persecutions, earthquake, land slide disaster and trafficking.This brings children to tearful joy most of them have not just missed their parents, family members and also missing their schooling lives.A, They so enjoy their schooling lives like other children in the country.B, You'll find a pure joy of children you'll be blessed in every ways of your life.C, You'll be proud and thanks for this life to be able to serve for too neediest.D, There will be special count that you've done something great and worthwhile you alive.F, You'll get to view thank you videos and photographs from their tearful and joyful hearts.You will get inner peace supporting to get education for the forgotten neediest children of Nepal and we have managed SPECIAL PERKS which are locally hand crafted in Kathmandu and from the high altitude Himalayas of Nepal, suit for all budgets sent with a great agape love from the most famous and Top of the Wold whoever help to us on our determination to save and educate for the forgotten lost children of Nepal. High Altitude Green Leaf Tea and other mentioned precious items in the perk section are local branded and will be sent through the registered mail from the postal office of Nepal Government with a very special waterproof sealed and stamped boxes with in details tags you may track about your parcel's status with our emailed 12 Digit Tracking Code Numbers at anytime and you will get parcel within 8 to 12 days of dispatch. High Altitude Green Leaf Tea is so super to regulate body, clean clone, weight loss, diabetic, constipation, blood pressure, gastric and for skin care it is also great for FACE PACK and HAIR WASH for shiny and fresher face and hair. We have also managed SPECIAL and PRECIOUS HIMALAYAN ANTIQUE GIFT ITEMS that will be sent to our great backers which is not mentioned in the perk section as well as we've SECRET PERK that is viewable for backers oncer your contribution is confirmed. Yarsagumba/Cordyceps Sinensis will be sent with the wax sealed and stamp of Nepal Government through the Department of Forest, Governtment of Nepal to your name and address from DHL Express Shipping. Himalayas Herb Yarsagumba/Cordyceps Sinensis "Half Mushroom and Half Caterpillar" has a great magical natural power for Chronic and Complex illness include Cancer, Natural Beauty and Magical Natural Booster for a Great Athletics Performances. It is proved since continual World Olympic Championship Multiple Records set by Chinese Female Athletes Wang Junxia. Yes, obviously it is also an extra gear for Sexual stamina. WE ALSO OFFERWe also offer TOP OF THE WORLD CERTIFICATE of APPRECIATION and HONOR on HUMANITY SERVICES with HIGH ALTITUDE GREEN LEAF TEA to those who help us in our determination by sharing to their Friends, Family, Colleagues and on Social Medias. "WE ALSO RESPECT WITH STAR HONOR AND AWARDS FROM THE TOP OF THE WORLD FOR THOSE WHO ARE UNABLE TO HELP BY FINANCIALLY BUT ALREADY WITH GREAT HUMANITY TASKS."01, What types of school children study private or under Govt. of Nepal?ANS: Our mission related schools are under Govt. of Nepal these children cannot even dream to join private boarding school because of high fees and their extra other charges eventhough some of our mission related schools are private due to no Govt. school are available in that remote areas. 02, How can I be sure that my contribution go to the neediest children and they join school with necessary school supply?ANS: You'll get videos and photographs of cheerily tearful thanking from the children after joining them with necessary school supply along with our organization letterhead letter and precious certificates with the mentioned perks in the right side through the registered mail with 12 digital 'NP' tracking codes numbers. 03, What will happen if you won't reach your funding goal?ANS: We do whatever collected fund allows we assure you that we do as fund allows and you'll get update in time frame as mentioned in the perk section clearly.04, Can I also get certificate from School of Nepal Govt. after children join the school with necessary supply?ANS: YES, surely we've clearly mentioned in the perk please check out and choose the related perk. 05, Can I also visit your organization and school and meet children if luck favors to me to travel in your country?ANS: Aha, that must be so great and you're very welcome to Nepal! Our mission team are always time ready to cheers you from our Tribhuvan International Airport to our mission building and we will take you in our mission field along with beautiful mountain trips as per your plan and wishes.06, Can I also involve as a volunteer in short and long term in Govt. school like teaching or any other IT or health related programs? ANS; Yes, we heartily welcome to volunteer in our mission related field and schools you just need prior notice to us for necessary management. 07, Can I also donate food, medicine, toys, clothes, tablets, computers or any basic school supplies etc? ANS: Yes, of course!  It is prohibitively expensive to transport these goods overseas to Nepal. However, you are welcome to earmark a monetary donation. We promise that your donation will go much more further when spent in Nepal.08,  What curriculum do the children learn?ANS: Same curriculum as any other Nepalese children are getting under Department of Education, Nepal. HIMET’S do not involve amending, correcting on Nepal’s curriculum though there are some different teaching materials between Private Boarding School and Govt. School academic curriculum. 09, What is your organization doing to root out and prevent child abuse, child labor and child right?ANS: Nepal Mission is Community Base Organization (CBO) of Himalaya Mt. Everest Tower 'HIMET'.We work with communities to ensure that the children do not participate in child labor and is not subject to exploitation in any way.There will never be any form of child abuse or corporal punishment be tolerated against any children at the schools.We do monitor and internal controls  that child labor or exploitation is not taking place with any of the schools and villages where we work with. Our focal leaders visit schools most often weekly. 10,  Does Nepal Mission also offer internships?Ans: Yes. we are in particular need of journalism, researcher and internships students who will help documentation, projection the work of our Nepal Mission by telling the stories to the World. And you just simply need permission from the organization and we arrange further help whatsoever you may in need from us.11,  How will the funds be used? any administrative costs handled? ANS: Our team take no salary and pays.  Administrative expenses include stationary, ink, stamps and computer-related costs. How do I contact with you?ANS: Please email to atten: Rajendra Nhisutu, Chairperson info@mounteveresttower.org.np, info@mission2nepal.org mounteveresttower@gmail.com or Skype: 'nhisutu' whatspp: +977984309774017, I have more questions. Who do I ask?ANS: Please contact us at info@mounteveresttower.org.np or info@mission2nepal.org or mounteveresttower@gmail.com to ask your any questions. We’ll get back to you as soonest as we can.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you don't have money to contribute right now, You can still help by getting the word out and sending others our way. story:
WHO ARE WE

My name is Cheri Reid I'm the owner of BIG HUGS INC. I operate my mentoring company with my husband John Reid. BIG HUGS has been in operation for 10 years and was fully funded by John and I through our personal finances and private donations through our  family members. You may ask yourself why did we do it this way? well we saw an emergency need in my community and we acted with our hearts. We saw too many kids going to jail, dropping out of school, and not dreaming. I came up with a program that would focus on mentoring, hot meals for the entire family, day care at the development stage six weeks through 3 years old, homework help, none of our children ever leaves BIG HUGS without hugs and their homework done every night. This program  has lead to IEP's going up and most of our kids are now students of the month and math champs of the month and most of all the kids are now smiling everyday. Homework not being completed was one of the main complaints from the parents who  had their children attending other programs. Most of kids come from broken homes or single parent homes and most of our parents don't get homes until late at night and this has lead to homework not being done so we sprung into action and hired junior staff members these are young adults who come from shelters, projects, and foster care who maintain good grades and we pay them to tutor and help with the homework help. This helps to add income to their families as well as help them gain self-esteem. We also do college tours our kids have been to Fairfield University, Princeton University, Yale University, and my Alma Mater Mercy College all trips taken are free, all tee-shirts are free. We keep everything free for the parents because I saw how my dad felt when he could not provide activities for me because he had to choose to put food in my mouth and pay the rent. so when I started this program I promised all parents who enrolled their children all trips would be free. Our motto is Education Through a Parent's Perspective. This means that I was once a parent myself and I knew how scary it was to let my children go with strangers in the beginning. I also know how unique every kid is and that the parent is the best person to guide myself and my staff on what their child needs most from my program. We accept all kids we also accept all kids who parent no income no child is ever turned away.

 

We Need Your Help

John and I was both in two major car accidents this year the first one was us and our three children. Our second accident was with John and I both times we was struck from behind and both times we was hurt. Theses accidents have caused us to have a economic hardship and we can't use our personal finances this year but we can't give up because we know that these kids needs us. BIG HUGS needs $500,000.00 this will allow 30 kids to go to our after-school and summer camp for free for two years.

The funds will be used for

overhead two years: $110,000.00

Salaries for two years:$200,000.00

Food for two years: $72,000.00

Computers: $20,000.00

Tee-Shirts for kids and staff for two years: $5,000.00

College Tours: $60,000.00

Website: $3,000.00

Van: $30,000.00

Perks

Please don't forget we have perks for donations these perks will be yours to keep and will remind you of your generosity.

Funds & Goals
We trust in GOD that our goal will be meet

The Impact

So many families lives will be forever changed with your help and partnership.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out

Please give a hug

Please use Indiegogo share tools

story:
African Americans Ain't Africans

The people the world has come to know as African Americans have no bloodline connection to the continent of Africa.

Hi,

My name is Kerry Davis, and through years of exhaustive research and unrelenting questioning the transatlantic slave trade is nothing but a hoax. What you see today in the African American community:  sagging pants, disrespect for one another, hatred for self, and a high rate of ignorance can all be attributed to the so called African American being disconnected to their placement on Earth. Dogged by years of mis-education, the African American has a clear case of Menticide and is on a clear path to self destruction. Your support of our mobile communication package ensures that we can travel to different locations and pull information live from the Earth to share with our people, especially the youth. We need more than your contribution of funds, we need you to help spread the word. 

At present we are closer to our goal and would personally like to thank everyone who has helped us come this far. But in order to go the rest of the way we need your support. Our mission is to educate, be a resource, and beacon of light for Indigenous peoples of North America now called African American. Please remember to send your e-mail address so we can send you your e-book. We anticipate on reaching our goals and we are making plans for content to help us get the information to the masses. Check out our website at http://africanamericansaintafricans.org

For those who choose the "WARRIOR" perk here's Chai's list of soaps that you can choose from:

1. Lemon Eucalyptus Soap 
2. Mint Soap
3. Black Amber Soap
4. Citrus Melons Soap
5. Calming Soap
6. I Feel Good Soap

If you have any questions or concerns feel free to contact us.

story:
Es ist davon auszugehen, dass die Zahl der Flüchtlinge auch in den nächsten Monaten weiter steigen wird. Deshalb brauchen wir dringend Ihre Hilfe. Bitte unterstützen Sie uns, um obdachlosen Menschen dabei zu helfen, endlich eine Notunterkunft zu finden!
It is assumed that the number of refugees will continue to increase in the coming months. Therefore, we urgently need your help. Please help us to help homeless people to finally find a shelter!

Wir geben Familien mit dem Schwerpunkt Syrien eine Unterkunft.
We provide families with a focus on Syria for a housing.

Die meisten der Flüchtlinge sind nahezu mittellos und dringend auf sofortige Hilfe angewiesen.
Most of the refugees are almost destitute and in urgent need of immediate assistance.
Da die Behörden den Ansturm nicht mehr bewältigen können, dauert es nicht selten für Familien bis zu 2 Wochen, bis sie überhaupt vorsprechen können/dürfen.
Since the authorities can no longer cope the onslaught, it takes not uncommon for families up to 2 weeks before they are allowed to have an audition.

Wir haben aktuell schon 14 Familien unterstützt und somit 76 Menschen geholfen. 

We currently have supported 14 families  and thus helped 76 people.


Da wir mit Ihrer Unterstützung noch viel mehr Flüchtlingen helfen können, bringt uns jede Hilfe von Ihnen einen Schritt weiter.
We can help many more refugees, with your support, any help from you will bring us one step further.


Wir brauchen Ihre Hilfe z.B. um neue Einheiten zu eröffnen und folgende 
Dinge zu kaufen:

We need your help, for example, to open up new units and the following

things to buy:
  • Betten / beds
  • Badutensilien / Bath Accessories
  • Kleiderschränke / wardrobes
  • Kleiderbügel / coat hanger
  • Lampen / lamps
  • Tische / tables
  • Stühle / chairs
  • Geschirr / dishes
  • Töpfe / pots
  • Pfannen / pans
  • Besteck / cutlery
  • Waschmaschinen / washing machines
  • für die Kinder was zum Spielen und Malen / for the children something to play and painting
    u.v.m. / and much more

Lassen Sie uns mit Ihrer Hilfe wenigstens den Kindern in diesen schweren Zeiten ein Lächeln auf die Lippen zaubern!
With your help, we put a smile on children's lips!

Ich bedanke mich im Voraus bei Ihnen und werde Sie hier auf dem Laufenden halten, was wir mit Ihrer Hilfe erreichen konnten!
I thank you in advance for your help and will keep you up to date here, what we achieve with your help!
REFUGEES WELCOME!

für die Kinder was zum Spielen und Malen / for the children something to play and paintingu.v.m. / and much more


Lassen Sie uns mit Ihrer Hilfe wenigstens den Kindern in diesen schweren Zeiten ein Lächeln auf die Lippen zaubern!With your help, we put a smile on children's lips!



Ich bedanke mich im Voraus bei Ihnen und werde Sie hier auf dem Laufenden halten, was wir mit Ihrer Hilfe erreichen konnten!I thank you in advance for your help and will keep you up to date here, what we achieve with your help!

REFUGEES WELCOME!

story:
Update:
--------

Thank you to everyone to donated for your support!

Your generosity means we now have funding for an extra month. 

If you missed your chance and would like to donate to help keep us going into the new year, visit the link below. 

Support us now: Click here to donate.

If everyone reading this gave just £5 each we could fund MediaWatch through 2016... 

How much is daily scrutiny of the press worth to you?

You can follow our work by signing up to our weekly email here.

Thanks for caring - let's keep up the fight!

- Adam

--------

The mainstream press is in overdrive. 

Instead of focusing on damaging cuts, they rail against the new leader of the Labour party.  

No matter what you think of Jeremy Corbyn, cuts to tax credits are more important to people's lives than whether he sings the national anthem.

During the General Election we saw how influential newspapers can be. Most of the UK’s print media is right-wing and owned by wealthy elite media barons.

We can challenge them.

MediaWatch exposes errors and lies in UK press, and presents the facts that argue for positive change. MediaWatch operates online through new media channels which are both relatively cheap and increasingly influential.

We're a small project making a big impact: with only one staff member we reach thousands of people every article - and we want to do more.

Since our launch in March 2015 we've punched above our weight.

We were pulling apart the racism and scapegoating of refugees months before the crisis went mainstream. 

We secured an apology and correction from the Telegraph for major errors in a piece on social mobility.

And we were the first to bulldoze shameful newspaper coverage of last week's LinkedIn sexism row - when a lawyer was called a 'femanazi' by the press.

Now we want to build on this work and take the fight to the newspapers.

With the Conservatives in power the right-wing press is brazenly promoting the government’s policies while pushing the national debate even further to the right.

We want to use our voice to combat the Conservative government’s worst policies and criticise media spin and distortion. 

It’s more important than ever that we support progressive politics to fight back against the media’s attempt to distort and smear all opposition.

As a non-profit start-up we are entirely funded by readers like you.

Can you chip in to help us fight for an honest press?

Support us now

__________

Here's our original crowdfunding video from April:


__________

For more on MediaWatch please keep reading below. 

The problem: Right-wing spin dominates UK print media. 

Newspapers still have a huge reach. More than 60% of people regularly read a daily or Sunday newspaper in the UK. They have influence on public debate and shape what people think.

Who owns these newspapers often informs their editorial line and political slant: papers with conservative owners tend to support conservative politics.

This is particularly dangerous when the overwhelming majority of UK papers are owned by right-leaning wealthy individuals like Rupert Murdoch and Lord Rothermere who combined own over 50% of the UK’s printed press.


This right-wing prejudice in newspapers influences public debate in a way comparable to Fox News in the United States, leaving the public with a one-sided and false picture of reality.

These news outlets are so powerful it can feel like there is no way to push back or offer a different perspective.

BUT

The rise of the internet and new media such as blogs can help rebalance the scales in this unrepresentative political environment without costing billions.

MediaWatch is uniquely placed to do this, with 100,000 unique readers every month and a growing list of supporters. 


In the short time we've been going we've already made a difference. Now, we need your help to continue. 

Can you chip in to help us fight for an honest press?

Bad news never sleeps - and neither will MediaWatch! 

With your support we can keep on exposing press lies and make progressive arguments for change.

Donate now to support MediaWatch


For more visit http://leftfootforward.org/tag/media-watch/ or follow us @MediaWatchLFF

Email Adam Barnett on adam@leftfootforward.org

story:
AMERIKUA - Indigenous dream weavers

My name is Maia Balam, I am a Mexican filmmaker and activist, with the mission of giving voice to the people of the land, those who stand in the front lines against globalization and ecocide: the Indigenous people that have been inhabiting the earth in a respectful way for thousands of years, but whom have been abused by the destructive agendas of capitalism for hundredths of years. 

One day upon walking the streets of San Cristobal de las Casas Chiapas (a colonial town in Mexico, that is very marked by injustice and discrimination), I had the dream of being able to help indigenous mothers and their children to have a better quality of life, lives in which the kids are able to eat 3 meals per day and go to school instead of working all day to help their mothers, who sell hand made products in the streets.  Every year that I visit Sancris I meditate on this same heartbreaking issue (of kids working until very late at night, not having time to play and being malnourished) , and this winter I finally came up with an idea to bring ease and abundance to this humble mothers and their hungry children: 

With the aid of the global community I will help them design a proper fair trade clothing & jewelry brand that gives them a steady income, and that will help them sell and ship their products all over the world,  I will also create a short film series around their craft-art & life in order to share their stories and culture with Mexico and the rest of world.


We are living in a very important moment in human history, an age in which we are being awakened to many truths and problems,  WE have been given the power to CHOOSE how to HELP transform the world around us, and right now we have the power to build a more FAIR REALTY for all living beings, specially the ones that are in our proximate reality, and the most vulnerable sectors of society, the homeless, the elders, the children and the Indigenous people of our planet. 



WHAT YOU GET

THE REWARDS:

The pieces of the collection will all be made of natural fibers, and will follow the millenary traditional style of women in Chiapas, the base materials will be wool and cotton,  the production line will feature: capes, jewelry, waist bags, and ponchos.

Hand made Medicine pieces, embedded with hundredths of hours of work, delicate flower embroidery designs, Indigenous patterns and ancient symbols.  Durable, ancient futuristic pieces that are able to endure for ages and adapt to the most challenging weather. 

Besides being all terrain pieces, they will be specially made to protect the owner from external energies and challenging weather, such as low temperatures, sun rays, mosquito bites and rain. 


THE USES:

This medicine pieces will be useful for the world traveller, for example ::

The poncho:: will be able to use as a yoga mat, as sleeping mat, and as a raincoat, because of the water proof qualities of wool, its the best ally for the traveller and festivalist.

The waist bag:: will be made of endurable hand made fabric, embroided with flowers and symbols, will also have a couple metallic rings where to hang carabineers or keys.

The capes::: are from a different material & design than the ponchos, good for a rainy day & also good to keep the warmth in winter.

The blouses::: are made from cotton and flower embroidery.  

The jewelry::: is made with Amber, Jade, Turquoise, Coral & other high vibrational hand carved stones made all around the world and Mayan lands. I personally hand made this pieces through several years of collecting the beads. 

The neck pieces:::  are made of embroided flowers and can be used in your neck, waist or around your head.

:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

:::The neck pieces:::



:::The Blouses:::

             

:::waist bags:::

              


:::Traditional capes:::


WHAT WE NEED TO WEAVE DREAMS

THE COOPERATIVE NETWORK

I will start to work with 4 women, then spread up to 8 or more, depending on the demand.  When one family starts doing well they invite their cousins or aunts to work with the cooperative. My dream is to improve the life of their whole family with this production, starting from the elders, to the mothers & their children. 

                          

  

THE IMPACT

  • I will work at first with 4 weaver women, then as the brand gets bigger I will keep training-employing more members of their family and community. 
  • I will teach then how to administrate their resources & invest in their future.
  • The long term vision is to branch out and work with Indigenous artists-artisans in other countries too, such as: Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, Bolivia, etc.  to help them activate their own online business and branding. I already have the connections with Indigenous leaders and artisans who want to be part of the dream, and who also need help to link up their crafts and arts.
  • The reason im so passionate about this project, is that the critical living situation of this Mayan women and children (and the majority of Indigenous people in Latin Amerikua who live in harsh conditions) is one that I know and trust can be solved with the support of other awakened and empathetic beings form around the world. 
  • The impact that this project will have on this communities will improve dramatically the extreme poverty in which they live in, and this will allow their kids to go to school,  + it will allow the whole family to eat better, and to have some free time, rather than be working on the cold streets all day. 
  • whenever the production line becomes steady and gets positioned in several markets around the world, I will act as an economic advisor for the women in the cooperative, and suggest them to direct their money to fix their homes rather than buying a plasma Tv,  when the time is right I will also introduce them to sustainable technologies such as water captation systems, green houses, permaculture, etc.

THE CHALLENGE

This women and children live in another rhythm of life, a more slow pace , so it will take me time to adjust to their needs, and learn their ways. But im willing and ready to spend quality time with this culture,  through many years I have admired immensely their work, and have felt powerless to do more than emptiying my wallet on them, or taking them for lunch. So after much thinking and feeling for them, this vision came together as a solution. I know you will want to be part of the solution to help bring ease to the people who are the most affected by our globalization.

Other ways to help us weave new realities

  • Help us share this campaign in your wall to create awareness of this dream. 
  • Help us by sending this link to 7 friends that might be interested in supporting us to weave this collective dream.

IN LAK ESH - NAMASTE - THE UNIVERSE ALWAYS HELPS THE DREAMER

               AND THE DREAMERS ALWAYS HELP THE UNIVERSE

               GRACIAS/KOLABAL

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
