story:
NOLA CODE is a fiscally sponsored, non-profit initiative to bring educational workshops in computer science to children in New Orleans.

Code is in Demand

Demand for computing jobs is growing at twice the rate of all other jobs in America.

And it’s growing at 5 times the rate in Louisiana.

Software development, for instance, is our state’s fastest growing job market.



Unfortunately, Louisiana’s children do not have adequate opportunities to learn this important subject.

For instance, roughly 6 out of our 80 public schools offer computer science in New Orleans.  None of our public elementary schools teach it.  As a result, only 0.3% of A.P. exams taken in Louisiana last year were in computer science.

 


Having organized two “Hour of Code” workshops here in town last December, we have seen this subject’s popularity with kids first hand. The feedback from the kids who attended these workshops was overwhelmingly positive: 90% reported that they enjoyed learning to code and wanted to learn more. 

That’s what NOLA CODE is here to offer. 

Code where the Kids are

NOLA CODE connects partnering community youth centers with teachers and professional coders.  Together, they will instruct the children in fun, engaging computer science activities.  These otherwise unavailable activities will be offered where the children already spend their time while out-of-school. 
 

Curriculum taught at NOLA CODE workshops fall into four categories:

  • Introductory Computer Coding
  • Robotics
  • Circuitry
  • And computer aided design with 3D printing

Our partner youth centers serve neighborhoods including

  • Hollygrove
  • The B.W. Cooper/ Calliope Projects
  • Central City
  • Hoffman Triangle
  • St. Roch
  • And the Lower 9th Ward

Who we are

Our team consists of qualified computer science professionals and youth mentors.

Our team includes:
Charlie Barnes; Community Manager
Travis Blotsky; computer and information technology teacher at Isidore Newman School,

Olin Gallet; freelance web developer,

and Alex Grant; a career roboticist and robotics educator.

NOLA CODE will work with former Tulane professor Dr. Calvin Mackie. 
Dr. Mackie, alongside our advisory committee, will help shape the curricula and design the workshops.

Support is provided from our partners and sponsors, which include STEM NOLA, AmeriCorps Alums NOLA, Public Lab, and the Royal Bank of Canada

Our Plan

NOLA CODE plans...

  • To reach 25 underprivileged kids grades K-12th this fall semester
  • Reach 150 kids by years end 2016
  • Create a matching 1:1 financial sponsor arrangement between affluent and underprivileged children
  • Teach 20-60 workshops per semester at participating youth centers
  • That’s 1-3 classes per week
  • And to measure our progress based on feedback surveys from students and parents

As for our project timeline:

  • NOLA CODE will spend the next few months focusing on outreach and fundraising
  • We will then launch the pilot phase at 1 youth center this upcoming fall
  • We plan to expand to 1 or 2 more youth centers in the new year 2016
  • Offering workshops at all 4 participating youth centers by next fall

The total startup cost for this pilot phase is $5,000.
This money will be spent primarily on staff and equipment.

  • At $1,000 we can teach web development with MIT Scratch and some 3D printing
  •  At $3,000 we can fund the minimal costs for the 20 week semester, with nothing left for our plan for long term viability
  • Only at $5,000 can we pack an entire 20 week pilot semester, with all the activities the community wants, with enough left over for planning our viability through the new year.

To cut costs we will share resources with our partners.

For example, the youth centers have roughly 100 existing computers available for the workshops.

Our continued financial sustainability thereafter will rely upon a 1:1 sponsorship arrangement. 
For every child who pays to attend the workshops another child, who qualifies for free or reduced lunch, will attend for free.

NOLA CODE is ready to go.

With your help, we can better prepare New Orleans’ children for the jobs of tomorrow.
Thank you!
story_txt:
NOLA CODE is a fiscally sponsored, non-profit initiative to bring educational
workshops in computer science to children in New Orleans.
Code is in Demand
Demand for computing jobs is growing at twice the rate of all
other jobs in America. 
And it’s growing at 5
times the rate in Louisiana. 
Software development, for instance, is our state’s fastest growing job market.
Unfortunately, Louisiana’s children do not have adequate
opportunities to learn this important subject.
For instance, roughly 6 out of our 80 public schools offer computer science in
New Orleans.  None of our public
elementary schools teach it.  As a
result, only 0.3% of A.P. exams
taken in Louisiana last year were in computer science.

 Having organized two “Hour of Code” workshops here in town last
December, we have seen this subject’s popularity with kids first hand. The
feedback from the kids who attended these workshops was overwhelmingly
positive: 90% reported that they enjoyed learning to code and wanted to learn
more. That’s what NOLA CODE is here to offer.  

Code where the Kids
are
NOLA CODE connects partnering community youth centers with
teachers and professional coders. 
Together, they will instruct the children in fun, engaging computer
science activities.  These
otherwise unavailable activities will be offered where the children already
spend their time while out-of-school. 

  
Curriculum taught at NOLA CODE workshops fall into four
categories:


Introductory Computer Coding


Robotics


Circuitry


And computer aided design with 3D printing


Our partner youth centers serve neighborhoods including


Hollygrove


The B.W. Cooper/ Calliope Projects


Central City


Hoffman Triangle


St. Roch


And the Lower 9th Ward


Who we are 
Our team consists of qualified computer science professionals
and youth mentors.
Our team includes:
Charlie Barnes; Community Manager
Travis Blotsky; computer and information technology teacher at Isidore Newman
School,
Olin Gallet; freelance web developer,
and Alex Grant; a career roboticist and robotics educator.
NOLA CODE will work with former Tulane professor Dr. Calvin
Mackie.  
Dr. Mackie, alongside our advisory committee, will help shape the curricula and
design the workshops.
Support is provided from our partners and sponsors, which
include STEM NOLA, AmeriCorps Alums NOLA, Public Lab, and the Royal Bank of
Canada
Our Plan
NOLA CODE plans... 


To reach 25 underprivileged kids grades K-12th this fall semester

Reach 150 kids by years end 2016

Create a matching 1:1 financial sponsor
arrangement between affluent and underprivileged children


Teach 20-60 workshops per semester at
participating youth centers


That’s 1-3 classes per week


And to measure our progress based on feedback
surveys from students and parents


As for our project timeline:


NOLA CODE will spend the next few months
focusing on outreach and fundraising


We will then launch the pilot phase at 1 youth
center this upcoming fall


We plan to expand to 1 or 2 more youth centers
in the new year 2016


Offering workshops at all 4 participating youth
centers by next fall


The total startup cost for this pilot phase is $5,000.
This money will be spent primarily on staff and equipment.


At $1,000 we can teach web development with MIT
Scratch and some 3D printing


 At $3,000 we can fund the minimal costs for the 20 week semester, with nothing left for our plan for long term viability


Only at $5,000 can we pack an entire 20 week
pilot semester, with all the activities the community wants, with enough left over for planning our viability through the new year.


To cut costs we will share resources with our partners. 
For example, the youth centers have roughly 100 existing computers
available for the workshops.
Our continued financial sustainability thereafter will rely
upon a 1:1 sponsorship arrangement. 

For every child who pays to attend the workshops another child, who qualifies
for free or reduced lunch, will attend for free. 
NOLA CODE is ready to go.
With your help, we can better prepare New
Orleans’ children for the jobs of tomorrow. 
Thank you!

story:
i-Skool is a technology aimed at improving learning abilities by creating thinking tasks which correlates to physical activities. Based on current research, it has been proven that thinking, memorizing  and practicing cognitive skills while moving, enhances brain activity which leads to better learning.

 The product functions as an alternative and as a physical method for educating and   testing of students. The software will be distributed worldwide via UNESCO to        school districts, teachers and parents.  This will allow these people to design        education content that is specific for their communities. All of this content will be    stored and made available for others to use. I-Skool has started to create learning    templates which will be made available to all.

i-Skool is a platform based mobile learning solution enabling children and students from all over the world to enjoy an innovative and accessible educational learning system.

  •  i-Skool allows parents and teachers to design the Learning Materials and Content and to set goals, interaction levels and incentives.
  • i-Skool improves learning abilities by creating thinking tasks for all students from Kindergarten to College.

We believe  in giving all children a chance. Each day of school is an opportunity for a student to explore, learn and dream of a better future for themselves and for their communities.

The impact doesn’t end there. As children become educated, they not only change their own lives,but they transform their families and communities. Peace and understanding comes through education.When we give a child the ability to read we change the world.

We started i-Skool to make a real difference. When You Invest in one child you give a whole community the chance for a healthier, more hopeful and peaceful future. Education empowers children to break free from the cycle of poverty and make a sustainable difference in their lives, their families and their communities. 

Our perks

Start  your  free  trial !


 

We offer complete transparency regarding all matters and operations within the company. These are not just words. Our sponsors can participate in the "Privy Councilor" campaign, in which they become our consulting agents. Anyone can sign up for this campaign for $25 and become our Privy Councilor. Once a week, you will receive a letter with a detailed report on all company operations. The only condition, besides the $25 contribution, is your willingness to participate. We will keep you posted on all company matters and in return, we would like you to share your opinion regarding everything we tell you. Some information, appearing in our reports, will be marked as 'confidential'. It means that it's not intended to be shared with the general public. We totally rely on your common sense regarding the matter of publishing our company-related information.  The thing is - we're not naive, we just have trust in human awareness.

As you understand we know a thing or two about advertising, public relations, trade secrets and significance of avoiding prior disclosure.

But nevertheless, we are willing to take that chance, and for a good reason. The first reason is that we never had and currently don't have the funds required to run a full media campaign "promoting the product and the idea". It means that people don't have too many chances to learn about us. So, when we take this step, we are striving to solve this problem, at least partially.

The second aspect: our project is software-related. We don't have any newfangled gadgets you can show your friends and brag about , but we  do  have a Demo-Version, fighting spirit, a will to win and passion for implementing the i-Skool vision. No crowdfunding project has offered such degree of openness as we do. No one has dared to operate on this level until now. At least, we haven't encountered any project that would dare to do so.

The third aspect: we believe that for many parents, it is important to understand what and how their children are being taught. For all those interested, this is a great opportunity to find out in detail how educational projects really work, providing our children with an ability to study at home without school teachers and daily class routine. Most importantly, you will be able to make an impact, rather than being a bystander!

We have less than a month remaining to raise $15000. It can be done. We ask you to help us raise this amount of money. This is a request for helping us, this is not a demand. We will respect your choice, whatever it may be. Being completely honest, it is clear that we have the right to ask and you have the right to refuse. Everyone should act according to the willingness of taking a part in anything.

One last thing. This project, like many others, is aimed to make the world a better place. There are bunch of good projects that pursue similar goals. Let's support each other. Contact us, we will be happy to collaborate! The potential of any project depends on communication between the project owner and like-minded people.





         

               


Generation Y technology adoption to Mobile Learning (M-Learning) is a very impressive .The education system must go hand-in-hand with this trend. M-Learning provides students high levels of engagement while it can be adjusted to each students’ needs in terms of time, place and educational level.

In addition, M-Learning provides some unique interaction features including visual and audible capabilities, competition and teamwork.

Just the facts:

More then thirty-nine percent (39%) of all US educational organizations are already using some form of M-Learning. M-Learning’s annual growth rate is a most impressive twenty-nine percent (29.3%).

M-Learning is accessible 24/7/365 worldwide. M-Learning is 100% intuitive, encouraging collaboration with other students and interaction with teachers and mentors.

M-Learning is highly cost-effective in terms of time, content and Return on Investment (ROI).


The game play concept is simple - each action taken in the   test  is " mapped" or assigned to an image - recogized visual code (image,shape or color).

The visual codes are scattered at physical locations,some of which may be simply colored paper hung on walls, or colors of a specific person's shirt, images (or QR codes), placed or hidden in the classroom or exterior space.

Each player will hold a mobile device and will receive instructions from the application. This include: task's content, possible answers/ actions, and information regarding the visual code (i.e.mapping each answer to a certain color).

The nature of the task will be given to the student to instruct him to walk or run from code loaction to code location, in order to complete the given task. There might be a time limit for completing a task, or all of the tasks.

The location of the codes to one another, and their quantity, will ensure the answers adds up to a certain specific amount and that each student has completed the physical session.

The question types will include be Multiple Choice Questions (MCQ) or Match and Collect.The game can be played by single players or as a group which collaborates to solve the questions or in a competitive mode between players or groups.

Content creators will be free to use any topic they want to teach,  using pre-existing exercise or use any of the templates that i-Skool will create for tasks for their students. This will be done as a part of what we call the back office tool.

In addition the playing field will need to be set by the content creators, with mapping the visual codes that are around (or they will create new ones) to the database of tasks.

Start  your  free  trial !


              

VIDEO INSTRUCTION


   

   

       

_____________________________________________________________________________

The application will be divided into two parts: 

1. Game – The game itself,which the players will see.

 

2. Backoffice – from which the teachers can create and edit the quizzes


Back Office

There are three (3) types of questions that can be created:

1. MCQ (QUIZ)

Series of multiple choice questions : the content creator will choose the game name, number of questions, four (4) possible answers for each question, chooses which are correct and which are wrong, which input method that the player will scan (Color/QR/image),and set the timer for the game.


2. Collection: (still in the pipeline)

Collect answers/follow a process: each ingredient of the collection is linked to a color/QR code/Image, the content creator will choose a collection type- words/images/numbers, an input method (color/QR/image), if the item is relevant for the collection or not, the order of items in the collection, timer for the game and game name. 

3. Match: (still in the pipeline)

Match two: the answers are composed of pairs, which needs to get connected one to another (suitable for memory games,or vocabulary in a foreign language,for instance), the content creator will choose the match type-words/images/numbers, the input method - color/QRcode/Image, if the item is correct or not, write the question choose the match name and set the timer.

There are three (3) types of modes for each game:

1. Test Mode

There’s no competition between players. Suitable for plain, regular tests in an interactive form. Not time based.



2. Competition Mode

Time based tasks, the players compete against each other, there’s aclear winner at the end.

3. Collaboration Mode:(still in the pipeline)

Group play,the players will be divided into 2-4 groups and will solve tasks together (each team member will get one question they are in charge of,for example).

There are three (3) types of input methods that the content creator can choose from:

1. Colors

The players will be able to scan colors using their camera, in order to answer questions. The colors will be given randomly for each answer.


2. QR Code: (still in the pipeline)

The players will be able to scan QR codes using their camera, in order to answer questions, the content creator will create a QR code using a code generator, and The QR codes will be given randomly for each answer.

3. Image: (still in the pipeline)

The players will be able to scan images using their camera (image recognition) in order to answer questions. The content creator will choose an image they want from an existing gallery of images, or upload their own image.The QR codes will be given randomly for each answer.

Start  your  free  trial !



 



       

   


                             


Leading Edge Consultants:

Entrepreneurship, Business Strategy and Management Advisory Firm

In the last fifteen years Leading Edge Consultants provided entrepreneurship, business strategy and management consulting services to various hi-tech start-ups and joint ventures, including, the establishment, analysis and creation of their business strategy, business model, marketing research, applicable economical models and business plan, capital raising, etc. 

Leading Edge Consultants is headed by Reuven Ulmansky, a veteran of the elite 8200 technology intelligence unit of the Israeli Defense Force. Reuven is an aeronautical engineer and he holds an MBA degree. A strategy and economic consultant, Mr. Ulmansky is an adjunct Professor at the Guildford Glazer Faculty of Business & Management in Ben-Gurion University in Israel, teaching entrepreneurship, strategy and innovation. Reuven held a variety of senior managerial posts in large international and Israeli organizations such as IntelCorporation (Management Staff member and Director of Finance) and Koor Industries Pharmaceutical group (Senior Executive VP - Finance and Business Development), and served as a technology expert in Israel Aircraft Industries (Lavi fighter aircraft project). 


Playful Shark is a game development studio based in Israel. We have been creating games since 2004.

As a game development studio, we are constantly creating games, playing games and updating our  knowledge about games and the industry. We use our knowledge and experience to make the ocean a little more playful for sharks and other sea creatures.

Our games are tailored to our client's needs. We are committed to making the best games we can while bringing on board the best of local talent – creative minds, gifted artists and technology experts.

Playful Shark is part of Jivy Group, a boutique outsourcing software house for startups and entrepreneurs. 


Polina Milshtein, Vice President and Board Member

Ms. Milshtein has 13 years of experience in managing educational projects as well as advertising ones including the JCC (Jewish Community Center) of Toronto, the INO (Institute of Informal Education) in Jerusalem and the ICHEIC at the Jewish Agency for Israel.  She has also been employed as a Project Manager at 3 Capitals, a production center of concerts and festivals in Saint-Petersburg, Russia, the Leading Expert in the Commercial Directorate of Bank VTB North-West in Saint-Petersburg,Russia. She is an executive director in Kholmnvest. Holds a MA in Public Relations from the Academy of Civil Aviation in Saint-Petersburg, Russia.

David C. Lome, Board Member

David C. Lome is now primarily an educator. Through his many years of experience educating children young people and adults he has worked with many mobile learning systems and has contributed his knowledge of advances in mobile learning. Mr. Lome holds a Bachelor of Architect Degree and a Master’s of Architecture Degree from the University of Illinois.

Mary Gorbatov,CEO

Mrs. Gorbatov  is a marketing manager in the educational field. She is a member of the leader team that established Landmark Education in Israel for the Russian speaking population. She was a Project Manager in the leading advertising agency Adler, Chomski & Warshavsky, Israel. She also served as the Chief Project Manager in Migzarim Integrated Marketing Communication. She is currently participating in a social initiative of a food bank. Mrs. Gorbatov holds a BA in Mass Media and Social Sciences with a specialty in Advertising and Marketing from Bar-Ilan University in Israel.

     


There are dangers along the way…

Yes, there are dangers and challenges along the way, but we are determined to complete our mission. We have been asked: "Aren't you afraid to fail?" Of course we are afraid. But failing is not what we are afraid of. When people are motivated by a good cause, they will still succeed in doing something good. Maybe we will miss the deadline that we set for ourselves, but we will complete the mission. Let's agree that a 1-2 months delay regarding this project is normal. At least, it would be more honest, than to swear that everything will be perfect. We are not perfect, just as the world we live in is not perfect. But this world is beautiful and we want to make it even better! You will see - we can do it and we won't let you down!

If you can't help us by doing a good deed, then help us by showing support!

Send your people over to help us!

Share the link, tell your friends about us, mention us on your social network pages and test the application. Any contribution is extremely valuable! Thank you for reading this and thinking about the project at this very moment! 

Thank you for being there for us!






How to test the Demo Version at www.i-skool.com?

The demo version can be tested following the instructions located in the HELP CENTER.   Here we are publishing a detailed   manual    that include the following:

   Game  –  The game itself which the players will see.

   Backoffice  –  from which the teachers can create and edit the quizzes.

 

Can I donate from outside the USA?

Absolutely! Indiegogo  accepts international credit cards and PayPal ,  but not bank or debit cards. 

What payment methods do you accept?

Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards.

Is shipping included?
Yes

Internet all over the world

We are frequently asked how we are going to provide education to all the children in the world with our project, while Internet is not available everywhere.

The answer is simple. There are at least three   ambitious projects promising to provide Internet worldwide in the near future.

Here are the links to some of them:

http://www.google.com/loon/

http://www.zdnet.com/article/is-free-internet-coming-to-the-whole-world/

https://www.facebook.com/zuck/posts/10101322049893211

http://www.themarysue.com/tiny-cubesat-internet/

http://www.engadget.com/2014/11/08/wsj-elon-musk-internet-satellite/


Please support us! Every dollar helps!

Please visit  us and try our software!

Please share this campaign with everyone you know! Thank you!

Mrs. Gorbatov  is a marketing manager in the educational field. She is a member of the leader team that established Landmark Education in Israel for the Russian speaking population. She was a Project Manager in the leading advertising agency Adler, Chomski & Warshavsky, Israel. She also served as the Chief Project Manager in Migzarim Integrated Marketing Communication. She is currently participating in a social initiative of a food bank. Mrs. Gorbatov holds a BA in Mass Media and Social Sciences with a specialty in Advertising and Marketing from Bar-Ilan University in Israel.
     







There are
dangers along the way…
Yes, there are dangers and challenges
along the way, but we are determined to complete our mission. We have been asked:
"Aren't you afraid to fail?" Of course we are afraid. But failing is
not what we are afraid of. When people are motivated by a good cause, they will
still succeed in doing something good. Maybe we will miss the deadline that we
set for ourselves, but we will complete the mission. Let's agree that a 1-2 months delay regarding this project is normal. At least, it would be more honest,
than to swear that everything will be perfect. We are not perfect, just as the
world we live in is not perfect. But this world is beautiful and we want to
make it even better! You will see - we can do it and we won't let you down! 
If you can't help us by doing a good deed, then help us by showing
support! 
Send your people over to help us!
Share the link, tell your friends
about us, mention us on your social network pages and test the application. Any
contribution is extremely valuable! Thank you for reading this and thinking
about the project at this very moment! 
Thank you for being there for us!















How to test the Demo
Version at www.i-skool.com?


The demo version can be tested following the instructions
located in the HELP CENTER.   Here we are publishing a detailed 
 manual    that include the following:

   Game  –  The game itself which the players will see.
   Backoffice  –  from which the teachers can create and edit the quizzes. 



Can I donate from outside the USA?
Absolutely! Indiegogo  accepts international
credit cards and PayPal ,  but not bank or debit cards. 
What payment methods do you accept?
Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards.
Is shipping included?
Yes





Internet all over the 
world
We are frequently asked how we are 
going to provide education to all the children in the world with our project, 
while Internet is not available everywhere.
The answer is simple. There are at 
least three   ambitious projects promising to provide Internet worldwide in the near 
future.
Here are the links to some of 
them:




http://www.google.com/loon/
http://www.zdnet.com/article/is-free-internet-coming-to-the-whole-world/
https://www.facebook.com/zuck/posts/10101322049893211
http://www.themarysue.com/tiny-cubesat-internet/
http://www.engadget.com/2014/11/08/wsj-elon-musk-internet-satellite/




Please support us! Every dollar helps!
Please visit  us and try our software!
Please share this campaign with everyone you know! Thank you!

story:
Notre Projet / Our project

Créer un Dojo d'arts martiaux internes à Loos, près de Lille (Nord de la France). Un Dojo est un lieu pour "trouver sa propre voie, l'étudier et la pratiquer". De manière originale, notre école réunira dans un même centre :
  • des cours et des stages de Kung-Fu Bagua Zhang, Xing Yi Quan, Qi Gong, Tai Ji Quan et Dao Yin
  • des séances et ateliers de Shiatsu (technique de thérapie manuelle et énergétique japonaise)
  • des stages pluridisciplinaires (calligraphie chinoise, yoga, etc.)
  • une bibliothèque de livres sur les arts énergétiques et martiaux
  • des conférences sur le Shiatsu, le Feng Shui, les médecines naturelles, etc.
  • des rencontres autour d'initiatives alternatives favorisant le respect de la Nature, de l'être humain et de sa santé

Create a martial arts Dojo in Loos, near Lille (north of France). A Dojo is a place to "find one's own path, study it and practice it". In an original way, our school will combine in the same place :

  • Classes and workshops about Kung-Fu Bagua Zhang, Xing Yi Quan, Qi Gong, Tai Ji Quan and Dao Yin
  • Shiatsu sessions and workshop (hand and energetic japanese technique)
  • Multidisciplinary workshops (chinese calligraphy, yoga...)
  • A library of books about energetic and martial arts
  • Conferences about Shiatsu, Feng Shui, natural medicines...
  • Meetings to discuss alternative initiatives about respecting human beings, their health, and nature


Notre but / Our goal

"Un esprit sain dans un corps sain" !

Depuis 10 ans, notre école donne des clés pour développer un mode de vie plus équilibré et plus harmonieux. C'est essentiel pour les enfants, les jeunes et aussi pour les adultes dans la société actuelle !

Nous proposons une pratique de santé et/ou une pratique martiale. La base est commune : apprendre à habiter correctement son corps (ancrage, respiration, postures, détente), à retrouver une vraie souplesse dans le mouvement et à connaître son énergie pour la canaliser. La pratique permet de se découvrir et de développer certaines qualités (concentration, calme, confiance en soi, etc.).

"A healthy mind in a healthy body"
For 10 years now our school has been giving keys to develop a more balanced and harmonious lifestyle. It is essential for kids, teenagers and also adults in our society!

We propose a health practice as well as a martial one. They have a common basis : to learn to correctly inhabit one's body (rooting, breathing, postures, relaxation), to recover a real fluidity in motion and know one's energy to channel it. The practice allows one to discover oneself and develop some skills (concentration, calm, self-confidence...)


Nos besoins / What We Need

Nous avons trouvé un entrepôt de 200 m2 à louer. Il existe déjà deux pièces pour le Shiatsu et un sanitaire. Maintenant, pour pouvoir commencer notre activité nous avons besoin de 12 000 € pour construire un plancher de 100 m2. Le plancher sera en pin et aura le motif du Tao peint en son centre afin de travailler les marches du Bagua dessus. C'est la première étape !

Ensuite, nous aurons encore deux étapes pour finir les aménagements du Dojo :

  1. Créer deux vestiaires (hommes et femmes), une douche, un deuxième sanitaire et équiper la salle (extincteurs, sac de frappe, etc.)
  2. Puis il restera à installer avant l'hiver prochain des chauffages (au gaz) et un bureau pour la gestion administrative du Dojo

La totalité des travaux est estimée à 40 000 €.

We found a 200m² warehouse to rent. There are already two rooms for Shiatsu and a toilet room. Now, to be able to start our activity we need 12 000€ to set a wooden floor on 100m². The floor will be made with pine wood and will have a Tao drawn on its center, to help practice bagua walks on it. It's the first step !

Then we will have another two steps to complete the Dojo's makeover :

  1. Create two locker rooms (men and women), a shower, a second room for toilets, and equip the warehouse (fire extinguishers, punch-bags, ...)
  2. Finally, before next winter, install gas heating and a desk for the Dojo's management and administration
The total amount for all the makeover is estimated at 40 000€.


L'école Arkhelios / Arkhelios School

Notre école est animée depuis 2005 par une équipe de gens passionnés (professeurs, thérapeutes, étudiants). A travers tous nos projets, notre volonté est d'encourager les initiatives et activités qui respectent l'être humain, sa santé et la Nature. Nos fondations reposent sur certaines valeurs : courage, respect, persévérance, goût de l'effort, dépassement de soi, humilité, entraide, honnêteté. Website Arkhelios School

Pourquoi être présent sur IndieGogo ?
  • Notre équipe est constituée de créatifs qui défendent des valeurs éthiques et l'économie solidaire. Notre vœu est d'être autonome grâce à notre activité et des aides amicales sans passer par des emprunts bancaires.
  • La campagne Indiegogo est un moyen de rencontrer des gens qui portent les mêmes valeurs que nous et de partager cette aventure innovante avec eux.

Our school has been driven on since 2005 by a team of passionate people (professors, therapists, students). Through all our projects, our will is to encourage initiatives and activities which respect human beings, health and Nature. Our school is built on specific values : courage, respect, perseverance, enjoyment of hard work, overcoming of one's limits, humility, helpfulness, honesty.

Why being on IndieGogo ?

  • Our team is composed of creative people who defend ethic values and solidary economy. Our wish is to be autonomous thanks to our activity and friendly helps, without resorting to bank loans.
  • The IndieGogo campaign is a way to meet people caring about the same values and to share this innovative adventure with them.


Ce que vous recevrez / What you get ?

En soutenant notre projet, vous contribuez à diffuser des disciplines essentielles qui aident l'être humain à développer sa noblesse, ses forces et à mettre en action ses idées. Elles aident à vivre plus pleinement sa vie ! 

  • En retour, nous vous enverrons nos remerciements personnalisés et des contreparties originales qui apportent de belles énergies et harmonisent !
  • Nous vous tiendrons au courant de chaque étape de cette nouvelle aventure via Indiegogo, Facebook et notre site internet - Website Arkhelios
  • Et nous espérons de tout coeur vous accueillir au Dojo ! Venez vous entraîner avec nous !

Si nous n'atteignons pas complètement notre objectif, les fonds financeront dans tous les cas une partie du chantier de la création du Dojo et nous aurons le défi de chercher d'autres moyens pour continuer notre projet.

By helping us, you contribute to spread essential disciplines which help human beings to develop their nobility, their strengths, and to put their ideas into action. They help to live one's life to the fullest !

  • In return, we will send you our personalized thanks and original goodies which brings good energies and harmony !
  • We will give you feedbacks during each step of this new adventure via IndieGogo, Facebook and our website. - Website Arkhelios
  • And with all our heart, we hope to welcome you at the Dojo ! Come and train with us !

If we do not manage to reach our goal, the money will still be used to finance a part of the makeover and the Dojo creation, and then we will take on the challenge to find other ways to keep on with our project.


    Défis et avenir / Challenges and future

    Depuis des années, notre difficulté était de trouver des salles d'entraînement disponibles, suffisamment grandes et peu onéreuses. Le problème se posait chaque année. Dans notre région lilloise (Nord de la France) il y a un réel manque d'infrastructures par rapport aux besoins. Nous avons été obligé de limiter nos cours par manque de salles et d'espace. Depuis l'année dernière par exemple, nous organisons 5 cours par semaine dans une salle de 20 m2 (sans vestiaire) !

    • Grâce à ce Dojo de 100 m2, nous pourrons accueillir beaucoup plus de gens qui cherchent des activités complètes et enrichissantes.
    • Nous pourrons proposer des activités tous les jours
    • Nous animerons des conférences, des discussions et des rencontres pour communiquer davantage sur ces disciplines passionnantes mais peu connues en Europe
    • Et nous offrirons d'excellentes conditions d'entraînement !

    For many years, our difficulty has been to find available training places, large enough and not too expensive. The problem presented itself every year. In our "région lilloise" (north of France), there is a real lack of buildings considering the need. We have been forced to limit our trainings by lack of training room and space. For example, since last year, we organize five classes a week in a 20m² training room (without locker-room).

    • With this 100m² Dojo, we will be able to welcome much more people who are looking for complete and rewarding activities.
    • We will be able to propose many activities every day.
    • We will organize conferences, talks and meetings to communicate more about those fascinating but little known disciplines in Europe.
    • And we will offer excellent training conditions !


    D'autres façons d'aider / Another way to help us


    Merci de parler de notre projet autour de vous ! Pour faire circuler ce message, vous pouvez utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo ou partager notre video, page Facebook et site Internet.

    Merci ! Que la Force soit avec vous !

    Facebook Arkhelios - Website Arkhelios (french language)

    Make some noise about this campaign ! Please talk about our project around you ! To spread the message, you can use IndieGogo sharing tools, or share our video, Facebook page and website.

    Thank you very much ! May the Force be with you !

    Facebook Arkhelios - Website Arkhelios (french language)

story:
Lighthouse Learning Center - Teams of Tomorrow (TOT) Program

We are passionate about giving all children the strongest foundation, regardless of their level of ability.  Children with disabilities (i.e. Downs Syndrome, Autism, learning disabilities, Cerebral Palsy, hearing or visually-impaired or are delayed), and other typically-developing children all learn in an inclusive environment.  However, with limited funding, our ability to add extra programming for the children is restricted.  We need help to bring the TOT program, anchored in physical education, to our children to give them an alternate avenue to find personal success!

Please help us bring the TOT program to our children.  TOT integrates music, movement, sensory skills, behavioral skills and educational elements in an exciting class, that caters to the ever changing attention spans of children - especially those with ADD.  Most importantly, this program focuses on self-control, which is the largest factor in determining success once our children move to "big school" kindergarten.  

We believe in the power of all children.  You have the power to help our children realize their potential and acquire the skills necessary for developmental success.

The Give & Get

Raising a child with a disability can have an added financial and emotional strain on the family.  We are asking for $4,500 to bring the TOT program to our students - at no additional cost to their families.  If we can raise our full funding we can provide the program twice a week for one year, or once a week for two years. If we can raise at least half of our goal, we will still bring the program to our students once a week for a year. We appreciate you helping us reach our goals, so here's a little about what you get for what you give:

  • $25 donation - Website Listing - With a donation of $25, you will receive a public acknowledgement of our appreciation on the Challenge Enterprises website.  Whether you'd like to be recognized as a company or individual, we want to let the world know that you care.
  • $50 donation - Social Media Shout-out - With your donation of $50, you will receive not only our Website Listing, but also a Social Media Shout-out from both our Facebook and Twitter channels.  We are happy to promote your company, your message, or your story on who/what inspired you to get involved.  As gratitude for supporting us, we want to help spread the names of the people and companies who care.
  • $100 donation - Personalized Thank-You - On top of our Website Listing and Social Media Shout-out, your kind donation of $100 will earn a personalized, hand-written thank you card created by one of our students at Lighthouse Learning Center.  Feel the connection our children have with those that support the cause, and know our appreciation is endless.
  • $500 donation - Tour and On-site Lunch - As part of our top contributor level,  you will receive not only all of our lower tier perks, but be able to see first-hand the power of your donation.  Join our preschool director Melva Powell for a tour of the facility, meet our wonderful teachers and children, learn about the programs you help support and enjoy a lunch with those who directly feel the impact of your generosity.

Make a Difference

We believe in the Power of People and Possibilities.  Our campaign was created with the foundation that given the right opportunities, every child has the chance to find their own personal success, regardless of their level of ability.  Helping a child find that self-confidence is the most precious gift anyone can give.  

Since 1972, Lighthouse Learning Center's parent company, Challenge Enterprises, has been providing necessary developmental, work and residential opportunities to individuals with disabilities.  We have successfully fostered individuals through independent working and living situations and have championed competitors in Special Olympics and local programs.  Every day we strive to inspire our leaders to enact necessary policy changes to empower people living with disabilities.

For more information on Lighthouse Learning Center and Challenge Enterprises' successes, please visit our website. 

Overcoming Obstacles

Developmental experts like Jean Blaydes Madigan and Gail Dennison's research has shown that physical activities utilizing both sides of the brain, like the TOT program, encourage both hemispheres of the brain to work together and increase the number of synaptic connections.  In short, the brain learns better! 

However, many children with disabilities do not have access or resources for these types of vital programs that could positively impact their early development.  Aside from Lighthouse Learning Center's structured, specialized curriculum, the facility is also home to on-site therapy services (physical, occupational and speech pathology), nursing assistance and support services.  Helping us bring in a developmentally-appropriate physical education program will allow us to provide a fully-integrated educational construct.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that help comes in all forms.  If you are unable to make a monetary donation to our campaign, you can still help our children succeed! You can:

  • Share our campaign on your social media platforms - knowledge is power!
  • Enlist the help of your church, community, or civic groups to raise funds and awareness.
  • Give the gift of you.  Volunteer.

$25 donation - Website Listing - With a donation of $25, you will receive a public acknowledgement of our appreciation on the Challenge Enterprises website.  Whether you'd like to be recognized as a company or individual, we want to let the world know that you care.

$50 donation - Social Media Shout-out - With your donation of $50, you will receive not only our Website Listing, but also a Social Media Shout-out from both our Facebook and Twitter channels.  We are happy to promote your company, your message, or your story on who/what inspired you to get involved.  As gratitude for supporting us, we want to help spread the names of the people and companies who care.

$100 donation - Personalized Thank-You - On top of our Website Listing and Social Media Shout-out, your kind donation of $100 will earn a personalized, hand-written thank you card created by one of our students at Lighthouse Learning Center.  Feel the connection our children have with those that support the cause, and know our appreciation is endless.


$500 donation - Tour and On-site Lunch - As part of our top contributor level,  you will receive not only all of our lower tier perks, but be able to see first-hand the power of your donation.  Join our preschool director Melva Powell for a tour of the facility, meet our wonderful teachers and children, learn about the programs you help support and enjoy a lunch with those who directly feel the impact of your generosity.
    Make a Difference We believe in the Power of People and Possibilities.  Our campaign was created with the foundation that given the right opportunities, every child has the chance to find their own personal success, regardless of their level of ability.  Helping a child find that self-confidence is the most precious gift anyone can give.  
Since 1972, Lighthouse Learning Center's parent company, Challenge Enterprises, has been providing necessary developmental, work and residential opportunities to individuals with disabilities.  We have successfully fostered individuals through independent working and living situations and have championed competitors in Special Olympics and local programs.  Every day we strive to inspire our leaders to enact necessary policy changes to empower people living with disabilities.
For more information on Lighthouse Learning Center and Challenge Enterprises' successes, please visit our website. 
    Overcoming Obstacles Developmental experts like Jean Blaydes Madigan and Gail Dennison's research has shown that physical activities utilizing both sides of the brain, like the TOT program, encourage both hemispheres of the brain to work together and increase the number of synaptic connections.  In short, the brain learns better! 
However, many children with disabilities do not have access or resources for these types of vital programs that could positively impact their early development.  Aside from Lighthouse Learning Center's structured, specialized curriculum, the facility is also home to on-site therapy services (physical, occupational and speech pathology), nursing assistance and support services.  Helping us bring in a developmentally-appropriate physical education program will allow us to provide a fully-integrated educational construct.   Other Ways You Can Help We understand that help comes in all forms.  If you are unable to make a monetary donation to our campaign, you can still help our children succeed! You can:  Share our campaign on your social media platforms - knowledge is power! Enlist the help of your church, community, or civic groups to raise funds and awareness.
Give the gift of you.  Volunteer.

story:
MarbleJam Kids is raising money to offer children with Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASDs) and their families within Northern New Jersey the opportunity to participate in our creative arts therapy programs. 

OUR STORY

            
It is inevitable that you have learned more about the growing number of children and families affected by the challenges of autism. Here in our New Jersey communities the number of children with Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASDs) has risen to 1 in 45, 1 in 28 boys, which creates the likelihood that most of you have knowledge firsthand of the needs of these children and their families.

As mothers of children with ASDs, we founded MarbleJam Kids, a 501c3 nonprofit organization, as a call to action to provide responsible arts programming to children with Autism.  Established in 2007, the organization started with one signature after school arts program specifically designed for children with autism. 

Today, MarbleJam Kids is a NJ Division Developmental Disabilities (“DDD”) authorized service provider of creative arts therapies and enrichment programs for children of all ages: not only for those with ASDs, but also those with developmental disabilities and other special needs.  MarbleJam Kids Center for Creative Arts Therapy, located in River Edge, NJ, provides many creative options to meet the array of challenges families face with today's growing population of children in need. But in order to serve the many children with autism in our state, we need to add another location. 

           

MarbleJam Kids firmly believes that unlocking the creative potential and building a safety net of support for individuals of all ages with special needs is the key to success.  MarbleJam Kids has provided services to over 400 children over the past 8 years. Through collaboration with school districts and state agencies MarbleJam Kids continues to advocate program support for children and families in crisis.  All programs are supplemented through the fundraising efforts of its volunteer board of directors; the mission of which is to provide necessary support for all individuals to thrive as active participants in their own communities.  For more information about MarbleJam Kids, please visit www.marblejamkids.org.
WHAT WE NEED

We need another location within 30 miles of our current facility!
Without us, financially challenged families of children with special needs cannot access experience s that will change their lives.  These are the programs in need of your support - today!

- Musicoterapia, a music therapy program designed to meet the growing needs of the Hispanic community in Hudson County, NJ.  

- MarbleJam Respite Arts Program, an after school arts program to meet the needs of parents and guardians who disparately need time off and help with the care of their loved one. 

- MarbleJam Art Works, an arts program for adults with disabilities, focusing on life skills and pre-vocational training.  

In order for us to expand our reach we need your help to completely roll out these new offerings by July 2015!

WHAT YOU GET

 

Happy families and children who will thrive with creative opportunities!

With your support, you will have the option to receive direct communication with monthly updates from us - sharing details on those who are personally affected by your contribution. 

Check out some of the perks!

                             

  PLUS!!! - EVENT TICKETS, DONOR RECOGNITION, & MORE!

Most importantly, your contribution is a beautiful gift that provides lasting smiles...  


THE IMPACT
Continued support of our programs!

When you provide affordable options for creative exploration in individuals with special needs, you impact individual families and the communities at large.  This campaign will allow us to supplemental funding for programs, and to expand our reach into financially distressed communities where gaps in services leave developing children without opportunities for growth. These therapeutic opportunities, where kids learn and explore the arts as a means and tool for communication and well-being, give families hope.  The need and the potential is too great to ignore.  

Our staff is a key element!

MarbleJam Kids is growing and needs the assistance of professional staff to ensure successful outcomes.  The challenge in securing permanent staff is difficult when funding is not there.  We know that with your help, we may sustain supervision and continuity of care in our organization.

Other ways you can help!

We understand that not everyone can contribute, but here are other ways to get involved:

· Share our campaign with your friends, family, and community!

· Use Indiegogo Share Tools!

· Contact us about advocating, volunteering, or organizing a fundraising event that will benefit MarbleJam Kids!

 For more information about MarbleJam Kids, please visit www.marblejamkids.org.

story:
Who We Are

We believe that ESL education should be student-oriented and not for profit. 

Logos Language Center is an adult education organization dedicated to providing language learners with affordable, holistic language instruction through an innovative cultural lens. Our collaborative approach enables learners to define and express themselves with total communicative competency. Our multi-prism curriculum addresses the following:

  • academic preparedness 
  • professional growth
  • social engagement
  • cultural enrichment
Right now we're fundraising to get our mission started! We are a group of passionate, experienced teachers who have been working tirelessly to create a challenging, dynamic curriculum that focuses on the needs of our students. Our first endeavor will be a low-cost summer camp that helps prepare international students for the American college experience. We will focus on immersive, cultural experiences that help students develop language competency and self-confidence before entering an American college classroom. 

What We Need & What You Get

What are we fundraising for? 

  • A space! We're looking for a space to hold our camp. We're hoping to raise enough funds to book spaces that match the themes of our camp weeks. For example, for our film week, we're hoping to rent out a cinema and for our nature and conservation week, we're looking to get a covered space in one of Portland's beautiful parks. 
  • Outings! We believe that cultural experiences are a great way for students to learn and use language. Over our 4-week camp, we will take our students on trips to Portland cultural sights, nature hikes, and cultural/artistic excursions. Your donation will help defer costs of these outings. 
  • Materials! No classroom is complete without classroom materials. These funds will help pay for the costs of books, videos, papers, and other classroom materials. 
  • Overhead! No one likes to think of charitable organizations needing overhead, but the truth is, they do. We'd love all of our money to go to our program, but as a new school, we have a few startup costs that need to be taken care of. First and foremost, we're in the process of applying for non-profit status and will be using some of these funds to pay for that application. 
  • Future Funding! Anything that we make over our goal will go towards funding future Logos Language projects. 
What do you get for helping us? 

  • Other than the knowledge of helping high school seniors from around the world facilitate their dreams of studying abroad and helping us towards our future mission....
  • Take a look on the side to see what you get for your donation! 

The Impact

With more and more international students coming to American universities every year, the need for collegiate preparation courses is undeniable. All of us here on staff have worked in pre-university ESL programs and found that cultural adjustment can be incredibly difficult for new students. We want to help remove some of the anxiety that comes with studying abroad. We will teach students critical skills including: 

  • the culture of the American college classroom
  • American culture norms 
  • socialization skills
  • study habits 
  • English language training
Long term, we're looking to make a larger community impact. The two branches we've seen in the ESL community are academic ESL programs and community ESL programs. In our experience, academic programs are generally for-profit and focus on meeting the needs of university-bound international students. Community programs generally target lower level students. We want to fill the void in the market. We hope to provide challenging ESL classes to local students at all levels. We hope to schedule our classes to meet the needs of working professionals in the Portland metro area. Our curriculum will be focused on meeting their needs. 

Risks & Challenges

We are experienced teachers who are embarking on a brand new endeavor. There will undoubtedly be bumps and challenges along the way, but our communal approach will help us through them. 

  • We approach all situations from a collaborative approach. Not only our board, but our students and volunteer staff will have a voice in the decisions made for the school. We greatly appreciate any and all feedback and will use each challenge as an opportunity for growth. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is not the only way to help! 

  • Get the word out! Direct people to our fundraising page and help us meet our goal.
  • Like us! Go and like our Facebook page: 
    https://www.facebook.com/logoslanguage
  • Get connected! Do you know of a local business owner who would like to build a partnership with a local non-profit? Direct them to info@logoslanguage.org

story:
"Our goal is that this worthy project will creates better, healthier and happier futures for Nigerian children in general"

The rate at which Nigeria school children dropout of school in primary level is very alarming, many factors are responsible which demands our attention to this cause. 

Formal education is the hierarchically structured, chronologically graded ‘education system’, running from primary school through the university and in addition, to general academic studies, a variety of specialized programmes and institutions for full-time technical and professional training.

The standard of education of any country is largely dependent on the standard of public schools in that country. Simply put, public schools are the yardsticks by which a country’s educational growth and development is measured.

It is not no longer news anymore that government alone cannot give the qualitative and quantitative education that we aspire in this nation, hence, stakeholders in the sector, non-governmental organisations and companies should rise up to the challenge and fulfil their social responsibilities.

Any cause that is geared towards the betterment of education, especially for Nigeria, always gets our attention, hence our presence here is to raise funds for renovation of 12 public primary schools in Kwara state, Nigeria. These public primary schools need proper renovation , did you see the ceilings in the picture? Did you see the children sitting on the floor? This is due to lack of furniture, the classrooms have neither doors nor windows. Paint on the walls has peeled off from too many neglect. 

You can see that they are not in good condition at all. It is an eye score.

Many parents these days don't like the idea of sending their children to public school due to lack of good infrastructure and proper training equipments as well as poor school environments in the public schools unlike the private schools that is well equipped for better learning.

Our Investigations report, however revealed that most of the schools major challenges are furniture, doors, Windows, ceilings and the toilets in most of the schools is nothing to write home about, they lack functional toilets and are disfigured with human faeces. This faeces leak from rusted pipes, polluting the compound with a foul odour. 

A safe, clean and well maintained school with a positive psychosocial climate and culture can foster school connectedness, which in turn boosts pupil and staff health as well as pupil's educational achievement. 

We are determined to restore the golden age of the public primary school system by raising funds to carry out this great project.


List of selected schools for this project

  1. Renovation of community  primary school, igosun
  2. Renovation of community  primary school, iwoye
  3.  Renovation of community  primary school, igbonna
  4. Renovation  of muslim  community  primary school, ira
  5. Renovation of  Ebenezer primary school, Erin-lle
  6.  Renovation of  Baptist primary school, Erin-lle
  7. Renovation of  St. peter primary school, ira
  8.  Renovation of  Community primary school, Asipa
  9. Renovation of  Ansaru islam primary school, ikotun
  10. Renovation of  AUD ‘A’ primary school, Adeleke
  11. Renovation of  Nodadic primary school, Bakin
  12. Renovation of Community primary school, Tanke

All schools are located in kwara state, Nigeria


How the fund will be spend 

As soon as we have reach our goal of raising the fund, the fund will go to the affected schools we have selected by purchasing materials and equipment's needed for renovation of each schools.  

Breakdown 

  1. Renovation of toilet building and Purchase of new toilets
  2. Re-plastering and painting of the walls
  3. Fixing of new ceilings in each classrooms
  4. Rewiring of the classrooms  
  5. Fixing of lights and ceiling fans in each classrooms
  6. Purchase of new doors
  7. Fixing of new windows
  8. Purchase of new classroom boards ( white board) 
  9. Purchase of classroom furnitures
  10. Fencing of some schools without fence and gate


Your supports can truly make it happen...please help us achieve our goal of raising funds for this propose.  We love you,,,,

Leaders of Tomorrow

Pupil Making Use of Table as Chair

Pupil making use of toilet

School Toilet

School Toilet

story:
Short Summary

Hey Friends, 

It is Safeer here. I am working on a girls education program for nearly 10 years now here in Pakistan. We started with sending just 20 girls to secondary school back in 2006. In 2009, we were helped by Girls Education International, and managed to send another batch of 30 girls to secondary school. As they completed their secondary education, we added another batch of 100 girls from 5 villages to secondary schools in district Chakwal, Pakistan.   

I have tried my best to help as many people individually as possible. Through experience, I have learnt that people are willing to support boys' education, but very few in Pakistan are willing to support girls education. Hence, I launched this girls education project. I received immense support from Bedari, and Girls Education International. You can find information about previous successes here: 

Girls' Post Primary Level Education Program

Girls Education Program - First phase completed 

Girls Education Program - Second phase launched 
Bedari inducts 30 more girls to its Girls Education Program
Shabana - the girl saved from teenage marriage through education program


Why Girls Education! 

Girls' Post Primary Education is the most effective and sustainable way to deal with poverty. More education means lesser chances of child marriage. If a girl is allowed to grow up into a mature and educated person, she would be better able to manage her family and take care of her children. She would have the understanding of, and the access to family planning methods. Thus small family would mean healthy mother able to feed her children properly. The next generation would be better off than the previous one. 

When you educate one girl, you take a family out of poverty. You make sure that the next generations of that family are not poor.  

What We Need 

The mathematics of girls education is simple. The cost of sending one girl to school for one year is US $ 240. It includes her traveling, uniform and shoes. The books are provided free of cost by the government, while tuition fee is nominal,and usually parents can afford that. 

Sending 1 girl to school for 1 year: GBP 156

Sending 1 girls to school for 5 years: GBP 156 x 5 = 780 

Sending 100 girls to school for 5 years: GBP 780 x 100 = 78,000 

*Administrative Cost for 1 year: GBP 4000

Administrative Cost for 5 years: $ 4000 x 5 = 20,000 

Total: 78,000 + 20,000 = GBP 98,000 

 *Administrative Cost: It included the cost incurred by Bedari for managing the project. We need to hire at least one female who registers girls, and monitors their progress. She makes sure that the poorest of the poor girls get benefit from our program, they remain in school, and are performing well. 

If we do not reach our goal, the funds collected would be handed over to Bedari to add benefits for the girls already studying under this project. These benefits include study tours, and awareness sessions on women rights. 

Risks & Challenges

As we are already running this project for several  years, there is little that can go wrong. Families usually do not like to get charity, so we have already pitched this project as a scholarship program. A girl has to have at least primary education to qualify for the scholarship to study in the secondary school in the nearby town. 

Please note that primary school exists in almost every village, and girls do attend primary school as it does not involve traveling to another town/village. But when it comes to secondary education, it becomes difficult for girls to travel to another village. Please see my blog I wrote on these issues over a year ago: Girls Education - Observations at the grassroots 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot constribute financially, it does not mean you cannot help. Please:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Girls Education Program - First phase completed 
Girls Education Program - Second phase launched 
Bedari inducts 30 more girls to its Girls Education Program
Shabana - the girl saved from teenage marriage through education program

Why Girls Education! 
Girls' Post Primary Education is the most effective and sustainable way to deal with poverty. More education means lesser chances of child marriage. If a girl is allowed to grow up into a mature and educated person, she would be better able to manage her family and take care of her children. She would have the understanding of, and the access to family planning methods. Thus small family would mean healthy mother able to feed her children properly. The next generation would be better off than the previous one. 
When you educate one girl, you take a family out of poverty. You make sure that the next generations of that family are not poor.  
What We Need 
 The mathematics of girls education is simple. The cost of sending one girl to school for one year is US $ 240. It includes her traveling, uniform and shoes. The books are provided free of cost by the government, while tuition fee is nominal,and usually parents can afford that. 
Sending 1 girl to school for 1 year: GBP 156
Sending 1 girls to school for 5 years: GBP 156 x 5 = 780 
Sending 100 girls to school for 5 years: GBP 780 x 100 = 78,000 
*Administrative Cost for 1 year: GBP 4000
Administrative Cost for 5 years: $ 4000 x 5 = 20,000 
Total: 78,000 + 20,000 = GBP 98,000 
 *Administrative Cost: It included the cost incurred by Bedari for managing the project. We need to hire at least one female who registers girls, and monitors their progress. She makes sure that the poorest of the poor girls get benefit from our program, they remain in school, and are performing well. 
If we do not reach our goal, the funds collected would be handed over to Bedari to add benefits for the girls already studying under this project. These benefits include study tours, and awareness sessions on women rights. 
Risks & Challenges
 As we are already running this project for several  years, there is little that can go wrong. Families usually do not like to get charity, so we have already pitched this project as a scholarship program. A girl has to have at least primary education to qualify for the scholarship to study in the secondary school in the nearby town. 
Please note that primary school exists in almost every village, and girls do attend primary school as it does not involve traveling to another town/village. But when it comes to secondary education, it becomes difficult for girls to travel to another village. Please see my blog I wrote on these issues over a year ago: Girls Education - Observations at the grassroots    Other Ways You Can Help If you cannot constribute financially, it does not mean you cannot help. Please:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary 

The Community School included hundreds of people during the years 1973 - 2010.
Graduates are organizing a Reunion through a Facebook Page: 2015 BIG CSchool Reunion. This campaign is to pay for a rental location, a banquet, T-Shirts, and hats. No individual is benefitting from this campaign. Funds will be collected by Dora Lievow, founder and former co-director of The Community School. Any balances will be donated to supplies during the reunion weekend.
Contributions of $25 or more will reserve a T-shirt(s) or hat(s) to be available at the Reunion.
Please use Indiegogo's Share tools to spread the word to those who may not yet be contacted! Can't wait to see you in July.

story:
For millenium, we've adorned.

One of the first artifacts of history is a 50,000 year old necklace found in Spain in 2010.  Why do we adorn ourselves? It's a social identity card that expresses our beliefs, heritage, marital and social status, and even our wealth.

I make jewels.

I started gathering elements and beads when I was in the Peace Corps, working as an English teacher in Eastern Europe in the very early 90's. I used to gather bits from different cultures to tell a story: one of my first pieces was with Russian amber and US southwestern turquoise- I called it "Peace on a String." Since then, our line has sold in over 300 stores in the US and internationally, from Bloomingdale's to Oilily, from specialty stores to museum shops.

We want to showcase indigenous

jewelers from all over the world, learn about their history, traditions, and cultures. Then, if they will have me, I'd like to create a collection with them, and present new ideas based on the ancient in the global marketplace. This campaign will take us to reservations in New Mexico and Arizona to visit Hopi, Zuni, and Navajo jewelers.

With gratitude, we offer

the following incentives.  Our journey would not be possible without your generous support.  

In our quest,

we want to honor the work of our collaborators with only the finest materials.


Help us get the word out.

Would you share our idea with your friends? Click below on your favorite sites.  We thank you!

story:
Libros pa Djabraba (Books for Brava)

We have collected over 2000 books to set up ten free little libraries across Brava. We have volunteers on the island building the physical structures. All the arrangements are in place to send the books by boat from New Bedford, MA to Brava, Cape Verde but we need your help. 
We had a partner covering the cost of shipping but unfortunately, they are no longer able to do so. 

The boat leaves at the end of the month and we need to pay the shipping company by the end of next week! 


This all-volunteer labor of love is being lead by my amazing mom who left Brava over 50 years ago when she was 11 years old. 

                     (Mom and family leaving Brava in 1963)
After getting her Ph.D. at Georgetown University, working in international development and literacy -- and raising me and my brother! -- my mom is now on a mission to provide free access to books for kids and adults in the community back in Brava. 

Our partners in Brava and in the US already include the Mayor's Office and the Community Development Associations in Brava, Casa da Saudade branch of the New Bedford Public Libraries, Minisu di Scola Materna, Copy Masters Inc., J & P Graphics, as well as a number of our friends and family members who have generously volunteered their time and books. 

                                             (Mom and Me)
All we need now is your help to cover the expense of packing and shipping the books.

Brava is the smallest and most isolated of the Cape Verde Islands with no airport and extremely limited boat transportation. Brava has one small municipal library that is not well stocked and not physically accessible to most of the people on the island. 

                                 (Library #2621, Mountlake Terrace, Washington)

This first effort will open 10 little free libraries in each of the towns across the island, with books in Portuguese and English (for those who have returned to Brava) ranging from children's picture books to novels and non-fiction books on health and wellness, etc. 

On behalf of my mom and all of our volunteers in Brava and in the US, thank you for your support!

Andrea

story:
Who? Sikh Youth Association 
What?  Hosting it's 3rd annual Seattle Sikh Turban Day 
Where? Seattle Center, International Fountain  
305 Harrison Street, Seattle, WA 98109
When? August 20, 2016
11:30am - 6:00pm 

  • Why should you care?  Sikhism is one of the youngest amongst the major world religions. Sikhism is the fifth-largest religion in the world and is based on the spiritual teachings of Guru Nanak, the first Guru, and the ten successive Sikh gurus.

  • The sad truth? With Sikhism being the 5th largest religion in the world not many American's up until today know who a Sikh is or even how to distinguish one. 

  • What can you do? Come out if your in the Seattle area on August 20, 2016 to get a free turban tied on and learn how cool Sikhs really are! This event's mission is not to convert anyone rather it's an educational experience for all. Attendance is open to the entire Seattle community and all are welcome to attend! 

  • What to expect? There will be free food, appetizers, bouncy houses, henna artists, gatka (martial arts) performances and most importantly cool turbans available in all types of colors for everyone!! You don't want to miss out!! 

I'm interested! What can I do?

The Sikh Youth Association is strictly for the community and run by the youth living in Seattle, WA. We cannot launch this great project by ourselves and are asking the community to show some love and support a great cause/event!

  • The venue that we have picked will be the International Fountain located at the Seattle Center. The fee's + insurance + permits that are involved are something that we cannot avoid! We have broken down the expenses for your reference below!
Seattle Center Costs Rental Fee for the whole day from 6:00am - 9:00pm: $5,100 
Marketing Expenses:  (brochures, flyers, advertising, news media, etc.)
$500
Tents, tables, chairs:  ( rental fees, delivery + setup)
$1000
Turbans:
$2,000
Miscellaneous: ( transportation, food, setup, breakdown, water)
$1,400
                               The Impact
                      <<   Previous events outcomes and success? >>
  • From the previous turban day events we reached an audience at each event of 1,000+ individuals who not only had turbans tied on but were taught the meaning behind Sikhism at the International Fountain!
  • Through social media platforms many participants showed support for this event re-tweeted, posted pictures and offered thanks for hosting such an educational event!
  • We have return attendees from previous years that come out and show support and say thanks. 

                      Other Ways You Can Help

We are always looking for hands on individuals who can assist us in the many operations tasks needed prior to the event. If you would like to volunteer your time please send us an email at sikh.youth.association1699@gmail.com  and a member of our team will reach out to you shortly!

story:
After studying Television production at Adam Smith college, it was clear to me that Acting was my biggest passion, it still is after 7 years. With a number of amateur dramatics and college productions now behind me, plus 3 years of Acting at Dundee college and years of applying and failing to get into drama school; this was my final year, my last attempt at really making a go of it and it's finally paid off!
The lovely folks at Drama Studio London have offered me a place on their 2 year course, which begins October 26th of this year. Unfortunately there is no student finance funding available for my course, which means I have to do it the old fashioned way, by appealing to various trusts, charities, foundations and loans to help me along the way.
I'm also traveling back to my home town of St. Andrews over the summer, where I'll be working full-time and living at home to help save the pennies.
Although all this will help me on my way, I'll need that final push from family, friends and friends of family and friends to help me reach my £10,200 goal for my first year of study. Every penny will make the world of difference, believe me. 
I'm not asking for a fortune, don't worry, just whatever you can afford and if you can't afford anything, that's fine too. You can simply help by just sharing my campaign with your family and friends and seeing they pass on the message as well.
If everything goes to plan, my two years at DSL will help me well on my way to the next stage of my professional acting career; and what will make it even more special is the backing I'll receive from you beautiful people. Which honestly will mean the world to me.

story:
Short Summary

  • This campaign has been developed to celebrate the commencement of Thomas Kollie, Jason Lumague, and Lavelle Roberts from California State University Northridge.
  • This celebration highlights the journey and achievements of Thomas, Jason, and Lavelle as the complete their Bachelors and Masters Degree. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • All contributions will be geared towards providing a holistic commemorating experience for everyone. 
  • This experience will not only allow us to celebrate the commencement with those involved but also experience the beautiful Los Angeles Marina. Enjoy good music, dancing, drinks and each other. 
  • All contributions will fund the celebration.  

The Impact

  • Although this event celebrates the achievements of Thomas, Jason, and Lavelle. It also recognizes the support of friend and family throughout their journey. 
  • All contributions will help acknowledge the sacrifices and dedication these scholars put forth towards their education. 
  • These young individuals have not only worked hard to achieve their goals but spent countless efforts outreaching and mentoring disadvantaged students at CSUN.

story:
mRNS.hu

mRNS.hu is a community and information portal for hungarian biologists and other life science experts. We have started in 2009, since then 4000 out of the 5000 professionals in Hungary have signed-up to mRNS.hu.

We offer news, scientific updates, job opportunities, grant opportunity news, a forum and many other services and functions for our users. We play an important role in the hungarian life science community.

Our goal

We wish to refurbish the website, we would like to create a brand new design instead of the current one. We also wish to expand our services and refurbish the script of the site.

We wish to refurbish our CMS, the control panel of the site, expand our services with a who-is-who function, every professional can introduce him or herself on the site and also his or her professional workplace. The list of our planned new services is long, the space provided here is not enough.

The main point of the refurbishment is to get a totally new design for the site and to expand our services. We wish to serve the life science community even better with up-to-date, modern services and tools.
