story:
Short Summary

Paths Ahead is the Third Annual Anthology of 8th Grade Poetry from students of De Marillac Academy in the Tenderloin neighborhood of San Francisco.  Check out the YouTube link for a video of the voices of 8th graders from the first two volumes of poetry

De Marillac Academy educates low-income, underserved children, youth, and families of the Tenderloin and surrounding communities through an innovative school program and a dynamic graduate support program that continues through high school and beyond.

De Marillac Academy's business model is unique.  We are a non-tuition driven school that serves exclusively low-income families.  Ninety-five percent of our operating budget comes from donations.


What We Need & What You Get

We need to cover the design and printing costs of the first 750 copies of this anthology.  The total cost is $7,500.  For every $100 donation, you will receive a copy of all three anthologies of poetry!

The Impact

We want to publish this book in order to demonstrate to our youth poets how important their voices are for our collective future.  Their teacher writes in the foreword, "Language is one of the most essential parts of who we are.  Yet, how often do we allow ourselves the chance to stop and contemplate the wealth of words that surrounds us, what they mean and where they lead?  The anthology . . . is your invitation to feel the power of words, and to be an active participant in the calls for transformation that spring from its pages."

story:
[IN PERSIAN BELOW]

Abadan, Iran is special. Across the world, thousands cherish memories of life in what was once a cosmopolitan beacon of modernity in the Middle East, longing for the places, spaces and faces of the city. And yet, Abadan is today a city largely forgotten by the world.

Let us reintroduce Abadan to the world by documenting its fascinating history; bringing its past to life through pictures, essays, videos and art; letting scholars share their knowledge; and letting everyone share their memories and experiences.

Let Abadan be retold so that future generations can draw from the lessons of the city, understand the historical processes it embodies and envision a peaceful future where Abadanis, whether Iranian or non-Iranian, whether in Abadan or abroad, can come together and recreate the magic of the oil city for all to experience and learn from.

Abadan:Retold is an innovative, multi-media social history project invented and managed by me, Rasmus Christian Elling (PhD). I am a Professor of Iranian Studies at the University of Copenhagen, Denmark, fluent in Persian and have lived in Iran. As a scholar of modern Iran and urban studies, I came across Abadan through my research in 2011, and since, I have explored the city’s history through oil company and state archives, newspapers, diplomatic reports, novels and biographies, as well as through fieldwork and interviews in Abadan. To understand why I am so fascinated by Abadan, please read my essays here.

A crucial part of the Abadan Retold project is an online portal (www.abadan.wiki) with multiple functions:

- The AbadanMap: a multi-layered interactive map based on GIS data, human data and historical information, drawing on a broad range of maps from open sources and from historical archives;

- Encyclopaedia Abadanica: an archive of research-based articles by excellent scholars on all aspects of Abadan’s history, from ancient times to present-day, as well as on Abadani popular culture;

- MemoryLine: a user-driven history wiki – an open platform on which everyone can share memories and knowledge through comments, essays, interviews and pictures, and where you can discover new faces or re-connect with old friends.

Abadan:Retold is part of a larger research project on documenting the history of Abadan in a global context, for which I have already received a grant of 13,000 USD from the Danish Arthur Christensen Foundation. Now I need a further 10,000 USD to make the public part of the project come true.

I am handpicking a team of excellent scholars around the world to conduct research and write articles; a geographer and a GIS expert to create the maps; a web designer to create a well-functioning portal; and artists to make beautiful pieces of collage art that can bring Abadan to life. My plan is that the framework we develop for Abadan:Retold be made available open source to the public so that other cities can use it too.

The initial grant covers research in archives in the UK, the US, Switzerland and Iran; one lecture and a seminar on Abadan's history (in Denmark and the US); basic cost of website design; and a contribution to the publication of a coffee table book.

The final 10,000 USD that I hope to raise now is to finance the following:

  • Remuneration for scholars writing articles (approx. 15 articles): USD 3,000
  • Design of wiki database and maps (including technical equipment, re-scanning of original sources etc.): USD 4,000
  • Design of artwork for website and for perks: USD 3,000

The funds raised here will go directly to a project account in University of Copenhagen.

In the second stage of the project, I am designing a beautiful coffee table book with high-resolution pictures, fold-out maps, artwork and essays on Abadan; and preparing an exhibition that will hopefully travel around Europe, the US and Iran. More details will be published soon.

For now, I hope that you will support with a donation and share this appeal with your networks so that we together can let Abadan be retold!


آبادان، ایران شهر خاصی است. در سراسر جهان، هزاران نفر با خاطره این شهر که زمانی پیشرو تجدد در خاورمیانه بود زندگی می کنند و در خاطرات خود، به محله ها، جاها، و تصاویرش فکر می کنند. از طرفی اما، آبادان امروز شهری است که گویی جهان فراموشش کرده

بیایید با هم آبادان را باز به دنیا معرفی کنیم. از طریق مستندسازی تاریخ این شهر سحرانگیز و زنده کردن گذشته اش از طریق عکس ها، نوشته ها، ویدیوها و هنرهای دیگر، آبادان را به همه بشناسانیم. دانشمندان و متخصصان دانششان را در این زمینه عرضه می کنند و همه می توانیم خاطرات و تجربیاتمان را به اشتراک بگذاریم.

بگذاریم داستان آبادان بازگویی شود تا نسل های آینده بتوانند از درسهایی که از این شهر آموخته ایم استفاده کنند، تاریخ اجتماعی آن را متوجه شوند، و به آینده صلح آمیزی فکر کنند که آبادانی ها، چه ایرانی و چه غیرایرانی و چه در آبادان و چه خارج از آن، بتوانند جادوی شهرنفتی را دوباره زنده کنند تا همه بتوانند از تجربه هایش بیاموزند.

بازگویی آبادان پروژه ای خلاقانه و چندوجهی است در مورد تاریخ اجتماعی که توسط من، راسموس کریستیان الینگ (دکترای ایرانشناسی) پرداخته شده. من استاد مطالعات ایرانسناسی در دانشگاه کپنهاگ دانمارک هستم و در ایران زندگی کرده ام و فارسی را به راحتی صحبت می کنم. به عنوان محقق تاریخ ایران مدرن و مطالعات شهرنشینی، در سال 2011 در ضمن تحقیقاتم به آبادان برخوردم و از آن زمان، تاریخ این شهر را مطالعه کرده ام. من برای این مطالعه از مدارک آرشیو شرکت نفت و مدارک آرشیوهای دولتی، روزنامه ها، گزارشات دیپلماتیک، داستان ها و زندگی نامه ها، و تحقیقات محلی و مصاحبه های شخصی بهره برده ام. برای درک علاقه من به آبادان، لطفا نوشته هایم را در اینجا بخوانید.

قسمت بسیار مهمی از پروژه بازگوی آبادان، پایانه اینترنتی است که چند هدف مختلف را دنبال می کند

آبادانمپ: یک نقشه چندلایه تعاملی که برمبنای داده های

GIS

 داده های انسانی، و اطلاعات تاریخی ساخته شده و از نقشه های قابل دسترسی عمومی و بایگانی های تاریخی نیز بهره می برد.

دانشنامه آبادانیکا: بایگانی مقالات تحقیقی نوشته شده توسط متخصصان درجه اول در مورد همه وجوه تاریخ آبادان، از دوره باستان تا امروز، و همچنین مقالاتی در مورد فرهنگ عامه آبادان.

لین خاطرات: یک ویکی کاربرمرکز؛ یک پایانه متن باز که در آن همه می توانند خاطرات و دانسته های خود را از طریق نظرات، مقالات، مصاحبه ها، و تصاویر به اشتراک بگذارند. در ضمن جایی که می توانید با دوستان قدیمی ارتباط برقرار کنید یا با دوستان جدید آشنا شوید.

بازگویی آبادان بخشی از یک پروژه گسترده تر است برای مستندسازی تاریخی آبادان در بستر تاریخ جهان است. پروژه کاملا غیر انتفاعی می باشد و تا به حال یک پشتوانه مالی 13000 هزاردلاری از موسسه خیریه دانمارکی «بنیاد ایرانشناسی آرتور کریستنسن» دریافت کرده ام. در این مرحله، به 10000 دلار دیگر احتیاج دارم تا بخش عمومی این پروژه را راه اندازی کنم.

گروهی از محققین مجرب را از سراسر جهان دست چین کرده ام تا در مورد آبادان تحقیق کنند و مقاله بنویسند، گیتاشناس و متخصص GIS انتخاب کرده ام که نقشه ها را بسازند، و طراح وبی که بتواند پایانه کارآمادی را بسازد. در کنار این، هنرمندانی را هم یافته ام که بتوانند قطعات هنری زیبایی بسازند و آبادان را دوباره زنده کند. هدف نهایی ام این است که چارچوبی را که از طریق پروژه «بازگویی آبادان» ساخته می شود بطور رایگان در دسترس عموم بگذارم تا بتواند از آن برای بازگویی داستان شهرهای دیگر نیز استفاده کنند.

بخش اولیه پشتوانه مالی دریافت شده برای برقراری امکان تحقیق در بریتانیا، امریکا، سوییس، و ایران در نظر گرفته شده است. یک سخنرانی و یک سمینار در مورد تاریخ آبادان (در دانمارک و ایالات متحده)، خرج های اولیه پایگاه وب، و بخشی از خرج چاپ یک کتاب در مورد آبادان نیز بخشی از این پشتوانه است.

10000 

دلار آخری

خرج موارد زیر خواهد شد

-دستمزد پرداختی به محققان برای مقالات تحقیقی (حدود 15 مقاله): 3000 دلار

-طراحی بانک اطلاعاتی ویکی و نقشه ها (شامل وسایل فنی، تصویر برداری از مدارک اصلی و غیره): 4000 دلار

-طراحی قطعات هنری برای پایگاه وب و برای استفاده های دیگر: 3000 دلار

تمام هزینه های کمکی مستقیما به حساب پروژه در دانشگاه کپنهاگ واریز خواهد شد.

 

به عنوان بخشی از قسمت دوم پروژه، من در حال طراحی یک کتاب زیبا به همراه عکس هایی با کیفیت بالا، نقشه های بزرگ و کامل، آثار هنری، و مقالاتی در مورد آبادان هستم و همچنین نمایشگاهی را پایه گذاری خواهم کرد که امیدوارم در تمام اروپا، ایالات متحده، و ایران به نمایش درآید. جزویات بیشتر به زودی منتشر خواهند شد.

اما در حال حاضر، امیدوارم که شما به پروژه کمک کنید و این درخواست را با شبکه های اجتماعی خود به اشتراک بگذارید تا بتوانیم همه با هم، آبادان را بازگویی کنیم

!
story_txt:
[IN PERSIAN BELOW]Abadan, Iran is special. Across the world, thousands cherish memories of life in what was once a cosmopolitan beacon of modernity in the Middle East, longing for the places, spaces and faces of the city. And yet, Abadan is today a city largely forgotten by the world.Let us reintroduce Abadan to the world by documenting its fascinating history; bringing its past to life through pictures, essays, videos and art; letting scholars share their knowledge; and letting everyone share their memories and experiences.Let Abadan be retold so that future generations can draw from the lessons of the city, understand the historical processes it embodies and envision a peaceful future where Abadanis, whether Iranian or non-Iranian, whether in Abadan or abroad, can come together and recreate the magic of the oil city for all to experience and learn from.Abadan:Retold is an innovative, multi-media social history project invented and managed by me, Rasmus Christian Elling (PhD). I am a Professor of Iranian Studies at the University of Copenhagen, Denmark, fluent in Persian and have lived in Iran. As a scholar of modern Iran and urban studies, I came across Abadan through my research in 2011, and since, I have explored the city’s history through oil company and state archives, newspapers, diplomatic reports, novels and biographies, as well as through fieldwork and interviews in Abadan. To understand why I am so fascinated by Abadan, please read my essays here.A crucial part of the Abadan Retold project is an online portal (www.abadan.wiki) with multiple functions:- The AbadanMap: a multi-layered interactive map based on GIS data, human data and historical information, drawing on a broad range of maps from open sources and from historical archives;- Encyclopaedia Abadanica: an archive of research-based articles by excellent scholars on all aspects of Abadan’s history, from ancient times to present-day, as well as on Abadani popular culture;- MemoryLine: a user-driven history wiki – an open platform on which everyone can share memories and knowledge through comments, essays, interviews and pictures, and where you can discover new faces or re-connect with old friends.Abadan:Retold is part of a larger research project on documenting the history of Abadan in a global context, for which I have already received a grant of 13,000 USD from the Danish Arthur Christensen Foundation. Now I need a further 10,000 USD to make the public part of the project come true.I am handpicking a team of excellent scholars around the world to conduct research and write articles; a geographer and a GIS expert to create the maps; a web designer to create a well-functioning portal; and artists to make beautiful pieces of collage art that can bring Abadan to life. My plan is that the framework we develop for Abadan:Retold be made available open source to the public so that other cities can use it too.The initial grant covers research in archives in the UK, the US, Switzerland and Iran; one lecture and a seminar on Abadan's history (in Denmark and the US); basic cost of website design; and a contribution to the publication of a coffee table book.The final 10,000 USD that I hope to raise now is to finance the following:
Remuneration for scholars writing articles (approx. 15 articles): USD 3,000
Design of wiki database and maps (including technical equipment, re-scanning of original sources etc.): USD 4,000
Design of artwork for website and for perks: USD 3,000
The funds raised here will go directly to a project account in University of Copenhagen.In the second stage of the project, I am designing a beautiful coffee table book with high-resolution pictures, fold-out maps, artwork and essays on Abadan; and preparing an exhibition that will hopefully travel around Europe, the US and Iran. More details will be published soon.For now, I hope that you will support with a donation and share this appeal with your networks so that we together can let Abadan be retold!آبادان، ایران شهر

story: Hello family and friends, it's LYNZIE!!! The time has come for me to GRADUATE HIGH SCHOOL! Now I'm working towards my amazing journey towards women-hood and of course COLLEGE! I am most certainly on my way and have maintained my grades with a steady 4.0 to insure I have taken the most productive path. So now I come to you guys for SUPPORT and a little help $$$$. I need a small donation to help out with the funding of my SENIOR PACKAGE. I have worked extremely hard throughout my educational career and have kept my focus, while excelling in Acting, Singing, Dancing also Producing. These great experiences and gained knowledge has led me to receive several acceptance opportunities from prestige colleges across the U.S. Now all I need is the final push off to fully spread my wings ;). PLEASE help a little sister out ...lol!!! I LOVE YOU ALL and promise to pay you all back with my SUCCESS, FORTUNE AND FAME!!!! :p

story:
Dear friends,

We, the students of Roadstead Montessori High School, are asking for your help! This year we have been working with Steve Nelson (founder of Zenman Energy) on new ideas and concepts of solar energy, particularly as a solution for climate change. We are ready to take our learning journey further. This April, we are going to the U.S Science and Engineering Festival in Washington D.C (http://www.usasciencefestival.org/). This is a chance for us to display our project, meet scientists and engineers, and learn other new and exciting ideas. With your generous contributions, we can make that happen. We are extremely excited and invested  in this project. We can't wait to see what the future holds. 

Thank You!

The students of Roadstead Montessori High School


What is Roadstead Montessori High School?

Roadstead is an innovative Montessori high school located in downtown Norfolk, Virginia.  Our learning environment consists of hands on experiments, critical thinking, collaborative effort, social engagement, and communal life. We work side by side with professional scientists, engineers, artists, artisans and entrepreneurs to gain work experience.

We take the world as an outdoor campus, which provides us with endless opportunities to learn by doing real things in real life, things that really matter to us and other people. 


Jim Gray teaches the mysteries of Ohm's Law at 757 Makerspace 

About our project
This year we have been learning and doing science in a field lab, which is a power station invention that, once ready, will convert solar heat into steam power. The goal of this solar facility is to produce high volume electricity in such a low cost that it will be able to replace non-renewable and unclean sources, such as oil, natural gas, coal and nuclear power.

In this field lab we have studied the physics, chemistry, math, engineering, economy, history, politics and philosophy of making electricity with low cost and widely available materials. 

To learn more about Roadstead Montessori High School

Click here:  http://roadsteadhighschool.com/


Our Partners                                                                                    

We are extremely lucky and honored to have partnered up with contributing agencies to enrich the value of our education with various hands-on experiences. These contributing agencies have guided and supported us through ought this project.

Nova Marketing Media—video production company (novamarketingmedia.com)

757 Makerspace- Community Workshop and prototyping center

( http://www.757makerspace.com/)  

BioLogik Labs - a community biohackerspace (http://www.biologiklabs.org/)

Old Dominion University - The Center for Educational Partnerships

(https://www.odu.edu/education/programs/tcep)

Zenman Energy - non Profit Solar Energy research ( http://zenmanenergy.org/)


The Event

The U.S.A. Science & Engineering Festival (http://www.usasciencefestival.org/) is a national biennial expo that advances STEM education. More than 350,000 attendees will engage in various activities with some of the biggest manufacturers, institutions and names in science and technology today.

It’s aim is to inspire the next generation of scientists and engineers. The Expo will be held on the 16th & and 17th of April 2016 at the Walter E. Washington Convention Center in Washington D.C.  We will hold a booth at the expo together with Steve Nelson and his non-profit organization--Zenman Energy.  We will be presenting his invention, answering questions, and sharing our extensive knowledge that we have learned in our field lab.

Alex Watson, Steve Shaffer, Steve Nelson, and Eran Livni (head of school) together at the event in 2014.

“The U.S National Science and Engineering Festival”-

For more information about "The U.S National Science and Engineering Festival"

click here: http://www.usasciencefestival.org/

What is Zenman Energy?
Zenman Energy is a non-profit organization that is attempting to solve the most acute problem of our lifetime: climate change. This project doesn’t intend to make money for its inventor (it is an open-source project), but to ensure a future for the next generations of the people and our children.


Steve Nelson at the 2014 Expo


Steve Nelson believes that it is possible to take ideas about clean energy that have been around for decades and rethink them. We don’t use solar nowadays because it’s just simply too expensive.

What if solar energy was cheaper than burning coal, nuclear power, natural gas and oil?  Zenman's focus is to lower the cost of producing energy from the sun and make it cost effective, so that ensuring a future for the next generations, isn’t too expensive to achieve.

Zenman Energy- Open Source Power Plant

For further information about this organization

click here: http://zenmanenergy.org/

Why is this important?
In this event, we will both educate people about solar energy and will be educated by the other people, exhibits, and projects that we see. 
Climate change will have a big impact on us and younger generations after us. As the people who are going to be affected by it the most, it is important for us to advocate about new sustainable clean solutions. We can start changing the world just with a single conversation that they have with another person.

We will receive a lot of input from other scientists and engineers at the exposition. This will allow us after this event to continue along with this project and help develop it further.

How the money will be used
By donating you will not only help the success of our booth, you will allow us develop as citizen scientists committed to harnessing the sun, saving the planet.

Hopefully, our short trip to DC will inspire  other high schools to let their students learn science by looking for solutions to real life questions.

All donations are tax deductible
story_txt:
Dear friends,
We, the students of Roadstead Montessori High School, are asking for your help! This year we have been working with Steve Nelson (founder of Zenman Energy) on new ideas and concepts of solar energy, particularly as a solution for climate change. We are ready to take our learning journey further. This April, we are going to the U.S Science and Engineering Festival in Washington D.C (http://www.usasciencefestival.org/). This is a chance for us to display our project, meet scientists and engineers, and learn other new and exciting ideas. With your generous contributions, we can make that happen. We are extremely excited and invested  in this project. We can't wait to see what the future holds. 
Thank You!
The students of Roadstead Montessori High School

What is Roadstead Montessori High School?
Roadstead is an innovative Montessori high school located in downtown 
Norfolk, Virginia.  Our learning environment consists of hands on 
experiments, critical thinking, collaborative effort, social engagement, and 
communal life. We work side by side with professional scientists, 
engineers, artists, artisans and entrepreneurs to gain work experience. 

We take the world as an outdoor campus, which provides us with endless 
opportunities to learn by doing real things in real life, things that 
really matter to us and other people.  


Jim Gray teaches the mysteries of Ohm's Law at 757 Makerspace 
About our projectThis year we have been learning and doing science in a field lab, which is a power station invention that, once ready, will convert solar heat into steam power. The goal of this solar facility is to produce high volume electricity in such a low cost that it will be able to replace non-renewable and unclean sources, such as oil, natural gas, coal and nuclear power. In this field lab we have studied the physics, chemistry, math, engineering, economy, history, politics and philosophy of making electricity with low cost and widely available materials. 
To learn more about Roadstead Montessori High School
 Click here:  http://roadsteadhighschool.com/

story:
Teachers, educators, PTAs, school administrators, sport team coaches and parents:

The facts:
Before I start digging into what BuyMyLemonade.com is all about, there are three facts I wish to highlight.

1. The average North American K-12 student possesses between $300 and $1,500 worth of inventory such as toys, games, book, electronics etc… that they no longer use. These are packed in boxes, under beds, or in basements and will most likely end up in a landfill.

2. Fundraising is inevitable and has become an integral part of our kids’ school and after-school activities. There are many ways kids can fundraise; most of them involve large investments of time and money.

3. Although our kids are acting like business people selling products to strangers and generating revenues (entrepreneurship 101), they have never been treated as entrepreneurs or small business owners but only as foot soldiers – their entire job is to smile at the door. The current fundraising activities have zero to little educational value.

About the founders:
Isaac and I possess more than 20 years of entrepreneurship experience each and we have both founded and managed several successful businesses in the past. For the last year we invested our money and time to develop BuyMyLemonade.com and we are very excited to share it with the world. Both Isaac and I are parents to kids aged 2, 7, 9, 10, and 13, so you can only imagine how many of their fundraising campaigns we had to participate in the last 6 or 7 years.

The solution:
BuyMyLemonade.com was founded and designed based on the deep frustration we experienced with traditional fundraising activities. We have developed a revolutionary fundraising business model that simply solves the three issues I mentioned above (and more).

We built a platform that integrates e-commerce and e-learning capabilities which means that our platform will help you, your students and your organization to:

1. Better fundraise by monetizing an overwhelming amount of inventory found under your young fundraisers’ beds and in their basements. You will no longer have the need to invest upfront cash buying products made by third-party suppliers and you will no longer lose 50% of your revenue.

2. Allow your students to fundraise from the comfort of their home and turn their own pre-loved or un-used inventory of items into cash right from their desktops, tablets and cell phones. You will keep them and their parents away from pounding the pavement or driving around the neighbourhood for door-to-door sales.

3. Provide your K-12 students the ability to learn key real-world business skills through the entire fundraising process:
   - online sales and marketing
   - entrepreneurship and financial literacy
   - creative thinking and social responsibility

Through our entire fundraising process, students of all ages are empowered to:

  - Choose which products to sell and to whom,
  - Learn how to set their own fair prices
  - Learn how to safely market their items over social media channels,
  - Learn how to sell (using sales techniques, setting discounts, and more), and
  - Learn how to pack and ship items to buyers.

In other words, BuyMylemonade.com gives students a real-life business experience where they basically run their own small online business while their sales proceeds are forwarded to their social fundraising campaigns.

From a social responsibility perspective, we provide a user-friendly ecosystem where children of all ages can be socially responsible citizens by donating their possessions and their sales proceeds to their preferred fundraising campaign.

BML provides full access to parents and teachers so they can supervise all activity on the site.

Our mission:
At the end of the day, our overall mission is to turn 44 million K-12 students into 44 million young entrepreneurs. Can you imagine the long-term effect on our economy if these students can be inspired by the experience of real entrepreneurship at a young age?

KPIs (key performance indicators):
We built a platform that provides measurable, positive social impact for all of our users, clients, investors, and shareholders. BML's "for-purpose" approach blends a for-profit business model with an educational directive and a charitable intention.

Your support is needed:
We have just launched our platform, so please use it; however, we do need your funding support so we can add more instructional videos and develop more educational features. We want to turn our platform into an optimal educational and fundraising tool for every school, sports team and youth organization.

Why are we crowdfunding?
We decided to raise money through a crowdfunding campaign because we strongly believe that our solution should be supported by its users and not by bankers. The product was built for educators, students and youth-related organizations and as such, it needs to be supported by them through donation and/or participation.

What we need the money for:
85% of the funds raised will be invested in developing more instructional videos and educational features, and in hiring the staff we desperately need to grow our company and improve our user experience. The other 15% will allow us to attend educational conferences and summits so we can learn from you and other educators what else we can do in order to improve your fundraising experience with us.

Your support again:
Whether you decide to support us financially or not we would love to have you as a customer. Donations of any size are appreciated, but we would really love it if you would spread the word about this campaign and our platform.

Thank you so much,

The BuyMyLemonade.com team

story:
Build a Computer Lab for the 

Fatema Tul Zahra (FTZ) Girls School, Kabul


This community school provides a stimulating learning environment for 300 vulnerable girls from poor and disadvantaged families, internally displaced families, and single-parent households. These girls could not afford to go to public school with the costs of uniforms and books, and cannot travel outside of their community to attend other schools. 
CW4WAfghan operates the school and covers its full budget, from salaries (principal, 21 teachers and after-school program instructors, cook, messenger, and guards), to fuel for heat and cooking meals, clothing, shoes and school supplies for the students.
Now we need the tools to provide the girls with computer literacy!
The FTZ School is unique in that the teachers are well qualified (holding Bachelor’s degrees or having graduated from a teacher training college), and use active learning methodology in their teaching—avoiding use of more common methods used in Afghan classrooms like rote memorization and lecture. The children attend classes daily, in grades 1-9. Some take vocational courses after school, which provide the girls with marketable skills toward viable livelihoods to help their families rise out of poverty, including courses in English, computers and tailoring. There is a small library in the school.
 

A recently hired Quality Assurance Manager is leading activities to improve the school’s physical environment, support teachers to strengthen their pedagogical practice, improve administrative and monitoring procedures, coach the school principal and head teacher, and create new after-school programs.
The goal is to ensure that all the girls who study at the school have brighter futures ahead of them. 

Most urgently, the girls need a computer lab!  You could make THIS dream a reality!


We have acquired an estimate for everything needed for the lab, including 20 computers, a printer, desks, chairs, wiring and carpet ~ with a goal is to raise CAD $20,000 as soon as possible. This lab will enable these girls to develop 21st century skills -- not only basic computer literacy, but even learning how to code, with help from our friends at CodeWeekend, Afghanistan's largest community of software developers, who are volunteering their time to this project. 
All equipment will be sourced locally!
 

Make an investment that will transform the present and build the future!


The road to restoring human rights to the girls and women of Afghanistan, and restoring peace and prosperity to a nation, starts with education. Your gift of computer literacy is a vital steppingstone to learning, leadership and opportunity. The impact of your gift will be felt for generations, as you help to provide education for girls who will one day raise and support their families and take their place as leaders in their communities!

GOAL: $20,000 to purchase and install 20 computers, printer, seating, flooring and wiring

As an individual or a corporate sponsor, your invaluable contribution for these girls will also result in a pilot program to teach computer literacy and to develop a coding curriculum for kids, continuing our pioneering work in technology for education in Afghanistan!

Canadian Women for Women in Afghanistan is a member-based, not-for-profit organization with twelve volunteer chapters across Canada. We advance education and educational opportunities for Afghan women and their families and educate Canadians about human rights.

For two decades, CW4WAfghan members have demonstrated that individuals, as global citizens, working in solidarity and with integrity of purpose, can take action, in partnership with Afghan women, to improve conditions of human rights, end women's oppression, and provide opportunities for Afghan women to live their lives with dignity, certainty and purpose.

story:
- I AM 4 Kids -

The World’s First Animated Reality TV Show for Kids

I AM 4 Kids is a ground breaking TV project created by children’s empowerment expert and author Mark Papadas. It tells real stories of real kids making a difference in their homes, schools, communities and beyond. Each episode is entertaining, educational, and empowering.

“The best way to describe the show is imagine Anthony Robbins meets Charlie Brown.”

Disclaimer: Neither Anthony Robbins nor the estate of Charles Schultz (creator of Charlie Brown and Peanuts) is involved in this project. This is purely a description of the concept of the TV show being developed using two known entities in the public domain.

For the past five years, I AM 4 Kids creator Mark Papadas has been speaking and working with educators to develop curriculum to teach empowerment and emotional intelligence to elementary school kids across the country. From this work, the I AM 4 Kids TV show was born. Each episode is based on a true story of a kid being the embodiment of a different empowering word. Each of the children featured will be invited (with their parents’ approval) to be a recurring I AM 4 Kids character, giving the show direct connections to communities across the country.


The Problem is Getting Worse

There is an emotional intelligence and identity crisis among the children of America. Studies show that over 50% of American school kids have a negative self-image. Common responses from second through fifth graders when asked to complete the statement, “I AM…” are:

  • I AM…fat
  • I AM…stupid
  • I AM…ugly

...and the identity they have as kids, is the identity they will have as adults.

Our Mission for this Campaign

We believe the lack of stimulating kids TV programming and violent video games aimed at kids today are major contributors to this crisis. There is no shortage of researchers, advocates, and bloggers complaining about the state of kids entertainment, but little is actually being done to change it. Our mission is to produce the I AM 4 Kids TV show and video game and prove to the networks that there is a LARGE audience out there demanding this type of quality empowering and educational content for our kids. Once produced, we see the I AM 4 Kids characters doing for empowerment and emotional intelligence what the Muppets did for reading and math.

The Movement has Begun

This campaign is about much more than a TV show - its about a MOVEMENT! A movement to empower our kids to grow into their inherent greatness and resist peer pressure and bullying. In short, they learn to become their own role models.

What Your Funding Supports!

  • Completing production of the pilot episode and version 1.0 of the video game
  • Multi-city release in conjunction with local school districts
  • An aggressive PR strategy
  • Advertising
  • Events to raise awareness
  • Legal counsel

-- Video Game --




-- Power to the Pupils storyboards --


What Have We Done So Far?

In addition to building the grass roots support among parents and teachers that a project like this needs to succeed, we have built relationships with resources needed to make it happen on a grand scale. For example, we have an agreement with one of the top TV animation studios to produce the pilot and the weekly show  - once it is picked up by a network. Watch the short video below to see who else they work with.

What do Expert Have to Say About I AM 4 Kids?


“Mark Papadas provides a critical roadmap to the development of our country’s most important resources and the next generation of leaders—our children. Additionally, adults who are mapping out their path to success will benefit from the thought-provoking action steps that Mark provides.”

Tonya Fitzpatrick, Esq.
Co-author, Success Simplified with Stephen Covey
Former Deputy Assistant Secretary of Civil Rights Policy,
U.S. Department of Education

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

“I recommend I AM 4 Kids to every educational organization that is committed to developing strong minds, characters and bodies.”

Randy Lawrence
Board Vice-President, Curriculum Committee Chair
Public School Board of Education Trustee

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"A great big THANK YOU to Mark Papadas for taking time to remind all of us the power that kids have within them."

Dr. Bill Truesdale, Ed. D.
Public Elementary School Principal
N.A.S.S.P. Break-Through School


About the Creator

Mark Papadas is an author, speaker, coach, and founder of I AM 4 Kids, the innovative children’s empowerment program revolutionizing elementary education. Mark also recently hosted I AM 4 Kids Radio – a weekly talk show focused in kids, family, and education. After years of training and coaching adults, he’s delivering those same self-empowerment tools to children.

Blessed to work in the self development field for over 20 years, working with and for such leaders as Brian Tracy, Zig Ziglar, and Anthony Robbins, Mark has been witness to countless success stories by those who realize their power and achieve their goals using proven tools and strategies.

When introduced to the concepts of personal growth and self-empowerment in high school, Mark was immediately hooked. Growing up in the 70’s, his parents worked hard to keep food on the table and make ends meet. Frequently, Mark was in the care of two older brothers – one of which often got his point across with his fists. Many times, he was beaten severely. While it was a difficult period growing up, he learned to control his mind and look inward for strength. Those tough childhood years are the threads that help Mark relate to the challenges many children face today.


Fund the Mission

&

Sign the Petition

demanding this type of quality empowering and educational content for our kids.
Once produced, we see the I AM 4 Kids characters doing for empowerment and
emotional intelligence what the Muppets did for reading and math. 
The Movement has Begun
This campaign is about much more than a TV
show - its about a MOVEMENT! A movement to empower our kids to grow into their
inherent greatness and resist peer pressure and bullying. In short, they learn
to become their own role models. 
What Your Funding Supports!


Completing
production of the pilot episode and version 1.0 of the video game
Multi-city
release in conjunction with local school districts
An
aggressive PR strategy
Advertising
Events
to raise awareness



Legal counsel


-- Video Game --
-- Power to the Pupils storyboards --
What Have We Done So Far?
In addition to building the grass roots
support among parents and teachers that a project like this needs to succeed,
we have built relationships with resources needed to make it happen on a grand
scale. For example, we have an agreement with one of the top TV animation
studios to produce the pilot and the weekly show  - once it is picked up by a network. Watch
the short video below to see who else they work with.


What do Expert Have to Say About I AM 4 Kids?

“Mark Papadas provides a critical roadmap to the development of our
country’s most important resources and the next generation of leaders—our
children. Additionally, adults who are mapping out their path to success will
benefit from the thought-provoking action steps that Mark provides.” 
Tonya Fitzpatrick, Esq.Co-author, Success
Simplified with Stephen CoveyFormer Deputy Assistant Secretary of Civil Rights Policy,U.S. Department of Education
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

“I recommend I AM 4 Kids to every educational organization that is
committed to developing strong minds, characters and bodies.”
Randy LawrenceBoard Vice-President,
Curriculum Committee ChairPublic School Board of
Education Trustee--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------"A great big THANK YOU to Mark Papadas for taking time to remind all
of us the power that kids have within them." 
Dr. Bill Truesdale, Ed.
D. Public Elementary School
PrincipalN.A.S.S.P. Break-Through
School

About the CreatorMark Papadas is an
author, speaker, coach, and founder of I AM 4 Kids, the innovative
children’s empowerment program revolutionizing elementary education. Mark also
recently hosted I AM 4 Kids Radio – a weekly talk show focused in kids,
family, and education. After years of training and coaching adults, he’s
delivering those same self-empowerment tools to children. 
Blessed to work in the self development field for over 20 years,
working with and for such leaders as Brian Tracy, Zig Ziglar, and Anthony
Robbins, Mark has been witness to countless success stories by those who
realize their power and achieve their goals using proven tools and strategies. 
When introduced to the concepts of personal growth and
self-empowerment in high school, Mark was immediately hooked. Growing up in the
70’s, his parents worked hard to keep food on the table and make ends meet.
Frequently, Mark was in the care of two older brothers – one of which often got
his point across with his fists. Many times, he was beaten severely. While it
was a difficult period growing up, he learned to control his mind and look
inward for strength. Those tough childhood years are the threads that help Mark
relate to the challenges many children face today. Fund the Mission&Sign the Petition

story:
She likes drawing, taking pictures, ice-skating. Her friends say she's energetic, impatient, fun. She's 13. Her name is Gabi. 

Sometimes snoozes the alarm and wakes up late for school. 

Her dream is to one day study Photography. She's a kid that has passions and goals. 

Well, she's also Deaf. 

She doesn't have too much trouble communicating with people. But it takes her time. A lot of time. 

Gabi is Deaf at birth. Sign language is her way of communicating. The language is complex, visual and non-vocal.


Gabi also goes to school. She wants to ask her teacher questions about her course. She does it by:

1. Throwing paper planes with notes at her professor.
2. Using magnifying glass to read her professor's lips.
3. Taping each class in video and then asking a friend for translation.


Maybe it's a bit exaggerated. But imagine - this is how it usually works. 

 Unconventional.

Is an application that serves Deaf people as a mobile translator. It provides two types of services. Real-time translation and text-to-speech translation. What do we mean?

For example Gabi wants to approach her professor with a question. She: 

Registers an Account


Appoints a day


Calls the sign language interpreter and.. 


That's it. 

The service can be used by any deaf person in different everyday situations.

  • A) Doctor 
  • B) Business Appointments 
  • C)Paying Bills 
..etc


While Gabi is in class how does she take notes? Peeking in the notebook of her classmates, trying to get small bits of information.


That's annoying. 

Yes, providing a sign language interpreter is a solution but has it's flaws. Sign language translators interpret information and each school class has its own specific and unique vocabulary which even the biggest professionals have a hard time translating.  So in this scenario, the solution is real time speech-to-text translation. The platform will turn all vocal information given by the teacher to text. This application will also automatically record and save all text files ever done.

Deaf people can use this service also in:

  • University 
  • Seminars 
  • Workshops 
  • ...etc
All this is really important for us. We take our mission at heart.


We're a foundation. We've been around for 2 years. We're from Bulgaria. Little efforts have been made by local organisations to bring awareness to the deaf culture. We felt someone had to take the initiative. 

Our team is mostly of Deaf and Hearing people who have a strong connection with the community. 


Yes, our constant contact with the community does give us the genuine drive to do things but it's mostly our desire to explore new ways of communication that bring us together as people.


We've organised events. 


Raised awareness.



We've provided translating services.


Won various social entrepreneurship contests. 


We already have a prototype version of the platform. 



5$ - Video shout out in sign language with your name in it on our social media channels.

10 $ - Thank you note with your name written in sign language.

20$ - Personalized thank you video in sign language.
30$ - Short video in sign language teaching you a sign symbol of your choice.

50$ - Digital copy of a painting made by a Deaf person.




Our purpose is to engage all 120,000 Deaf and Hard of Hearing people in Bulgaria to pursue their dreams and be confident enough to participate in all kinds of activities equally with hearing people. 

After we successfully develop our software in Bulgaria, which we project would happen by 2017, we would like to expand our platform in other Balkan countries where it hasn't been implemented. 



Become part of this change. Donate now.

story:
Hi! I'm Alex Vigil-Emerson and I'm an illustration student at the
University of Arizona in my junior year and I am on track to
graduate in the spring of 2016. I am trying to fund my trip to study
abroad in Orvieto, Italy. The program is called Arizona in Italy,
and is run through the U of A School of Art and has U of A faculty
teaching at their school in Orvieto. The program lasts five weeks
and includes trips to Rome and Florence to visit many famous
landmarks and art museums in Italy. After the program ends I hope
to see the Louvre and The British museums.

This trip poses the last chance I may have of visiting Europe, as I
am graduating and will not have the means or resources to travel
once I'm out of school. I REALLY want to visit many of the
buildings and cathedrals in Italy and see the amazing and unique
architecture in person. I love drawing with perspective and want to
go into animation or concept design and would relish the chance to
see many of these iconic buildings and the paintings that explore
one point perspective—works by Brunelleschi and Raphael. be
able to use what I see and can study from them to create wondrous
and awe-inspiring settings in my illustrations.

The total trip cost is around $10,000. This includes around $5500
in tuition, $1600 in airfare, and the rest going to housing, food,
books and materials, and additional travel costs. Money has been
tight with covering the costs of school and housing while in
college, but I've been able to cover about half the cost of the trip
with help from money earned from my part time job. The money
from this Indiegogo would go towards getting me the rest of the
way to funding this trip. I'm really excited to be able to have the
chance to visit Europe and see new and exciting places that I can
use to improve the inspiration of my drawings. Any support you
can give me would be greatly appreciated.


*I will be keeping a log of my journey and thanks to donors at my trip blog: an-illustrator-abroad.tumblr.com*

These are 7 available prints for perk rewards:


        

Print 1


Print 2


Print 3


          

Print 4


Print 5



Print 6



Print 7

story:
OUR MISSION

We are hoping to send our top 16 oarsmen (8 varsity and 8 novice) to Gainesville, Georgia to compete in the American Collegiate Rowing Association National Championship Regatta on May 23rd and 24th. The high cost of travel and entry fees falls on each of the individual rowers and coxswains hoping to compete. In our current financial state, this works out to about $800 per person for one weekend of racing.




WHO WE ARE

We are San Diego State University Men’s Crew. We’re a group of full-time college students that get up at 4:30 a.m. six days a week to pursue a united goal of excellence. We are neither an NCAA nor a Varsity program. Our funding comes almost exclusively from fundraising and membership dues. That’s right, we don’t get paid to do what we do. We don’t have scholarships. We actually pay to be on our squad (on top of tuition and books)!! In addition to our 20+ hour/week training schedule, most of us work part-time jobs, or take out student loans just to support school and rowing...even our head coach works nights as a bouncer then heads straight to the boathouse to run practice!



WHY INDIEGOGO?

Simply put, we’re running out of options. We need your help. As mentioned earlier, the members of our program drive our income. We’ve paid hundreds per person in dues, we’ve written letters, we’ve volunteered at San Diego Charger’s games, we’ve begged our friends and families. We have been fortunate enough to survive from these means alone so far but we need to ask for your donations.

WHERE WILL YOUR DONATIONS GO?

Rowing is an expensive sport. Much of our equipment is donated, purchased through fundraising efforts, or shared graciously by our university-funded women’s team. Despite these obstacles, we have put in enough work to have the unique opportunity to showcase our growth at the ACRA National Championship this summer in Georgia. Your much-appreciated donation will go directly toward paying for this trip. Any funds that exceed our goal will be used to reduce membership dues for our future athletes.

NON-PROFIT STATUS

We are a certified 501(c)(3) non-profit program. Any and all donations are fully tax-deductible.

SOME FUN ROWING FACTS

  • Rowers are among the fittest athletes in the world!
  • Collegiate rowers are approximately 20% more likely to graduate than their peers.
  • Rowing is the oldest intercollegiate sport.

story:
END ENTRAPMENT

I am a human being passionate about people and trust in the world.

I have witnessed first hand how ENTRAPMENT - the deliberate framing and blaming of a citizen or group of citizens is being used to destroy the credibility, integrity and character of those who pursue the truth.

ENTRAPMENT is also being used to create conflict and crisis across the world.

ENTRAPMENT is the core problem facing HUMANITY as we are deceived by False Pretence and manipulation by a few.

This campaign is not about money - thats why I have assigned 0.29cents for every human being on the planet - ( the max permitted ) 

This campaign is about bringing people together to make ENTRAPMENT ILLEGAL across the world - ENTRAPMENT must become A Criminal Offence - because currently it is NOT.

What We Need & What You Get

Awareness - we must make people aware of the dangers of ENTRAPMENT.

All citizens of the world must adhere to the LAW - if ENTRAPMENT is not Currently ILLEGAL - it can and is being used to destroy good people who speak out against injustice or against good people and nations being incited into conflict and war.

BENEFITS

The benefits or perks to you and your children will be a world no longer corrupted and mismanaged by those who abuse power and use entrapment to silence and suppress good people and the Truth.

Any funds created will go directly back into each global region where we can make a difference and see that ENTRAPMENT is made ILLEGAL.

If we can change a law in a nation location - it will be funded.

If we can create art and information to drive this message home it will be funded.

If we can demand change through numbers at a public meetings it will be funded.

Think of it like this - if we are talking 0.29 cents per human being on the planet you can see relative to your donation how many people you are helping.

All funds received will go towards implement change around the world - ending entrapment and making it a criminal offence.

The Impact

If we can make ENTRAPMENT ILLEGAL around the world it will no longer be available to those who have corrupted power over people.

I have managed global companies successfully in the private sector but I had never seen such horrific abuses of power and control as I witnessed when ENTRAPMENT was used to suppress good people trying to do the right thing.

I need your help to spread the word and make this happen.  

For if there is to be TRUST in the world with the systems we all live by then we as citizens must have TRUST that those in Control are not abusing that power and are not using ENTRAPMENT to shut down genuine concerns when mistakes are questioned.

Risks & Challenges

The challenges are simple - we need numbers of people to force change in governments around the world to make ENTRAPMENT ILLEGAL.    

For if ENTRAPMENT is ILLEGAL it will no longer be permitted to be used on GOOD CITIZENS around the world.

We need Focal points in each country - established to create awareness and to push these demands so that a global solution to this concern can be implemented.

The biggest risk and challenge to ENDING ENTRAPMENT will be in opposing the resistance of a few.

Other Ways You Can Help

There is much to do, and much that can be contributed to help.   

Every human being will in some way be able to contribute to this concern - spreading the word is easy - we are all now connected - get your friends to support this cause and make a massive difference in the world today, and the future tomorrow.

Campaign LOGO - I used the symbol for BRIMSTONE or SUPFUR.

SULFUR - the Protector Element - the Destroyer of Power over YOU!

Web - frameblame.com   frameblame.net  frameblame.me  frameblame.org

story:
We are a group of parents from Taft School in Lockport, Illinois.  Our school, like many others, is dealing with funding decreases as well as facing the inevitable increasing costs just to operate our school.  Because of this we have had to make significant cuts to our budget and one of those cuts directly affected our teaching staff.  We as a school are no longer able to fund the teachers with money to purchase items to enhance the curriculum and fill basic classroom needs.  This fundraiser will make a HUGE difference for our K-8th grade students at Taft.  

What We Need 

We are trying to raise $3200 to be shared among our teachers.  These funds will be used for things like school supplies, materials for Science/Math/Language Arts projects, and, heck, even owl pellets for our 4th graders to dissect!! 

The Impact

These may seem like small potatoes to most folks but to our kids it really, really matters.  If our teachers have the resources they need, how can our kids NOT succeed in school??  It's like the difference between having gas in your car to go anywhere you want versus just having enough for one gallon.  How far can you get with that?!?!

Risks & Challenges

There are no downsides to this.  If you are able to give just a little (or a lot!) it's a win-win for all.  Our kids will have the tools they need and you can feel great about helping to fill that void.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please join us in helping to offset the budget cuts that are affecting our fantastic teachers and their classrooms. By supplying the basic building blocks, and having the ability to purchase items to enhance the curriculum, our kids can have an outstanding learning experience.  If not, please just spread the word.  Thanks for reading our story!!

story:
Slováci: Návod ako prispieť, klik sem.

Pinf Hry

Try Pinf Hry now! Just click here.
What is project Pinf Hry

I want to help people with cerebral parsy (CP or C.P.). Pinf Hry are games built for kids with CP.

Pinf Hry will help kids with CP with learning letters, colors, practising logical thinking and practising fine motor skills such as doubleclick (which can be difficoult for healthy kid too)



My name is Ondrej, I am 13 years old and I am form country Slovakia. I study Secondary Grammar School. I want to help kids with CP, but I am not making money.

Pinf Hry is important for me, because I want to help. I know couple kids with CP and Pinf Hry helped them. I want to help as much people with CP as posible.

If you'll support us, we'll be able to translate Pinf Hry to other languages, use ads to help people with cerebral parsy, buy images, print ads for doctors.

YOU can help a lot!


My Story

My mom's cousin is having cerebral palsy (CP). Her age is 20 years, but she's on level of 5-6 yeared child. I wanted to help - I made game "Písmená" (means Letters).

There was a lot of versions of this game until final. I do not want to brag, but now she can use Google, she knows basic colors, and she knows how to read the time (I'm not sure, because after some time without repeating kid can easily loose some skills - you have to deal with it.) 

Game "Letters" was very succesful. She learned new letters and her vocabulary is much bigger. 
Game "Letters":

 

When kids likes learning - keep learning! Kids will be happy.

Kids must be HAPPY from learning. They have to think they are NOT learning - they are PLAYING a game.

Demonstration


    Successes

    • Pinf Hry won Slovak nationwide competition - JuniorInternet. 
    Trophy from Junior Internet 2015


    • Pinf Hry got Price dean of the Faculty of Informatics and Information Slovak Technologies University (FIIT STU)
    Me and Dean of FIIT STU

    • Lukáš Koškár wrote article about Pinf Hry


    Challenges

    • Translate to other languages (such as German, Czech, Russian, ...)
    • Make propagation
    • Get 1 000 users
    • HELP people with CP

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Not everyone can contribute, but everyone can share. Please, share this campaign to help! We need you. 

      Thank you.

      Visit Pinf Hry now!
story_txt:
Slováci: Návod ako prispieť, klik sem.


Pinf Hry



Try Pinf Hry now! Just click here.


What is project Pinf Hry




I want to help people with cerebral parsy (CP or C.P.). Pinf Hry are games built for kids with CP.
Pinf Hry will help kids with CP with learning letters, colors, practising logical thinking and practising fine motor skills such as doubleclick (which can be difficoult for healthy kid too)










My name is Ondrej, I am 13 years old and I am form country Slovakia. I study Secondary Grammar School. I want to help kids with CP, but I am not making money.






Pinf Hry is important for me, because I want to help. I know couple kids with CP and Pinf Hry helped them. I want to help as much people with CP as posible.
If you'll support us, we'll be able to translate Pinf Hry to other languages, use ads to help people with cerebral parsy, buy images, print ads for doctors.
YOU can help a lot!



My Story
My mom's cousin is having cerebral palsy (CP). Her age is 20 years, but she's on level of 5-6 yeared child. I wanted to help - I made game "Písmená" (means Letters).

There was a lot of versions of this game until final. I do not want to brag, but now she can use Google, she knows basic colors, and she knows how to read the time (I'm not sure, because after some time without repeating kid can easily loose some skills - you have to deal with it.) 
        
Game "Letters" was very succesful. She learned new letters and her vocabulary is much bigger. 
Game "Letters":

         
When kids likes learning - keep learning! Kids will be happy.

Kids must be HAPPY from learning. They have to think they are NOT learning - they are PLAYING a game.
        

Demonstration








Successes



Pinf Hry won Slovak nationwide competition - JuniorInternet. 

Trophy from Junior Internet 2015








Pinf Hry got Price dean of the Faculty of Informatics and Information Slovak Technologies University (FIIT STU)


Me and Dean of FIIT STU





Lukáš Koškár wrote article about Pinf Hry










Challenges


Translate to other languages (such as German, Czech, Russian, ...)
Make propagation
Get 1 000 users
HELP people with CP




Other Ways You Can Help
Not everyone can contribute, but everyone can share. Please, share this campaign to help! We need you. 
Thank you.
Visit Pinf Hry now!

story:
Our Story...

We, the co-founders of Forward Thinking Leadership Academy, had each looked back on our own personal struggles with school, poverty, missed chances, and unavailable opportunities due to our family’s socioeconomic status. Although we've come very far, we then imagined how much more successful and driven we and our peers would have been if we had... access to programs to enhance our skills and improve on our weaknesses; trusted mentors who could share their experiences and give sound advice away from standardized tests; resources to help us achieve our next steps and help us decide what path was best for us; and role models to look up to. That is what we want to give to the current generation of students, and that is how Forward Thinking Leadership Academy was born; A leadership program where students will learn accountability, professionalism, effective communication, the importance of philanthropy, and other vital skills to help achieve whatever their scholastic and career goals may be. Students will have an opportunity for self-exploration, a chance to fine-tune their strengths while improving on less-experienced areas, and a safe, encouraging environment among peers with similar aspirations. 

Prepared and Prepared to Compete...

Although sounding so simple, these basic life skills and the more holistic approach to student learning are routinely forgotten in the current school systems. With most curriculum for underserved areas, material is centered around state tests and not much is actually applicable to the long road of reality. It is a disservice to students and we want to be the game-changing factor that allows students of all socioeconomic backgrounds to stand on their own and be a competitor for college and jobs. With FTLA, there will be programs implemented onto school campuses for accessibility and ease, and with it, members will have teachers, workshops, tools, and most importantly, information. They will all become leaders with guidance, hands-on projects, volunteer work, and a strong support system among their peers. 

Our Goal...

Our current fundraising efforts aims to fully fund our program for 4 San Diego high schools and the money would go towards: teaching material, speakers, teachers, transportation for field trips, uniforms, a location for conference events, etc. 

Equal education is a right, not a privilege.

Student Benefits...

Being a part of the Forward Thinking Leadership Academy will give students rare opportunities to:

  • spend time with community leaders and professionals who will share their story, give advice, and answer questions.
  • gain first hand experience leading projects that positively effect their own neighborhoods such as volunteer work, fundraising, and clean ups. 
  • participate in workshops on different topics such as resumes, interviews, entrepreneurship, public speaking, marketing, and many others. 
  • have more specified guidance in exploring and determining their own scholastic and career path. 
  • have a local network already established by FTLA to find internships and jobs, sometimes within our own companies. (See our interns in the image below!)

Completing the program would also allow students to use the certification and leadership experience on resumes and college applications. 

More About FTLA...

FTLA has developed a curriculum that will create a community that cultivates continual growth and life-long learning. It focuses on applied learning of core values and skills such as social responsibility, communication, ownership, accountability, integrity, and team work. It is far from a class where students are directed what to do. Instead, we will guide them but allow them to take the reigns; choosing projects they feel are important to themselves and the community. They will then plan, develop, and execute a solution to the issues at hand with the help of their fellow FTLA members. This will allow them to immerse themselves into a leadership role and truly learn in a rare environment of endless support and where mistakes are merely new lessons.  

FTLA will provide teachers who have been fully vetted and have many years of experience to attend meetings at schools twice a week. FTLA will also host conferences where speakers, more extensive leadership exercises, competitions, and presentations will be held among all local schools involved with FTLA. This allows students to create social networks beyond their immediate school and to learn from other individuals of different backgrounds. 

How Your Donations Make a Difference...

$15 would cover one student in our academy for an entire week.

$25 would give one student a month of free access to mentors and leadership courses.

$50 would help provide a professional uniform for one of our students. Slacks, collared shirt, and jacket. This will enable them to be professional in every way for conferences, meetings, and as they reach out to their community. 

$108 would pay for a teacher/mentor for 1 week - traveling to 2 schools, twice each, and provide 2 hours of services.

$300 is what it takes to supply material for 4 schools for 1 month.

$500-1000 to host a local conference event involving FTLA students from 4 schools. 

EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS!!!

To Thank Our Donors...

There is very little we can do to fully show our appreciation of your support. But in our attempts to do so, please accept our tokens of thanks. Everyone who donates will receive a thank you email and will receive notification once we are up and running. We can't wait to show you the happy faces you've given chances to! 

For those of you who have donated a certain amount, our gifts will vary on the contribution size. Our gift packages will contain FTLA goodies and gear that everyone will want and we will not make available for purchase until after you all receive yours! Please be patient in receiving these, as they will not be sent out until after the campaign has finished and we tally up the number of rewards. 

Many of our higher appreciative gifts include free or discounted services from our affiliated business consulting firm: Fabian Business Consulting Group. We focus on startups and education, but can be utilized by all company types. FBCG can help from resumes and college applications, to helping you start or revamp your business through our marketing services, business plan writing, and much much more. Please visit FBCG's website at Fabian Business Consulting Group for more information.

Please be patient in receiving these, as they will not be sent out until after the campaign has finished and we tally up the number of rewards. Many of our higher appreciative gifts include free or discounted services from our affiliated business consulting firm: Fabian Business Consulting Group. We focus on startups and education, but can be utilized by all company types. story:
The Problem

ZENworks Yoga works to combat the negative effects of Cleveland's urban storm: poverty + obesity + mental illness. Combining these three elements creates the following statistics:

  • Cuyahoga County has a poverty rate of 18.6%; The poverty rate in just Cleveland jumps to 34.2% (US Census 2011)
  • Among Ohio third graders, 35.3% are overweight, and 19.5% are obese (Ohio Department of Health, 2012)
  • There are 124,000 minors in Ohio struggling with serious mental health issues (National Alliance on Mental Illness, 2010)

The Solution

Yoga is the solution! Studies from The National Institute of Health’s (NIH) National Center for Complementary and Alternative Medicine recognize yoga as a form of mind-body medicine that “focuses on the interactions among the brain, mind, body, and behavior, and on the powerful ways in which emotional, mental, social, spiritual, and behavioral factors can directly affect health.”

ZENworks Yoga brings yoga basics and principles to Cleveland families and kids through schools and community organizations. Since 2013, we have helped more than 2,000 kids through 65 programs.

Can yoga really help under-resourced kids? Don't take our word for it – read theirs about how yoga makes them feel:

  • “Yoga calms me. I have a lot going on in my life so I rarely smile. Yoga gives me peace to the heart.” - 15 year old

  • “It makes me feel good because if I’m mad, I can use yoga to calm me down” - 11 year old

  • “Happy inside” - 8 year old

  • “Very nice. I should have done this a long time ago :)” - 8 year old

And from of their teachers:

  • “Yoga is “teaching the children self control, patience, and breathing to calm one’s self. The children and teachers LOVE yoga” - PreK teacher

  • “My class is a very hyper class, with yoga they seem calmer. It has been a positive impact. The students enjoy every Monday and want to do it [yoga] every week.” - 3rd grade teacher

  • “Many student’s moods are up and down. Yoga has had an impact on using calming effects on them when students are feeling anxious, stressed, etc. This has been a great experience for the students.” - Middle School Special Education teacher

How Can YOU Help?

As regular yogis know, a yoga practice works best at improving one's life when it continues outside the classroom each week and into the real world. Most schools and organizations that have participated in our programs will sign up for them again. These schools and their teachers repeatedly ask ZENworks Yoga for materials and exercises that they can use with their students throughout the week, between yoga classes.

ZENworks is asking you to help us provide teachers and students with these tools. We want to develop and print 

  • Educational materials for each student
  • Classroom posters and guides and 
  • Songs along with demonstration videos 
Classroom teachers and staff can use these resources in their classrooms throughout the week, demonstrating simple breathing exercises and basic postures that students can do at their desks. One of our own program teachers is also writing and recording music for use as a companion piece during school yoga classes.  This is an example of the materials we are currently using and would like to expand upon.

  

All donations, no matter how humble, are greatly appreciated and directly benefit Cleveland's children and families.

- May the light in me honor the light in you – Namaste -

ZENworks Yoga is a Cleveland-based 501(c)(3) non-profit organization committed to creating change and growth in a child’s life by teaching skills based on the practice of yoga. Its mission is to provide access to yoga and wellness programming for children and families in under-resourced schools and community organizations.

story:
My name is Ron Berglas and I am the producer and host of KVCR TV’s INSIGHT with Ron Berglas. KVCR is the public television and radio station covering The Inland Empire, Coachella Valley, Riverside, and parts of Los Angeles County. The mission of this show is to provide a public service by focusing our programs on subjects that will have an immediate impact on the lives of our viewers. Please feel free to check out my website at www.insightwithronberglas.com

Our next program will be on the subject of Parental Alienation Syndrome (PAS), a term coined by Dr. Richard A. Gardner to describe “…a disorder in which a child, on an ongoing basis, belittles and insults one parent without justification, due to...indoctrination by the other parent.”

The clip I am using above is by Dr. Craig Childress, one of the foremost experts on the Parental Alienation Dynamic in the world. In this video he speaks directly to the reasons he feels therapists so often and so disastrously get their diagnoses wrong when it comes to recognizing Parental Alienation Syndrome. This forceful video will hopefully emphasize for you the urgent need to alter the process of family therapy so that children will no longer be misdiagnosed and further damaged.

The purpose of this show is to help the psychiatric and legal professions to understand how their lack of knowledge on this global and divisive issue has exacerbated the trauma so many families are going through. Your investment in this show will break open that traditional methodology and encourage therapists, psychiatrists, mediators, lawyers, and judges, not only to recognize the PAS dynamic when it is put in front of them, but to educate themselves so that they can begin to find new ways to help these families.

On this episode of INSIGHT, we bring together a panel of experts including Linda Kase-Gottlieb and Dr. William Bernet as well as alienated parents, adults who were alienated as children, dramatic readings from family therapy case notes, and much more. Once it has aired on KVCR, our plan will be to market the show to other PBS stations as well as to individuals, groups, universities, libraries, medical and family-orientated establishments around the country and around the world.

The fund raising goal for this show is $5,000, and during our two previous fund raising efforts, we raised $2,250. I am using this third fund raising effort in order to ask you to please consider making your tax deductible donation today to KVCR: Attention Ron Berglas INSIGHT. If you cannot help, or have already done so, please pass on this information to anyone you think might be able to help.

On behalf of the thousands of children and their targeted parents worldwide who have been so profoundly affected, we thank you for your generous support.

With sincere appreciation,

Ron Berglas

story:
Be Confident in Going Back to School!

Everyone remember's the first day of school---a new outfit, new school supplies, fresh hair-do...

But for many DCPS, having all new everything isn't their reality.

For the first time, The Women's Collective, Polished for Prom, The Way, Truth & Life and GLOSSRAGS are teaming up to meet the needs of DCPS students across the city.

What We Need & What You Get

Your online donation is critical to helping us meet these students' needs. A donation of $25, $50 or $100 could mean up to four complete back to school packages---we're talking uniforms, stuffed backpacks and more.

The Impact

Confidence is key. Stepping back into a new classroom or even the same school building with a new sense of confidence makes all the difference. By donating, you're blessing a DCPS student not only with tools for success but the confidence that they can succeed. You're also taking a huge burden off the parents' back, who may be struggling to provide for their children.

Spread The Word!

Our goal isn't impossible! The more people you spread the word to, the more likely we are to hit our goal.
