story:
What this is about:

Police violence has skyrocketed to the top of the national discussion in the past year and will remain in mainstream media as the rate of police killings is not de-escalating.  This campaign aims to create a platform for those affected by police violence the most:  family members who have lost loved ones to police murder.

The Forced Trajectory Project 

& Allied Media Conference 2015

My name is Vanissa W. Chan and I am a media artist and  community organizer.  
For the last 6 years I have been working on the Forced Trajectory Project, a multimedia project documenting family narratives of police violence - that is, translating the stories of family members who have lost loved ones to police murder to digestible media pieces to help disseminate these crucial yet often unheard stories via the web and exhibition.  

This year, the Forced Trajectory Project was selected to be a spotlight project with Groundswell Oral History who will be sponsoring my trip to Detroit and my participation at the Allied Media Conference from June 17-21.  
I'm grateful for the sponsorship - but my presentation is not complete without the presence of those whose stories my project hosts.  I am launching this Indiegogo campaign to ask you to sponsor 6 family members affected by police violence from different parts of the country to join me at the Allied Media Conference to be on a panel/presentation called:  Organizing with Families Affected by Police Violence.  

Your contribution will assist these following family members:
Jennifer Gonzalez, partner of police murder victim, Kenny Lazo (April 12, 2008, Long Island, NY), co-founder of the Justice for Kenny Coalition
Nicholas Heyward, Sr., father of police murder victim, Nicholas Heyward, Jr. (September 27, 1994, Brooklyn, NY), founder of the Nicholas Naquan Heyward Jr. Memorial Foundation
Cynthia Howell, niece of police murder victim, Alberta Spruill (May 16, 2003, Harlem, NY), Founder of Families United 4 Justice
Cephus "Uncle Bobby" Johnson, uncle of police murder victim, Oscar Grant (January 1, 2009, Oakland, CA), CEO of the Love Not Blood Campaign

What We Need & What You Get

Here is the breakdown of our collective budget:

Allied Media Conference Registration Fee:  $75 per person = $450
Wayne State Housing:  $150 for 3 nights per person = $900
Transportation costs: $250 roundtrip fights tickets (NYC --> Detroit) x 4 = $1000
$550 roundtrip flight (San Jose --> Detroit) x 1 = $550
$400 roundtrip flight (Greensboro --> Detroit) x 1 = $400
Total:  $3300

WHAT YOU GET --> PERKS <-- WHEN YOU GIVE

$5-20: Shout out on Social Media, Personal thank you email from our crew and updates from Detroit
$25:  Shout out on Social Media, Email & Updates, Postcards written personally by the families in Detroit at Allied Media Conference
$50:  Shout out on Social Media, Email & Updates, Postcard, 8x10 professional photograph of the whole crew at Allied Media Conference
$100: Shout out on Social Media, Email & Updates, Postcard, 8x10 photo, Personal phonecall by one of the crew from the Allied Media Conference
$200 & up:  

Shout out on Social Media, Email & Updates, Postcard, 8x10 photo, Personal phone call by one of the crew from the Allied Media Conference, Producer credits for the Forced Trajectory Project

The Impact

Why is this important?  While many of us are familiar with certain police brutality cases due to mainstream media attention, what do we really know of the paths of the family members who lose their loved ones to police violence?  What do we know of their struggle for justice, and of their relationship with the criminal justice system after their loved one is killed?  Can their paths guide us in this nationwide movement to stop police violence?  Furthermore, shouldn't family members be involved in the discussion of the justice this movement is trying to achieve?  Funding this campaign will give these family members a platform to share their narratives and educate AMC participants on how to organize with them, assist them, and tap into their wisdom.  

Risks & Challenges

We only have a few weeks to raise these funds to cover 100% of the family members' Allied Media Conference costs... If the funds are not completely covered, family members' participation will be limited.  We would like for all 6 of our family members to be on the AMC panel.  Think of how powerful it would be to have family members from all over the country on a panel together!  This is what we envision, and you can help us make that happen.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with $$$ that's okay!  You can help by sharing this page on social media and getting your network interested in this work!  Help this campaign go viral!!  Questions, comments, suggestions?  Please email me:  vanissawchan@yahoo.com

story:
How YOU can help Get Kids in the Game 

DONATE $10 or more TODAY!

Team Tío just pledged $15k to sponsor a youth golf clinic which will be delivered by former PGA professional, current NBC analyst, and native New Mexican -          Notah Begay III.

  • Our goal is to raise at least $2500, effectively sending 25+ underserved area children to the clinic.
We need YOU to :
  1. Donate at least $10 to help send a child to the event
  2. Visit us on Facebook, Like Us, and share your donation with others
  3. Encourage people you know to contribute to the youth in our community as well.
  4. Feel good knowing that you potentially changed the direction of an underprivileged child and opened doors to new, positive influences.  

What's in it for you? 

Just in case simply feeling good knowing you helped a kid have an experience of a lifetime isn't good enough, Team Tío is sweetening the deal!

  • With the help of some very generous local businesses, we will be giving supporters that donate at least $10 an opportunity to be randomly drawn for great prizes: golf foursomes, restaurant gift certificates, and other items of value from well-known establishments.  

About Team Tío

Did you know that:

  • when including equipment, uniforms and additional team fees, the average cost for a child’s sports participation in a single sport for one season is $381? 

  • the average family participating in youth sports spends more than $670 a year? 

  • children in households making less than $60k/year are 33% less likely to participate in sports than those earning above $60k/year?

Team Tío is raising funds from the community to make sure all kids, regardless of their financial situation, can get in the game.

Team Tío levels the economic playing field for youth desiring to participate in team sports by helping them gain access. Studies have shown that team sports help children develop teamwork, learn resilience, and build self-esteem...all while having fun. Research also suggests that kids involved in athletics realize long-term benefits including increased health, greater educational achievement, and even improved career success. We support this philosophy by giving targeted gifts for fees and equipment in underserved communities so that these kids can get in the game.


The Impact

Studies conclude that children participating in sports benefit from:

  • Physical health
  • Mental health
  • A sense of belonging and worth
  • Friendship
  • Teamwork
  • Increased educational performance
  • Confidence and self-esteem
  • Personal and group achievement
  • Learning to overcome adversity
  • Improved interpersonal skills
  • Likelihood of long-term career success

Other Ways You Can Help

Visit our Facebook page and Like Us so you can follow our work in the community.

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the share tools to spread our message and need for support.

Visit us on Facebook, Like Us, and share your donation with others
Encourage people you know to contribute to the youth in our community as well.
Feel good knowing that you potentially changed the direction of an underprivileged child and opened doors to new, positive influences.  



What's in it for you? 
Just in case simply feeling good knowing you helped a kid have an experience of a lifetime isn't good enough, Team Tío is sweetening the deal!
With the help of some very generous local businesses, we will be giving supporters that donate at least $10 an opportunity to be randomly drawn for great prizes: golf foursomes, restaurant gift certificates, and other items of value from well-known establishments.  


About Team Tío
 
Did you know that:


when including equipment, uniforms and
additional team fees, the average cost for a child’s sports participation in a single sport for one season is $381? 
the average family
participating in youth sports spends more than $670 a year? 
children in households making less than $60k/year are 33% less likely to
participate in sports than those earning above $60k/year?


Team Tío is raising funds from the community to make sure all kids, regardless of their financial situation, can get in the game.
Team Tío levels the economic playing field for youth desiring to participate in team sports by helping them gain access. Studies have shown that team sports help children develop teamwork, learn resilience, and build self-esteem...all while having fun. Research also suggests that kids involved in athletics realize long-term benefits including increased health, greater educational achievement, and even improved career success. We support this philosophy by giving targeted gifts for fees and equipment in underserved communities so that these kids can get in the game.

   The Impact Studies conclude that children participating in sports benefit from:  Physical health
Mental health
A sense of belonging and worth
Friendship
Teamwork
Increased educational performance
Confidence and self-esteem
Personal and group achievement
Learning to overcome adversity
Improved interpersonal skills
Likelihood of long-term career success



    Other Ways You Can Help Visit our Facebook page and Like Us so you can follow our work in the community.  Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Use the share tools to spread our message and need for support.

story:
Short Summary

Working with Police, Fire, and Military Honor Guards I saw people from diverse backgrounds and different economic levels working together as a team.  The Honor Guard teams had to learn respect and honoring each other along with a high level of discipline and self-respect.  Our philosophy is taking this same training that these Honor Guards go through and teach children from the ages of 6-16 how to learn to respect themselves, their community and each other.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise enough funds so that any child from any background can participate in our events.  We will provide complete uniforms for each of the children participating in our Honor Guard events.  Our initial investment will also cover the costs to have flags of varying sizes and from all branches of the military, public safety and fire so that our children can participate in multiple community events.

Our goal is to have our KOHR kids to participate in community events through-out the metropolitan Phoenix area, with the goal of expanding statewide.  Our KOHR kids will be performing at veterans events, military events, public safety and fire events.  If you happen to know of a local event that you would like out KOHR kids to perform, there is no cost to anyone for their attendance at your event.

    The Impact

    Your donation to purchase our uniforms and flags for our KOHR kids will allow any child from any socioeconomic background eligible to participate.  We don't want any family to have any out of pocket expense.

    Risks & Challenges

    Although this program is the first of it's kind and there are a few organizations such as Boy Scouts of America and Explorers programs that do offer Honor Guards,  the age range for these programs and the restrictions are what makes us stand out from all the rest. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you can't contribute funds for our initial investment, you can still support our KOHR kids by letting people know about our organization if they are looking for something unique at their event or if you know any youth or youth groups that would be interested in joining our team.

story:
Why Smile, Don't Stare?

Teachable moments are being missed every day. This is why the Smile, Don't Stare campaign was launched. It focuses on understanding and is intended to help people rethink what they do, and what they say when they come into contact with a person - of any age - living with a disability. The campaign is working hard to turn stares into smiles and teach that it's OK to look, even better to ask questions.

Educational Curriculum:

The Smile, Don't Stare educational curriculum is geared towards children in grades K-2. Children in this age group learn best through storytelling, so I have written a children's book called, "You Have a Beautiful Smile". Along with the book, there are parent and educator conversation guides that provide guidelines, talking points and answers that can help the adults in the children's lives be better prepared when the tough questions come up. High School students affiliated with Best Buddies will be going into these classrooms to read the story and teach the curriculum to promote inclusion, satisfy the children's curiosity and turn those stares into smiles.

My Wish PSA

We asked families we serve how they wanted to be treated in public. Here is what they had to say:


How Your Donations Will Help:

The local school systems are ready, but we have a few more steps left before we can get the curriculum distributed to the schools. This is where your donations will help us!

All of the materials are written and edited. The $10,000 will be used to add illustrations to the book, and have it published and printed - along with the rest of our materials. In more detail:
  • 12 intricate design illustrations for "You Have a Beautiful Smile"
  • Publishing of "You Have a Beautiful Smile"
  • Printing of "You Have a Beautiful Smile"
  • Printing of parent conversation guides
  • Printing of educator conversation guides
  • Printing of Smile, Don't Stare promise banners (to be signed by students after presentations)
  • Printing of Smile, Don't Stare promise buttons (to be handed out to students after presentations)
Every donations counts! We will be working hard to make sure our fundraising goal is met. We want the Smile, Don't Stare curriculum distributed and taught this coming school year.
Thank you in advance for your donations!

Help Us Build a Movement!

Everyone can spread the word and join the conversation on the Lollipop Kids Foundation Facebook page or on Twitter @lollipopkidsfnd and by using #SmileDontStare.

Who We Are:

The Lollipop Kids Foundation is a local 501(c)(3) non-profit organization geared towards creating opportunities that enable children with disabilities to live to their fullest potential. We exist to combat social stigmas, ease financial burdens and provide a comfortable and fun environment for families and children with disabilities to connect with, learn from and support one another. The programs we offer to support our mission include ARTbeat, LolliFIT, Lollipop Links, parent and sibling support groups, family socials and group community outings. We also fit and donate durable medical equipment, such as wheelchairs, standers and adapted bikes, to children whose families cannot obtain the equipment on their own.


In the News:

Fox 5 News

News Channel 8

Washington Post

Bethesda Magazine

Uplifting Entertainment

Bisnow

story:
Hey, what's up! My name is Kyle Heser and I am a soldier of peace. I just graduated from Colorado School of Mines and am looking to put my engineering skills to work helping improve the life situations of those in need. I like to read, explore, and be outdoors.

At the end of December, a group of 11 Mines students will be traveling to Nepal as a part of the Hike for Help program and volunteering alongside the local Sherpa people in the village areas of Syangma and Chaurikharka, near the base of Mt Everest. We will be working to help rebuild the only high school in Chaurikharka, which was destroyed in the 7.8 magnitude earthquake earlier this year. Nearly 500 students from 1st through 12th grade rely on this school as it is the only education center in the area. Planning is underway to rebuild the earthquake-proof structures that are desperately needed. The cost of this project is approximately $200,000. So far, we have raised about 12%, or $25,000. I am hoping to personally raise $5000 towards the trip and rebuilding efforts.

Hike for Help: Nepal is a nonprofit organization based out of Golden, CO. Founded in 2010 by Lhakpa Sherpa, owner of the Sherpa House and Cultural Center and an immigrant from Nepal, Hike for Help’s main objective is to foster a comprehensive strategy of small, focused projects with high impact, sustained by the local Sherpa community. Donations are tax deductible, and we are currently awaiting the final word on our official 501(c)(3) nonprofit application.

I have been working side-by-side with Lhakpa since early January to coordinate this opportunity to travel to Nepal from October - January 2016. My time will be spent working in southern Kathmandu and in Syangma and Chaurikharka, learning the culture and language and assisting with whatever relief efforts are taking place at the time. I will meet up with the team in December and continue work on the school.

Your donation will help directly fund me to travel to Nepal, and any extra money will be used for construction costs in country. Follow the trip blog throughout the project so you can keep up with our progress as well!

If you cannot help out with a donation today, don't worry! You can still help me out by spreading the word and sharing this fundraiser with your friends and family! Together, I know we can do this.


Read more about the adventure here:

  • http://www.hikeforhelp.org/
  • http://goldentranscript.net/stories/Goldenites-...

Finally, a note from Lhakpa himself...

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Namaste, my name is Lhakpa Sherpa. I was born and raised at the base of Mt. Everest and attended the school in Chaurikharka, Nepal. Each day, I commuted 2 hours each way to attend classes. I was the first in my village to earn a high school diploma. This experience taught me that hard work and discipline builds strong moral character. After graduating in 1990, I spent several years guiding in the Himalayas. In 1996, I moved to the U.S. to pursue higher education and later opened several local businesses. I have been very successful and wish to pass on some of my good fortune to the people of Nepal. I attribute much of my success to the years I spent at the Chaurikharka school and want to ensure that the children in that area have the same access to education and opportunity. This is a great opportunity for me to help the children in Nepal. Please consider making a donation today.​

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

story:
OUR MISSION

We’re on a mission to empower kids to change the world. We’re on a mission to meet poverty and pain with caring and kindness. We’re on a mission to make the leaders of tomorrow, who are ready to make a difference TODAY!

HOW WE DO IT

MISSION POSSIBLE KIDS is a national non-profit empowering kids to change the world by helping others with more than 100 chapters in schools and churches in 38 states. Elementary-aged kids become Agents of Change and learn to think BIG! By doing hands-on missions, they discover they can make a real difference in the lives of others, in their communities and around the world. 

Hands-on TOP SECRET Missions include:      

  • Making gifts for kids in hospitals and shelters
  • Assisting with disaster relief
  • Reaching out to kids in orphanages and refugee centers
  • Supporting wounded US troops overseas
  • Touching the hearts of nursing home residents
  • Stocking food banks         
  • And many, many more!           

   

By changing the lives of others, our agents change themselves. They grow into compassionate, self-confident future leaders with a powerful work ethic and a lifelong commitment to volunteering, social responsibility, and giving back.

"There is too much unmet need in the world…MISSION POSSIBLE KIDS’ vision is to build a much larger and more capable volunteer base both now and in the future, by starting with America's kids.”--Points of Light Foundation https://missionpossiblekids.org/read-article-mpk-points-light-foundation

JOIN OUR MISSION

We have more than 17,000 current and former agents who, together, have touched more than 2,000,000 lives! Before MPK, no one believed 1-5th graders could affect such far-reaching change, but it happened. And now, we want to do more. We want to give EVERY kid the opportunity to change the world. And we’re starting in America’s schools, churches, and other hosting sites.

Two years ago, we launched the pilot MISSION POSSIBLE KIDS after-school program at Glen Oaks Elementary School in McKinney, TX. It was an incredible success; to quote the principal, “MPK is the most successful afterschool program we have EVER had, more than triple the involvement of our other clubs…I can’t wait to see what our kids do next!”

What we’re doing next is expanding. MISSION POSSIBLE KIDS is poised to explode into schools and churches across the country. We want to launch ­­­50 more MISSION POSSIBLE KIDS chapters by this time next year.

In order to achieve and sustain all of these new chapters and agents, we need funding! So we’re asking you to help us reach our goal of $15,000. 

Take a look at what $15,000 could do in just the next year.



That means that just $5 can help a child touch 65 lives. The social impact is ENORMOUS!

Our mission is only possible with your support. Help us help kids change the world. Donate now.

PERK DETAILS

We’re planning to start sending out perks as soon as you start sending in donations, so if you're buying a t-shirt or want a name other than your own on a Spy Promotion Certificate or heart pillow tag, please contact us through the “contact” link beneath our video after you donate! 


New Recruit--$5

In thanks for stepping us to support our young “Agents of Change,” you’ll get a social media shout out from Mission Control on Facebook and Twitter expressing our gratitude for your support. SPY FIVE!


Special Agent--$10

Congratulations, honorary agent! You have reached the rank “Special Agent,” and we’ll email you a personalized Spy Promotion Certificate from Mission Control! FYI, MPK Agents receive a promotion after successfully completing 6 missions, rising in rank the more they do to help other people. Giving (fun spy-themed!) recognition is an integral part of our program, and we want to give you a similar experience the more you help us, our Agents, and all the people they serve! 

If you would prefer a name other than your own on the certificate, just let us know when you place your donation through the "contact" link under our video. 


Master Agent--$15

The nation’s youngest, and most successful spy team, our own Spy5, Crystal Clear, Maxx Risk, Sonic Shadow, Checkmate, and their leader, KC Legend, will send you 1 of 5 exclusive Spy5 postcards signed by one of the Spy5 with a TOP SECRET message just for you! We'll send you the postcard(s) in an envelope, so you can keep it as a collectible or pass on the empowerment to someone else!


Special Forces Officer--$25

Heart Pillows for Kids in Need has become one of MPK's signature missions. Our Agents make these wonderful heart pillows from shoelace and fleece and send them to orphanages and refugee camps all over the world with messages of love and support! At this perk level, we will make one heart pillow especially for you and donate it to a child in need--one more life your gift can touch! We’ll email you a picture of the heart with your name on its tag. 

If you would like a name other than your own on the tag,  just let us know when you place your donation through the "contact" link under our video.



Deputy Chief Officer--$30

You will receive ALL 5 of the exclusive signed Spy5 Postcards from our elite spy team, the Spy5! We'll send you the postcards in an envelope, so you can keep it as a collectible or pass on the empowerment to someone else!


Chief Officer--$35

Spread the spy love and sponsor 1 heart pillow for a child in need and receive your own to keep! We’ll email you a picture of the heart with your name on its tag. Sleep soundly on your pillow knowing that you made a difference in the life of another.

If you would like a name other than your own on the tag or if you would like us to donate both heart pillows, just let us know when you place your donation through the "contact" link under our video.


Chief Officer--$35

Now you’re really part of the team! Get the official Mission Possible Kids “Ask Me About My Secret Mission” Flip-shirts in our trademark inconspicuous bright green. Then, send us a picture of you in your spy shirt (and any other spy gear you want to throw on--dark sunglasses recommended!) doing your best spy pose, and we’ll create and mail you 10 personalized spy business cards!

Don't forget to contact us through the "contact" link beneath our video to let us know the t-shirt size you want:  YS, YM, YL, AS, AM, AL, AXL, AXXL

 


NEW PERK:  Chief Officer--$35

Spies love their coffee! If you do too, this official MPK “We're on a Mission” Coffee Mug is the perk for you! Drink and feel proud that your money is helping kids change the world!

Ambassador--$50

You get to participate in one of MPK’s signature missions:  Helping Military Wounded. We cut used jeans into 4x4 squares, and then you write well-wishes and thank you’s on them. Then, these jean squares are sewn into quilts (not by you-- don’t worry!) and donated to military hospitals. We’ll send you a Helping Military Wounded Mission Pack, which includes 20 jean squares, frames, sharpies, instructions, and everything else you need to show our injured troops your love and support.


Deputy Commander--$75

Feeling like you’re missing a part of your spy gear? Have no fear! The Spy Deluxe Package is for you! Not only do you get the official MPK “Ask Me About My Secret Mission” Flip-shirt, but you'll also receive our TOP SECRET Spy Rearview Sunglasses! They have mirrors on the inside edges of the lenses--very useful for surveillance or to make sure you're not being surveilled! Then, send us a picture of you in your spy shirt and sunglasses (and any other spy gear you want to throw on) doing your best spy pose, and we’ll create and mail you 10 personalized spy business cards!

Don't forget to contact us through the "contact" link beneath our video to let us know the t-shirt size you want:  YS, YM, YL, AS, AM, AL, AXL, AXXL

    


Commander--$100

Another unique opportunity to participate directly in one of MPK's signature missions, the Family Fun for a Cause Mission Pack gives you all the supplies and instructions you need to assemble and stuff 4 heart pillows for children in need. It's great for families, friends, small groups, or doing good while spending quality time in front of the TV! Once you've made your pillows, you can send them back for us to distribute or donate them to children in your community. Either way, that's four more kids who now know someone cares about them, thanks to you. And that makes a world of difference!


Director--$150

Get the ultimate heads-up on the happenings of MPK with an hour-long Skype call with Executive Director Kathy Meadows at Mission Control! Get TOP SECRET info on the latest MPK missions, marketing, managing, or nonprofit advice, or just get to know personally the person behind the cause you're supporting. 

         

Emissary--$275

Still feeling like something's missing from your spy repertoire? Introducing...our world famous Spy Kit! It includes Spy Rearview Sunglasses (see Deputy Commander for description), the official MPK “Ask Me About My Secret Mission” Flip-shirt, a TOP SECRET mission assignment, and a Mission Control ID badge, all in a super slick spy Ipad case! Then, send us a picture of you with your new spy supplies (and any other spy gear you want to throw on) doing your best spy pose, and we’ll create and mail you 10 personalized spy business cards!

You will also be listed as an Emissary Mission Supporter on our website! 

And don't forget to contact us through the "contact" link beneath our video to let us know the t-shirt size you want:  YS, YM, YL, AS, AM, AL, AXL, AXXL


Liaison--$500
Receive temporary clearance to access an exclusive tour of MISSION POSSIBLE KIDS Mission Control--our TOP SECRET business office! Meet with Executive Director Kathy Meadows to get TOP SECRET info on the latest MPK missions, and see in person where all the behind-the-scenes MPK action happens! 


You will also be listed as Liaison Mission Supporter on our website!


Associate--$1000

For donating at $1000 and above, you earn your place on our brand new Spymasters Wall of Honor at Mission Control! And we'll send your name to all of our chapters across North America in our next MPK Insider Newsletter! We'll email you a photo of your name on our Spy Wall of Honor and a copy of our next MPK Insider when it comes out.

You will also be listed as an Associate Mission Supporter on our website!


Associate 1st Class--$2000

Live the spy life for a day and host a mission party for you/your club/your workplace with the MPK “We’re on a Mission!” Kit! Supplies are provided for up to 30 guests to become secret agents for the day and work on a REAL MPK mission, assembling no-sew heart pillows for children in need! It’s team-building with heart! Extra spy activities and our official MPK music CD included.

You will also be listed as an Associate Mission Supporter on our website!


Asset--$5000

Link your name to MISSION POSSIBLE KIDS forever! You will sponsor one of our four new national missions for the upcoming school year. Your name, photo, and/or company logo will be sent with the new mission to all of our chapters across North America. You'll receive a copy of the the mission you're sponsoring when it goes out!

Plus, pick any one perk from Master Agent to Liaison as an extra bonus for your amazing support! Tell us your choice through the "contact" link below our video.

You’ll also be listed as an Asset Mission Supporter on our website!


GET INVOLVED!

Want to help more? Share our campaign through social media, emails, or word of mouth! 

Want to learn more about MISSION POSSIBLE KIDS? Check out our website: www.MISSIONPOSSIBLEKIDS.org

For a look at the countries we serve see https://missionpossiblekids.org/countries-we-serve

Know a kid who might want to be a Special Agent in MISSION POSSIBLE KIDS? Check our chapter locator https://missionpossiblekids.org/mission-control#block-block-13 to see if there’s a chapter near you. If not, consider starting one! https://missionpossiblekids.org/start-a-chapter

And many, many more!           



   



By changing the lives of others, our agents change themselves. They grow into compassionate, self-confident future leaders with a powerful work ethic and a lifelong commitment to volunteering, social responsibility, and giving back.

"There is too much unmet need in the world…MISSION POSSIBLE
KIDS’ vision is to build a much larger and more capable volunteer base both now
and in the future, by starting with America's kids.”--Points of Light Foundation https://missionpossiblekids.org/read-article-mpk-points-light-foundation

JOIN OUR MISSION
We have more than 17,000
current and former agents who, together, have touched more than 2,000,000 lives! Before MPK, no one
believed 1-5th graders could affect such far-reaching change, but it
happened. And now, we want to do more.
We want to give EVERY kid the opportunity
to change the world. And we’re starting in America’s schools, churches, and
other hosting sites.



Two years ago, we launched the pilot MISSION POSSIBLE KIDS
after-school program at Glen Oaks Elementary School in McKinney, TX. It was an
incredible success; to quote the principal, “MPK is the most successful afterschool program we have EVER had, more
than triple the involvement of our other clubs…I can’t wait to see what our
kids do next!”
What we’re doing next is expanding. MISSION POSSIBLE KIDS is
poised to explode into schools and churches across the country. We want to launch ­­­50 more MISSION
POSSIBLE KIDS chapters by this time next year. 
In order to achieve and sustain all of these new chapters
and agents, we need funding! So we’re
asking you to help us reach our goal of $15,000. 
Take a look at what $15,000 could do in just the next year.


That means that just $5 can help a child touch 65 lives. The social impact is ENORMOUS!
Our mission is only possible with your support. Help us help
kids change the world. Donate now.



PERK DETAILS




We’re planning to start sending out perks as soon as you
start sending in donations, so if you're buying a t-shirt or want a name other than your own on a Spy Promotion Certificate or heart pillow tag, please contact us through the “contact” link beneath our video after you donate! 



New Recruit--$5


In thanks for stepping us to support our young “Agents of Change,” you’ll get a social media shout out from Mission Control on Facebook and Twitter expressing our gratitude for your support. SPY FIVE!




Special Agent--$10Congratulations, honorary agent! You have reached the rank “Special Agent,” and we’ll email you a personalized Spy Promotion Certificate from Mission Control! FYI, MPK Agents receive a promotion after successfully completing 6 missions, rising in rank the more they do to help other people. Giving (fun spy-themed!) recognition is an integral part of our program, and we want to give you a similar experience the more you help us, our Agents, and all the people they serve! 

If you would prefer a name other than your own on the certificate, just let us know when you place your donation through the "contact" link under our video. 




Master Agent--$15
The nation’s youngest, and most successful spy team, our own Spy5, Crystal Clear, Maxx Risk, Sonic Shadow, Checkmate, and their leader, KC Legend, will send you 1 of 5 exclusive Spy5 postcards signed by one of the Spy5 with a TOP SECRET message just for you! We'll send you the postcard(s) in an envelope, so you can keep it as a collectible or pass on the empowerment to someone else!







Special Forces Officer--$25
Heart Pillows for Kids in Need has become one of MPK's signature missions. Our Agents make these wonderful heart pillows from shoelace and fleece and send them to orphanages and refugee camps all over the world with messages of love and support! At this perk level, we will make one heart pillow especially for you and donate it to a child in need--one more life your gift can touch! We’ll email you a picture of the heart with your name on its tag. 
If you would like a name other than your own on the tag,  just let us know when you place your donation through the "contact" link under our video.





Deputy Chief Officer--$30You will receive ALL 5 of the exclusive signed Spy5 Postcards from our elite spy team, the Spy5! We'll send you the postcards in an envelope, so you can keep it as a collectible or pass on the empowerment to someone else!







Chief Officer--$35
Spread the spy love and sponsor 1 heart pillow for a child in need and receive your own to keep! We’ll email you a picture of the heart with your name on its tag. Sleep soundly on your pillow knowing that you made a difference in the life of another.

If you would like a name other than your own on the tag or if you would like us to donate both heart pillows, just let us know when you place your donation through the "contact" link under our video.






Chief Officer--$35
Now you’re really part of the team! Get the official Mission Possible Kids “Ask Me About My Secret Mission” Flip-shirts in our trademark inconspicuous bright green. Then, send us a picture of you in your spy shirt (and any other spy gear you want to throw on--dark sunglasses recommended!) doing your best spy pose, and we’ll create and mail you 10 personalized spy business cards!
Don't forget to contact us through the "contact" link beneath our video to let us know the t-shirt size you want:  YS, YM, YL, AS, AM, AL, AXL, AXXL
 


NEW PERK:  Chief Officer--$35

Spies love their coffee! If you do too, this official MPK “We're on a Mission” Coffee Mug is the perk for you! Drink and feel proud that your money is helping kids change the world!






Ambassador--$50You get to participate in one of MPK’s signature missions:  Helping Military Wounded. We cut used jeans into 4x4 squares, and then you write well-wishes and thank you’s on them. Then, these jean squares are sewn into quilts (not by you-- don’t worry!) and donated to military hospitals. We’ll send you a Helping Military Wounded Mission Pack, which includes 20 jean squares, frames, sharpies, instructions, and everything else you need to show our injured troops your love and support.




Deputy Commander--$75
Feeling like you’re missing a part of your spy gear? Have no fear! The Spy Deluxe Package is for you! Not only do you get the official MPK “Ask Me About My Secret Mission” Flip-shirt, but you'll also receive our TOP SECRET Spy Rearview Sunglasses! They have mirrors on the inside edges of the lenses--very useful for surveillance or to make sure you're not being surveilled! Then, send us a picture of you in your spy shirt and sunglasses (and any other spy gear you want to throw on) doing your best spy pose, and we’ll create and mail you 10 personalized spy business cards!

Don't forget to contact us through the "contact" link beneath our video to let us know the t-shirt size you want:  YS, YM, YL, AS, AM, AL, AXL, AXXL

    


Commander--$100Another unique opportunity to participate directly in one of MPK's signature missions, the Family Fun for a Cause Mission Pack gives you all the supplies and instructions you need to assemble and stuff 4 heart pillows for children in need. It's great for families, friends, small groups, or doing good while spending quality time in front of the TV! Once you've made your pillows, you can send them back for us to distribute or donate them to children in your community. Either way, that's four more kids who now know someone cares about them, thanks to you. And that makes a world of difference!





Director--$150Get the ultimate heads-up on the happenings of MPK with an hour-long Skype call with Executive Director Kathy Meadows at Mission Control! Get TOP SECRET info on the latest MPK missions, marketing, managing, or nonprofit advice, or just get to know personally the person behind the cause you're supporting.          
Emissary--$275
Still feeling like something's missing from your spy repertoire? Introducing...our world famous Spy Kit! It includes Spy Rearview Sunglasses (see Deputy Commander for description), the official MPK “Ask Me About My Secret Mission” Flip-shirt, a TOP SECRET mission assignment, and a Mission Control ID badge, all in a super slick spy Ipad case! Then, send us a picture of you with your new spy supplies (and any other spy gear you want to throw on) doing your best spy pose, and we’ll create and mail you 10 personalized spy business cards!
You will also be listed as an Emissary Mission Supporter on our website! 
And don't forget to contact us through the "contact" link beneath our video to let us know the t-shirt size you want:  YS, YM, YL, AS, AM, AL, AXL, AXXL


Liaison--$500

Receive temporary clearance to access an exclusive tour of MISSION POSSIBLE KIDS Mission Control--our TOP SECRET business office! Meet with Executive Director Kathy Meadows to get TOP SECRET info on the latest MPK missions, and see in person where all the behind-the-scenes MPK action happens! 


You will also be listed as Liaison Mission Supporter on our website!


Associate--$1000
For donating at $1000 and above, you earn your place on our brand new Spymasters Wall of Honor at Mission Control! And we'll send your name to all of our chapters across North America in our next MPK Insider Newsletter! We'll email you a photo of your name on our Spy Wall of Honor and a copy of our next MPK Insider when it comes out.
You will also be listed as an Associate Mission Supporter on our website!



Associate 1st Class--$2000
Live the spy life for a day and host a mission party for
you/your club/your workplace with the MPK “We’re on a Mission!” Kit! Supplies
are provided for up to 30 guests to become secret agents for the day and work
on a REAL MPK mission, assembling no-sew heart pillows for children in need! It’s team-building with heart! Extra spy activities and our official MPK music CD included.


You will also be listed as an Associate Mission Supporter on our website!


Asset--$5000
Link your name to MISSION POSSIBLE KIDS forever! You will sponsor one of our four new national missions for the upcoming school year. Your name, photo, and/or company logo will be sent with the new mission to all of our chapters across North America. You'll receive a copy of the the mission you're sponsoring when it goes out!
Plus, pick any one perk from Master Agent to Liaison as an extra bonus for your amazing support! Tell us your choice through the "contact" link below our video.
You’ll also be listed as an Asset Mission Supporter on our website!





GET INVOLVED!
Want to help more? Share our campaign through social media, emails, or word of mouth! 


Want to learn more about MISSION POSSIBLE KIDS? Check out our website: www.MISSIONPOSSIBLEKIDS.org

For a look at the countries we serve see https://missionpossiblekids.org/countries-we-serve
Know a kid who might want to be a Special Agent in MISSION POSSIBLE KIDS? Check our chapter
locator https://missionpossiblekids.org/mission-control#block-block-13
to see if there’s a chapter near you. If not, consider starting one! https://missionpossiblekids.org/start-a-chapter

story:
The Story

Loisaida Inc is a non-profit, community-development organization located in the Lower East Side (Loisada) neighborhood of Manhattan that is currently organizing an important exhibition, ¡Presente! The Young Lords in New York, from July 30-October 10, 2015. Like many non-profits, we rely upon the generosity of community members and the general public to help sponsor many of our activities. In order to realize this exhibit, we are seeking financial support from those who understand the importance and necessity of communicating lesser-known perspectives of the Young Lords legacy within the Lower East Side, and their impact upon New York’s cultural scenes. Now we have a high visibility opportunity to shape the narrative around Puerto Rican/Latin@ contributions and footprint to lower Manhattan. Our curatorial team has already confirmed and gathered the participation of high-caliber photographers, mixed-media artists and nationally recognized scholars to collaborate, contribute to, and participate in the first multi-site exhibition surveying the Young Lords Organization/Party.

What We Need 

 Your support will help us underwrite the physical elements of the exhibit such as never before seen historical photographs, panels, print photos, display mounts, and interactive elements like videos and audio elements. With the funds we hope to be able to produce the best exhibit possible for all visitors. 


The Impact

We hope that our exhibit does the following

·  Enriches the Lower East Side and general NYC community through the display of archival imagery, historical contributions and events we have researched.

·  Attains a high level of excellence in Loisaida Inc.'s  first partnership with prestigious cultural NYC institutions, such as the Bronx Museum and El Museo del Barrio. 

·  Helps visitors to reflect on the role played by Latin@s in civil rights issues and the impact of the Young Lord's legacy through cultural activism in their aftermath.

·  Shows the progression of social issues and the role of artistic styles in the factors that influenced those changes. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, here are other ways you can help!

·  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign

·  Come and see the final installed exhibit when it opens on July 30th -or any of the related events until Oct 10th!

 We have been working extremely hard and are so excited to see this exhibit become a physical reality! We now need your help!

*In the spirit of the organizational structure of the Lords, we presented a similar tier to reflect the different contributions supporters can make to this campaign.

The Loisaida Inc. Center is one of the two Puerto Rican /Latino based multi-use facility remaining in the downtown area. We aspire to build a connection between community, learners, artists and scholars through affordable education opportunities in cultural fields, S.T.E.A.M. (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts and Mathematics) design and everyday life. 

Its multi-purpose space aims to become an incubator for self-sustainable artisanal, technology, and culinary arts entrepreneurial initiatives. Devoted to collaborative art practices, social engagement and community building through culture, the vision is to facilitate a mindset of exploration. Our approach celebrates the urban surroundings, grassroots invention and immigrant spirit of the Loisaida neighborhood in its dedication to celebrate Latino cultural vitality and their contributions to NYC.

story:
Our society is a beautiful mix of different ethnicities, cultures, and personalities. Unfortunately, when a consumer ventures into toy stores or searches online, there aren’t many positive, educational, and diverse options available. Melanites is revolutionizing what it means to have toys and products for boys. We are challenging social norms about gender and diversity.

Melanites is introducing the first line of boy dolls of color. Our Action Pals combine the emotional appeal of a doll and the articulation of an action figure. Representation is the cornerstone of our foundation so each pal is designed with diverse skin tones, facial features, and hairs types.

  • 16 inches tall 
  • 11 points of articulation
  • Full vinyl body
  • Real wig hair
  • For boys & girls ages 4+

 

 

 

 

Melanites Action Pals are based on four characters who are nine year old boys with different personalities. They represent the “Thinker, Doer, Maker, and Performer” in all of us. Our accompanying storybooks and games follow the crew as they go on different adventures that highlight S.T.E.M. and the importance of staying true to yourself.

Our philosophy of AND is reflected in their multi-faceted interests. Instead of crafting the characters to be within specific professions, I created four building blocks. They are meant to highlight the Thinker, Doer, Maker and Performer in every child. Who knows who the next entrepreneur, engineer, or artist will be!

The first four Melanites boys are Jaylen, Aiden, Marcus, and Sid! 

 

Now we need your help!  In order to make Melanites a reality, we have to meet our manufacturers minimum order quantity of 1,000 units. 

This is where YOU come in. Every pledge will go towards the production cost of making one of the first boy dolls of color! As we grow, we plan to include accompanying storybooks and games that represent the possibilities for every child’s future.

Our team of passionate advisors and experts make the great combination to make this a reality. As the founder, I have been a volunteer and mentor for over 7 years since high school. My combined passion and business degrees from the University of Miami (BBA 15’) and Babson College (MS ‘16) make me the driving visionary force. 

Impact

We are more than just a toy company. By backing this project, you’re helping create a world in which young boys can not only see their identity around them, but watch it be celebrated. 

Melanites means Melanin filled, it’s a reminder that the diversity of our society is a name and a face. We want to hear from you! Tell us what you think by emailing us at Jennifer@BrownBoyhood.com

Risks and challenges

We are aware that there may be unforeseen production challenges with any manufacturing project. With this in mind, we have built relationships with more than one factory and any updates will be shared with our crowdfunding community.

Ship date: We have built in extra time for the manufacturing process and are confident we will ship by the projected dates, but there is always a chance that things will take longer than planned.

Product changes: As we refine the doll based on additional community feedback and more product testing, slight changes may be made. We'll only make changes that enhance the product experience.

Supplier coordination:  We work with a variety of suppliers to source the best materials and ensure the doll is developed correctly.

story:
Gizelxanath Rodriguez, of the Yaqui people, has committed her artistic work to bringing awareness of their struggle in the United States to help put pressure on the Mexican state to end its repression of the Yaquis.

With her band, the Afro-Yaqui Music Collective, we aim to raise funds to create a video and tour the United States, raising more awareness and resources for the Yaqui Water defenders.

Water is life, no matter what country you are in. Now more than ever is the time to break down walls that separate us from others’ struggles, which in an interconnected world, are also our own.

What We Need & What You Get

$2500 should be enough to get the needed film equipment and transportation rentals so we can initiate a public awareness tour in multiple cities and communities throughout the United States. An award-winning vocalist, Gizelxanath and her partner Ben Barson will bring their music, poetry and politics throughout the states to educate people on the Yaqui struggle and show them how they can help. A little bit of American pressure goes a long way and we hope this can curtail the Mexican state's violation of Yaqui rights and reverse the aqueduct.

We would be honored to share with you CDs of great music by Gizelxanath and Ben Barson, as well as literature that we have contributed to, or even provide a private performance.

The Impact

We have a long struggle ahead of us. Pentagon experts suggest future wars will be over water. Meanwhile, indigenous communities have been protecting environments the world over -- it is no coincidence that 80 percent of Earth's remaining biodiversity areas are also indigenous territories. The waste and abuse of natural resource systems must be resisted. The Afro-Yaqui Music Collective has performed at fundraisers for, donated instruments to, and given workshops and performance for indigenous communities in Papantla and Chiapas. In the United States, the Afro-Yaqui Music Collective have performed in cities from Vermont to Chicago and been fierce advocates of indigenous human and ecological rights. Now we want to take raise the level of our contribution, but we need your help to do so.

We do not expect this to be easy. In the current political climate, anything can happen. But as the great activist and writer Frantz Fanon said, 'Each generation must, out of relative obscurity, discover its mission, fulfill it, or betray it.' Now is the time. With runaway climate change 200 species going extinct each day due to ecological catastrophe, we must do what we can to make a difference. Help make one today by providing a vehicle to spread awareness of the Yaqui water protectors and their struggle.

story:
Mi a szakkollégium?

A szakkollégium története a brit "college" elnevezésű intézményekig nyúlik vissza, amelyek a szakmai fejlődést előtérbe helyező kollégiumok voltak a 19. századtól. Magyarország első szakkollégiuma 1970-ben alakult Budapesten. Ezt követve, elsőként fővárosi, majd vidéki diákszerveződések indultak országszerte. A szakkollégium egy szakmai és egyben baráti közösség, egyetemi diákszervezet, melynek tagjai támogatók egymást önálló kutatásokban, továbbá közösen végeznek tanulmányi munkát. A magyarországi Szakkollégiumi Mozgalom 3 alappillére a szakmaiság, a közösség és a társadalmi érzékenység.

A szakkollégiumokban a  magas színvonalú szakmai munka és tehetséggondozás van előtérbe helyezve, beleértve a kiemelkedő képességű és a hátrányos helyzetű diákokat is. Fontos alapérték a diákönkormányzatiság és az alulról szerveződés, a megfelelő közösségi élethez pedig elengedhetetlen az együttlakó bázis. Az egyének az egyetemi tananyagot meghaladó ismereteket az elméleti és gyakorlati tudás összekapcsolásával, kurzusok, előadások formájában sajátíthatják el.

Mi a NYATA?

A Nyári Szakkollégiumi Találkozó (NYATA) a Szakkollégiumi Mozgalom legfontosabb, immáron több évtizedes hagyománnyal rendelkező, évenkénti Találkozója, ahol a hazai, illetve kárpát-medencei szakkollégiumok hallgatói vesznek részt. A szakkollégiumok, mint a hazai felsőoktatás tehetséggondozásának fontos műhelyei, kiemelt figyelmet fordítanak tagjaik, a kollégisták emberi, szakmai fejlődésére, valamint társadalmi érzékenységére.

Mitől különleges a NYATA20?

Technológia és társadalom

Közös gondolkodás különböző szakterületekről
Szakmai programok, előadások, workshopok
Vitakultúra fejlesztése
Barátságok, kapcsolatok
Felejthetetlen élmény, mini-fesztivál hangulat

​3 szakkollégium közös erőfeszítései:

Energetikai Szakkollégium
Simonyi Károly Szakkollégium
Széchenyi István Szakkollégium

2 egyetem tudásának ötvözése a szervezésben:​

Budapesti Corvinus Egyetem
Budapesti Műszaki és Gazdaságtudományi Egyetem

***

Támogass minket!

A részvételi díj fejenként ~50 USD, amelyet nagyon sok fiatal, érdeklődő egyetemista nem engedhet meg magának. Célunk, hogy arányos támogatói rendszerrel a szakkollégisták kedvezményes áron vehessenek részt a Találkozón. A 50 USD-os részvételi díj azonban csak egy részét fedezi csak az egy főre jutó költségeknek, így ezen felül minden adományt külön megköszönünk.

Az 50 USD tartalmazza a szállást, napi háromszori étkezést, a részvételt szakmai és közösségi programokon, valamint promóciós ajándékokat, mint repohár, jegyzettömb, toll.

Hogyan segíthetsz nekünk?

Többféle támogatói csomagot állítottunk össze, így mindenki kiveheti a részét a NYATA megvalósításából:

  • 5 $-os támogatói csomag
  • 10 $-os támogatói csomag, melyet NYATA20 emléklappal honorálunk
  • 50 $-os támogatói csomag, melyet NYATA20 pólóval hálálunk meg
  • 100 $-os támogatói csomag: ha nem csak egy diáknak, hanem magadnak is örömet szeretnél okozni, legyél Te is a NYATA20 résztvevője!
  • 200 $-os támogatói csomag, további szponzori kategóriákért lépj kapcsolatba a szervezőkkel!

***

A Nyári Szakkollégiumi Találkozó rövid története

A legelső Találkozót 1985-ben rendezték Szarvason. Azóta az utóbbi időkig néhány kivételtől eltekintve kétévente kerültek megrendezésre. Az első Nyári Találkozók erősen politikai töltetűek voltak, ellenzéki hangnemben szerveződtek; ugyanakkor céljuk volt az országban fellelhető problémák megvitatása. Az utolsó politizáló NYATA az 1988-as Találkozó volt. A Találkozók nagy szerepet játszottak a később közéletileg aktív akkori szakkollégista generáció életében, a szakkollégiumok, mint szellemi műhelyek, elismerten komoly szerepet játszottak az átalakulás folyamatában.

A rendszerváltás után többnyire a magyar társadalom egy-egy problémája köré szerveződtek a Találkozók, valamint kiemelt feladatuk volt a szakkollégiumi mozgalom erősítése és szakkollégiumok feladatának, felsőoktatásban elfoglalt helyének definiálása. A Szakkollégiumi Charta lefektetésére is egy Nyári Találkozón (Zánka, 1991) került sor. A mai napig az országos szakkollégiumi közösség egyik legfontosabb eseményei ezek a találkozók, ahol az ország különböző pontjairól és határon túlról érkező szakkollégisták találkozhatnak egymással, és aktuális kérdéseket vitathatnak meg.

***

Eddigi Találkozók

1985: Szarvas
1987: Pápa
1988: Balatonszárszó
1991: Zánka
1993: Fadd-Dombori
1995: Csopak
1998: Baja
2000: Kemence
2002: Kemence
2004: Gyalu (Erdély)
2006: Eger
2008: Fadd-Dombori
2010: Pécs
2011: Nagyvárad (Erdély)
2012: Velence
2013: Eger-Felsőtárkány
2014: Balatonfenyves
2015: Kolozsvár (Erdély)
2016: Szeged
story_txt:
Mi a szakkollégium?A szakkollégium története a brit "college" elnevezésű intézményekig nyúlik vissza, amelyek a szakmai fejlődést előtérbe helyező kollégiumok voltak a 19. századtól. Magyarország első szakkollégiuma 1970-ben alakult Budapesten. Ezt követve, elsőként fővárosi, majd vidéki diákszerveződések indultak országszerte. A szakkollégium egy szakmai és egyben baráti közösség, egyetemi diákszervezet, melynek tagjai támogatók egymást önálló kutatásokban, továbbá közösen végeznek tanulmányi munkát. A magyarországi Szakkollégiumi Mozgalom 3 alappillére a szakmaiság, a közösség és a társadalmi érzékenység.A szakkollégiumokban a  magas színvonalú szakmai munka és tehetséggondozás van előtérbe helyezve, beleértve a kiemelkedő képességű és a hátrányos helyzetű diákokat is. Fontos alapérték a diákönkormányzatiság és az alulról szerveződés, a megfelelő közösségi élethez pedig elengedhetetlen az együttlakó bázis. Az egyének az egyetemi tananyagot meghaladó ismereteket az elméleti és gyakorlati tudás összekapcsolásával, kurzusok, előadások formájában sajátíthatják el.Mi a NYATA?A Nyári Szakkollégiumi Találkozó (NYATA) a Szakkollégiumi Mozgalom legfontosabb, immáron több évtizedes hagyománnyal rendelkező, évenkénti Találkozója, ahol a hazai, illetve kárpát-medencei szakkollégiumok hallgatói vesznek részt. A szakkollégiumok, mint a hazai felsőoktatás tehetséggondozásának fontos műhelyei, kiemelt figyelmet fordítanak tagjaik, a kollégisták emberi, szakmai fejlődésére, valamint társadalmi érzékenységére.Mitől különleges a NYATA20?Technológia és társadalomKözös gondolkodás különböző szakterületekrőlSzakmai programok, előadások, workshopokVitakultúra fejlesztéseBarátságok, kapcsolatokFelejthetetlen élmény, mini-fesztivál hangulat​3 szakkollégium közös erőfeszítései:Energetikai SzakkollégiumSimonyi Károly SzakkollégiumSzéchenyi István Szakkollégium2 egyetem tudásának ötvözése a szervezésben:​Budapesti Corvinus EgyetemBudapesti Műszaki és Gazdaságtudományi Egyetem***Támogass minket!A részvételi díj fejenként ~50 USD, amelyet nagyon sok fiatal, érdeklődő egyetemista nem engedhet meg magának. 5 $-os támogatói csomag
10 $-os támogatói csomag, melyet NYATA20 emléklappal honorálunk
50 $-os támogatói csomag, melyet NYATA20 pólóval hálálunk meg
100 $-os támogatói csomag: ha nem csak egy diáknak, hanem magadnak is örömet szeretnél okozni, legyél Te is a NYATA20 résztvevője!
200 $-os támogatói csomag, további szponzori kategóriákért lépj kapcsolatba a szervezőkkel!

Az utolsó politizáló NYATA az 1988-as Találkozó volt. A Találkozók nagy szerepet játszottak a később közéletileg aktív akkori szakkollégista generáció életében, a szakkollégiumok, mint szellemi műhelyek, elismerten komoly szerepet játszottak az átalakulás folyamatában.A rendszerváltás után többnyire a magyar társadalom egy-egy problémája köré szerveződtek a Találkozók, valamint kiemelt feladatuk volt a szakkollégiumi mozgalom erősítése és szakkollégiumok feladatának, felsőoktatásban elfoglalt helyének definiálása. A mai napig az országos szakkollégiumi közösség egyik legfontosabb eseményei ezek a találkozók, ahol az ország különböző pontjairól és határon túlról érkező szakkollégisták találkozhatnak egymással, és aktuális kérdéseket vitathatnak meg.***Eddigi Találkozók1985: Szarvas1987: Pápa1988: Balatonszárszó1991: Zánka1993: Fadd-Dombori1995: Csopak1998: Baja2000: Kemence2002: Kemence2004: Gyalu (Erdély)2006: Eger2008: Fadd-Dombori2010: Pécs2011: Nagyvárad (Erdély)2012: Velence2013: Eger-Felsőtárkány2014: Balatonfenyves2015: Kolozsvár (Erdély)2016: Szeged

story:
On April 25, 2015 an earthquake with a 7.8 magnitude struck  Nepal, leaving  a massive trail of destruction behind. According to the latest UN estimates, close to  eight million Nepalis are affected .

The death toll has risen to more than 4000 , and will continue to rise over the next few weeks. Left to survive are close to one million children who need your help to ensure they are safe, healthy and secure in a shelter.

With more aftershock happenings, and some 80 percent of homes, schools, hospitals  and education facilities destroyed in some districts, people are sleeping in the streets,  makeshift tents or sewage pipes.  Survivors are desperate for shelter and food. In many places, there is a strong smell stink of dead bodies in the rubble waiting to be collected. 

Nepal  will undoubtedly require the help of the global community urgently.  Young people including children and young women in particular, are the most affected from these tragic events  which could have lasting consequences on their life. 

Helping Nepal is a collective effort requiring the commitment of organizations, volunteers, time and money. World Youth Foundation is contributing to the relief and rebuilding effort by raising funds to support  NGOs,  especially youth organizations, children and animal shelter homes in their rebuilding  and reconstruction effort.  World Youth Foundation, a registered organization in Malaysia, has a documented history of supporting youth through its mission to educate, engage and empower young people around the globe. 

The goal is to raise $10,000 which will be distributed through credible international and local organizations  i.e. UNICEF,  ICRC, Save the Children, JCI that  are working in Nepal. To raise the required sum World Youth Foundation  requires your support to make it a reality and any donation is greatly appreciated. Children and youth are the future of any country. With your donation, the displaced youth and children in Nepal will be able to rebuild their lives  and have a greater chance for survival.

Funds received will be used for  the following:

  • Sanitation and hygiene material, water purification kits
  • Nutritious food
  • Construction supplies to rebuild homes, schools and shelter homes for children and animals
We as a global community are seeking your generous support to help us rebuild  Nepal. Please help us spread the word by telling your friends, family and colleagues to support this wonderful cause. Together we will make a difference!

story:
Let's create a dream school!

Hi, I'm Enicia Fisher, Founder of The Element School. I'm a teacher, writer, yogi, proud mom of two bright and creative kids, and I care deeply about education and lifelong learning. I love to build community and I am passionate about bringing people together to care for each other and the earth. I have a Master's degree in education and started out teaching in a special education classroom. I've taught all ages, from elementary through high school, college writing, and creativity courses at my local yoga studio. For the past ten years I've taught an integrated arts enrichment program to homeschoolers in my local community with the long-held vision of starting an independent school based on my passion for creativity, ecology, and community. I'm ready to offer the unique model I've developed as a model independent school for elementary, middle, and high school students.

We are super excited to launch The Element School! Once we finally secure a site for our programs, we are going to use this as a model school with the intent of developing sister schools in other communities across the globe. This site will serve as a home for our day school programs, after-school arts outreach, family and community education programs. We'll also establish a permaculture community garden.

I have created a vision for holistic education based on a platform of consciousness in education. In my forthcoming book, Learning to Thrive, I have articulated 5 lenses of consciousness that enhance learning and empower students: creative, social, environmental, global, and empowerment consciousness. I believe the vision and design of The Element School has great potential to bless and transform individual lives and communities, not just in my backyard but as a model that can be replicated according to the unique needs and interests of other communities.

What We Need & What You Get

We need a minimum of $43,188 in start-up expenses to get the school up and running. This amount will go toward the lease deposit and first month's rent, the city permit, remodeling, upcycling furniture, infrastructure for the community garden, basic classroom supplies, and incorporation & professional fees including establishing a non-profit 501c3 so that we can apply for grants to provide a healthy scholarship fund for student tuition. We want our private school to be accessible to any student who truly desires to be a part of our program.

We've chosen flexible funding so that whatever funds we raise will go straight into startup costs. Any extra amount will go toward student scholarships.

We think you'll be excited about our unique perks. We've created a "Pay it Forward" campaign. Rather than focusing on giving you a bunch of stuff you probably don't want, we're going to show you a key element of our school: our social enterprise business model. For each level of donation, we'll do a unique service project for others, expanding your donation into a ripple effect of kindness and empowerment that will reach countless people! (You'll still get some fun goodies which I know you'll LOVE!)

Our perks also relate to the 5 lenses of consciousness...check it out!

You'll get a handmade friendship bracelet with a compassion meditation woven into it (may you be happy, well, and filled with peace), beautiful inspirational art prints created by a student artist (see the "gallery page" to view them!), an advanced reading copy of my upcoming book Learning to Thrive, establish a guild in your honor in our community garden, sponsor a mindfulness mini-retreat for parents, sponsor a student through a scholarship, and create a ripple effect of good in the world!

The Impact

Your contributions will directly benefit students and families in our community, and will continue their impact through our commitment to environmental and social service and our plans to develop a sister school model.

I have built a vital community around this vision and I have individuals and families ready and waiting to make this vision a reality. Since 2005 I've successfully offered
this program on a part-time basis in a variety of community settings, so I expect even greater success with our own site, a team of fantastic teachers, and a full-time school full of students actively co-creating an excellent, innovative, empowering educational program.

We don't just want your money! Other ways you can help:

We hope you are inspired and we appreciate your generosity and financial support.

We also need to get the word out to as many people as possible. Please share our campaign with your networks, and tell people why you are personally interested and supportive of The Element School.

Use the Indiegogo share tools on our campaign page to generate as much traffic as possible to our page. If you share from Indiegogo, we will get more support from them and will possibly get featured on their home page!

Film credits

I hope you enjoyed the promo video that introduces this campaign. It was directed and produced by my son, Alden Blake, the first official graduate of The Element School. He is now completing his second year of community college and preparing to transfer to a university program in the Fall. The amazing teens appearing in the film are some of the great kids in my life who inspire me every day.

Thank you!

Thank you for taking the time to read this, watch the video, and for your support of our campaign. Please donate as much as you can today to help us gain and keep momentum, and please stay engaged with the campaign to help us celebrate our milestones as we reach our goal! If you haven't already, check out our website (TheElementSchool.org) and sign up for our email list and join our community on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. We love to interact with our community online and can't wait to invite you to our Grand Opening Celebration in the near future!

Investors welcome. If you'd like to invest, please feel free to get in touch!

Thanks for sharing the LOVE!
