selected her as one of 22 world leaders for their 2009 Peace Fellowship.  In 2014, marking the 100th
anniversary of World War I, she was selected along with 59 other global
activists, to be a Salzburg Global Seminar Fellow and participate in an
international consortium on the power of arts and culture to transform our
world.  A participant in the Clinton
Global Initiative, she configured the Genesis Academy for Global Leadership as
a scalable global model for peace education (her CGI commitment.) Her medical
career informs the healing aspects at the heart of Genesis.

II.  What We Need + What You Get:
We need to raise $150,000 USD to bring 20 global students to
the 2016 Summer Institute.  These funds
will cover not only  international travel
+ room and board (at a university center), but also all ground transportation,
supplies/educational materials, faculty honoraria, field studies, admission for
all museums and other visited institutions, and the final closing ceremony
showcasing their work.  
(All surplus funds go towards future Genesis Academy Summer
Institutes and building The Genesis Academy for Global Leadership, a $34
million boarding high-school school with endowed scholarships for its future
students.) 
The Perks:
Depending upon your level of support, our peacebuilding-perk
gifts range the gamut from your very own Genesis Saffron Caravan CD or a unique
set of our peace quilt cards designed by children with their vision for world
peace, a Genesis guitar pick or a personalized engraved brick along the Genesis
Academy’s Path to Peace.  You can have
your name proudly displayed on our website for funding a student's travel or
full scholarship.  Greater investment on
your part, could create your personal sponsorship of a Saffron Caravan concert to
help us raise even more...
III. Impact
In this conflict-saturated world, we believe innovative
education will provide the most powerful way to address and solve intractable
problems and thereby, transform humanity. 

What if you had a hand in helping us find next-generation
global youth leaders and invest in them by supporting this unique educational
program?  
Giving to the 2016 Genesis Academy Summer Institute empowers
you to bring real opportunity not only to conflict-torn areas of the world, but
also to the future prospects for peace by nurturing bright, young leaders
through the arts and a rich experiential curriculum.  Moreover, it helps lay the foundation (within
the next three years), for building the Genesis Academy for Global
Leadership:  a four-year boarding high
school in Chicago that will immerse future leaders in four years of the same
arts-rich curriculum, designed by experts. 

When students work and learn in cross-cultural teams, they
learn to respect one another and appreciate diverse perspectives different from
their own.  An inter-disciplinary
curriculum embedded with art cultivates both their critical thinking and
humanism.  Our Academy, which
incorporates an incubator- lab for academic studies on creativity and
leadership, engages our four university partners: University of Pennsylvania,
Stanford University School of Medicine Center for Compassion and Altruism,
Indiana University Lilly Family School of Philanthropy and DePaul University.
(Others are in progress...)
Genesis at the Crossroads has been healing conflict through
education and the arts for 16 years.  The
2015 Summer Institute already enriched the lives of young people from conflict
and post- conflict zones around the world. 
Our students came from Pakistan, Cambodia, Northern Ireland, Bosnia, and
the US.  Together, they explored many
complex issues locally and globally, accomplished professionally crafted blogs,
recorded podcasts of renowned heroes working in human rights and environmental
sustainability, created frameworks for children’s stories addressing pressing global
issues and wrote the lyrics and score for an original song and professionally recorded
it in a music studio.  They created
photography exhibits, journaled about their personal journey, and became a
community of internationally-networked youth leaders - “Ambassadors for
Peacebuilding.”

IV.  Risks and Challenges:
We have a 16-year proven track record of doing educational
and artistic programs in a variety of settings in and outside the classroom and
of producing programs all over the world, some in times of great challenge–
from Morocco, to Jerusalem and the Bedouin community during the Arab Spring, to
Bosnia in the 20th anniversary year of the genocide in the former
Yugoslavia - to those at home in Chicago and across the US. We have faced visa issues for artists and
students, prevailed despite conflict crises worldwide, and continue to employ a
smart, creative and tenacious team of artists, educators and managers to
deliver our programs.  
The Summer Institute gives us not only valuable experience,
partnerships and expertise, but also helps us build a coalition and network of
supporters to realize the vision of the Genesis Academy for Global
Leadership.  In the longer term, we face
the challenges of building this new school in Chicago – a four-year boarding high
school that will include the Summer Institute as its summer quarter.  We need to purchase land, build the
facilities, furnish technology and libraries, develop curricula, pay teachers
and artists, and house our students. 
This vision requires expertise and a budget of $34 million USD.  We look forward to also endowing
scholarships to make this financially accessible for qualified, talented students
from all over the world.
While some have suggested we use a closed-down school and
build the boarding school at a later date, we prefer to build our educational
movement, model and our institutional legacy with our vision for a boarding community that engages young
people in transformative education in social justice, human rights and the arts
while they live and learn
together.  If this takes a few years
beyond 2018, we will continue the Genesis Academy Summer Institute as is, along
with all of our other Saffron Caravan and Salon programs, in the meantime – we think
it will be worth the wait!

Other Ways to
Provide Service:

Media
skills
Subject
matter expertise in curriculum development
Finance/Asset
management skills
Project
managerial or executive assistance support
Fundraising/Development
support
Help
identify promising youth leaders 
Share
Genesis with your community and spread the word


Please share our story...share
our website - www.gatc.org
Peace education and
true peacebuilding happen in incremental steps. 

YOUR support speeds up the process.  
We ALL benefit.

Thank you in advance
for your generosity!


To learn more about
Genesis at the Crossroads and Saffron Caravan:
https://m.soundcloud.com/wbez-worldview/genesis-at-the-crossroads-presents-saffron-caravan
http://www.usip.org/events/using-the-arts-promote-human-rights-in-peacebuilding

story:
My name is Sarina Singh. I am a former social worker, with 20+ years experience. I gave up the profession because of its radical neo- marxist feminist agenda which views the world through the lens of the oppressor and the oppressed. There was a time when I also held these views, but I evolved when I saw the damage victim grievance culture is inflicting on society.  Increasingly, I became alarmed at the silencing of free speech on University and college campuses. Many speakers in recent months and years have been disinvited because individuals are choosing to silence and de- platform speakers, rather, than debate the merits of their arguments.  Those who are silenced tend to be conservative in their views and values.  University administrators and faculty who are supposed encourge free speech and debate and exhange of ideas are complicit in silencing dissenting views. My sense is this is why Trump won in America even though he clearly lacks the leadership skills to become President.  I worry about my country Canada going down a dangerous path with the recent passing of Bill C 16 and the Islamophobia bill M -103 . I worry this will motivate people here to also lean towards more radical and fringe positions. What we are witnessing with mass protests, polarization and civil unrest in the US could become a reality here if we do not learn from the mistakes of history.  I wanted to do something even if I am a drop in the ocean, remaining silent is not an option. As such, I spent months organizing a free speech event all on my own and it was scheduled to occur on August 22nd.  The event was titled" the stifling of free speech on univ campuses". The speakers were: Dr. Jordan Peterson, Dr. Saad, Dr. Amitay and Faith Goldy. The event was cancelled last minute by Ryerson University, citing security and safety concerns. Ryerson was getting calls from Antifa and other fascists organizations demanding  the event be shut down. These organizations refer to the panelists and me in the most derogatory and offensive manner - epithets used are to vulgar to repeat. After the event was shut down, the fascists gleefully celebrated on social platform at their victory of silencing " fascists". These organizations want to deny people the right to free speech, reason and debate.  The panelists and me are all people who support enlightment values and classic liberalism and are not linked with any bigoted groups. I dedicated my entire life to working with very high risk and marginalized of all cultures, religions, socio-economic backgrounds, orientations and ethnicities,. The suggestion that I am bigoted is beyond astounding.  Our crime for which the event was shut down is that we would NOT support the neo - Marxist agenda which increasingly is focused on identity politics, victimhood and a hierarchal understanding of entitlement and rights. On the other hand, we passionately believe in free speech for all and are of the Milton/Mill school of thought that all arguments should be presented and heard no matter how offensive and insulting. It is in the open forum, that bad and dangerous ideas get exposed and are not driven underground. Make no mistake, free speech in Canada and the western world is in grave peril.  In researching for this event, it was clear that this is a scourge not only impacting Canada but many countries across in the western world. 

 We are desperately trying to mobilize and continue to have meaningful and important panel discussions to raise awareness on this important issue of our times. I suffered not only personal financial losses but being the target of hateful comments on social platforms. I carry on because I believe something very profound is at stake. As my mentor says " the price you pay when you don't speak up is worse than the price you pay when you speak up. I would be lying if I said I wasn't distraught at the recent turn of events, but, I am delighted at the number of emails of support I have received.  I will not give up, nor should any of you. I am going to reorganize and hold a much larger event, with a much larger venue, and a lot more security. These financial contributions give me the ability and capacity to book a much larger venue, hire more security, and pay for further talks.  The free speech event will still have Dr. Jordan Peterson, Dr. Gad Saad and Dr. Oren Amitay. 

Remainder funds are going to be used to organize another panel discussion critiquing the feminist movement and its devastating impact on men who are involved in custody/access cases. I know a lot about this issue from my 8 years as a child welfare worker and can tell you the system is heavily biased towards women.  The process is underway...

In a time of universal deceit - telling the truth is a revolutionary act. Orwell.

story:
Donate to RoboTex Robotics 

Robotex is a Christian homeschool team competing in BEST(Boosting Engineering Science and Technology) . RoboTex Robotics competes in the BEST competition of the Cowtown Hub. Part of the competition is raising funds to design and build our robot, show booth, and a practice field for the robot. when you donate you are helping us raise the funds to buy all the materials needed to complete these projects. If you donate a certain amount to RoboTex you will get your business logo on the t-shirt and possibly other places depending on your donation. Your contribution to the RoboTex team will not go unnoticed, thank you.

story:
Contact Details

Twitter: @Blueskyyes

Facebook: Merlyn.Dunn7

Email: merlied@gmail.com

Instagram: Merlyblues 


What is your campaign about? 

My campaign is aimed at raising capital for my studies at the William Esper Studio in New York.

Indicate the amount of funding that you are applying for?

50000 us dollars

Why the amount?

The amount will cover the tuition fees for two years which is 20000 dollars a year and assist with living expenses

Is this your only initiative?

No, I have applied to several funding organisations and am currently savings towards my studies.  

If you don’t meet your target what impact does this have for you?

I will not be able to study at the Studio. My savings do not cover most of my expenses.

Currently the exchange is not favourable for South Africans, 1 dollar = 16 rands.


Give reasons why you should be funded instead of other campaigns

Initially when I started the campaign my focus was on my needs and what I wanted to achieve, however as I began to appeal for assistance on social media the positive responses have taught me about community, shared ideas, reciprocity and inspiration. There is a community of people who want you to succeed and have taught me about paying it forward. This has made me offer more service to others. I fund campaigns that are focused on personal development. I have learnt the need for a strong team to share ideas and build a strong brand. Not all strategies are going to be successful and a team of people sharing ideas can help realign your strategies. Reciprocity has been the biggest lesson I have learnt. In order to receive you have to give, and giving comes in all forms. In order to succeed you have to create mutually beneficial relationships. I have been humbled and inspired by all the shares my campaign has received thus far and this has only made me work harder to achieve my goal. For an ordinary South African female to be able to study abroad will have a chain effect in inspiring others to overcome their fears and follow their dreams. In order to inspire others you have to walk the walk and talk the talk and I believe I can achieve that.  Starting this campaign has definitely made me a better person and I’m constantly looking for ways to align my strategies with being of service to others. By the end of this campaign I hope to learn how to be better at paying it forward to others.


How will you pay it forward

My goal it to be able to open a drama studio at the Mangete Primary School in South Africa.  The school is close to my heart because I attended this school as a little girl and all our drama events took place at a community hall which was later burnt down. 


Give us any other additional information that you may want to bring to our attention

My perks include the donation of my time and service to the Nokhuphila School in Midrand website address (http://www.nokuphila.co.za/get_involved.html) and service to a non-profit theatre organisation for kids.  Pictures and video clips of  will be posted. Should you not be in a position to financially support my campaign however you would like to assist please share the post with your network . Any effort will be graciously received.

story:
Hi Everyone,
Thank you for checking out my campaign, your interest is really appreciated.
Where to begin?

My name is Simon Hughes, I am currently a student at University studying a Bachelors in Comic Art, this is a subject that I have been passionate about my entire life and was overjoyed to be able to pursue as a field of Study. With the final year upon me I began searching for ways to further myself even more. I decided pretty quickly that I would like to pursue a career in Teaching Comics/Art at higher education level. Through my research it became apparent to me that I would benefit from furthering my education to a higher standard before pursuing my career as a teacher. As a result I applied for a handful of related subjects at a masters level including subjects hosted within other countries, to my delight I was accepted onto the MFA in Comics at the California College of Arts!

What do I do?

I write comics, specifically Fantasy/Sci-Fi stories. I am working on my on-going series , Paradise Lost, a series that focuses on the fallen Angel, Lucifer as he attempts to return to heaven and a small group of humans who were born with unique abilities to oppose him. The series currently stands at 2 chapters including the 6 page prologue, with the 3rd chapter about to be completed in the coming month.

What I need

  • the total cost of a years tuition is £29,724
  • If I can raise £14,862 to pay tuition for the first semester and come back to the U.K studying the following 2 semesters remotely.
  • If I can raise the entire £29,724 I will be able to remain in the US for study for the entire year.

What do you Get?

  • I have created several perks for this campaign for £10 you can get a digital copy of the first chapter of Paradise lost, ending with the top perk of you becoming a recurring character in the series with your character being a core player within the story arc!
  • Don't Worry! Even if the full campaign isn't realized everyone will still receive their perks as this is an ongoing project that I will be completing regardless of the campaigns outcome

Any Contribution you can make will be a HUGE help to me as an Comics Creator and and Personally, I am forever grateful for any donation big or small. Please feel free to check out my Facebook page (Simon Hughes - Comic Artist and Illustrator) where I will be posting weekly updates about my progress with this campaign and any other avenues I explore.

I understand that not everyone who views this Campaign can afford to donate, but by sharing this page to others via Facebook, twitter and other social media platforms you can still help out the campaign,and help me achieve my goal, Thank you So much for taking the time to check out my campaign and for all your help and support! It means the world to me.

Best Wishes and thanks again!

Simon
